description:
Dish: Pad Thai
Cost: $13.95
Rating: 4.75/5
Review: I loveeee thai food and my favorite dish to order is usually Pad Thai.  Of all the Thai restaurants I've been to so far, I'd have to say this spot serves the tastiest pad thai! I've only been here and ordered this once so I really hope it wasn't just a good day for them cause I plan to keep going back. It was really packed for lunch time on a weekday so I assume they're a pretty good restaurant overall. The pad Thai was sweet and flavorful and not dry! Cooked well even when it was a full house. They give a pretty decent portion size but it is pretty pricey for what it is. I'll definitely be back to order this again and also try other dishes! 

Giving this spot only 4 stars because they messed up on 2 of my friends' orders and the waitress rolled her eyes and tried to make them feel like they told her the wrong orders. I clearly heard their order but the waitress must have been too busy to try to make sure she got their order right.

Came on a Friday during lunch at 11:45am and it was pretty much packed already if I didn't make reservations. Passed by on weekend nights and it's usually packed so I suggest making reservations! Parking can be a bit difficult.
author: Valerie T.

description:
Had an early dinner at Basil Thai and decided to order the pad kee mao. It was absolutely delicious! Noodles were cooked perfectly and the sauce wasn't too heavy. The vegetables and beef were cooked well and weren't just sparsely thrown around into the dish.

Friend ordered the indian pancake and upon first sight, it looked pretty good. The taste, on the other hand, didn't turn out to par - the pancake was a bit too light and oily for my liking. Takes the cake for presentation though!

Overall was a good experience as the food was satisfactory and ambiance was beautiful. Don't know if I would go out of my way to come back but I certainly wouldn't mind if I did.
author: Isabelle W.

description:
Came here on Saturday night before a show starting at 8pm. When I arrived at 6pm, it was just starting to get busy. Luckily, I had made a reservation the day before and was seated immediately.

Upon sitting down, our waitress came by with waters and asked if we wanted anything to drink. The drink menu was expansive enough - I ordered a beer and my friend ordered a mojito. The serving size for the mojito was generous.

We ordered Kao Pode Tod to start, which was delicious. For the entrees, we ordered Pad Ke-Mao and the Jungle Beef - both of which satisfied our hunger. For dessert, we got the mango sticky rice, which again did not let us down. 

I would come back here again!
author: Daniel K.

description:
Made a reservation on yelp which was super easy!

We were seated right away and our dishes were all great.  We especially liked the Choo Chee Pla (grilled salmon with asparagus & cauliflower in choo cheee curry).  Salmon was grilled perfectly and the yellow curry was really flavorful.  Gai Pik Khing (crispy chicken, string beans and bell peppers) was good.  Veggie pai thai was good too.

I ordered Thai ice tea but it never came so I reminded them that I never got it when we were half way through dinner.  They brought one out very soon.  When we got the bill, they charged us for 2 Thai ice teas.  I caught it and they corrected the bill for us.  Check your bill carefully!

Other than this minor hiccup, the evening was great and I'd come back to Basil Thai.
author: Susan C.

description: The restaurant is nice with good amount of seating. I used yelp reservations to reserve a table for lunch since it get filled up very fast. They don't have a lot of vegetarian dishes to try which is very unlike for a Thai restaurant. The quantity of food is very good. I tried a lunch menu vegetarian curry and it was very spicy.
author: Bhawna J.

description:
Been here a couple times now and while my first experience didn't live up the hype the second one was solid. 

I came here with a friend who always came for here dinner and not lunch. He found out quick that their dinner and lunch menus were very different. I had even looked over their menu online to see what they served but it really was nothing like what we were handed when we sat down.

My friend ordered the Spicy Basil w/Chicken and I went with the Sweet and Sour Lover w/ Chicken. We also decided to go with the Chicken Fried Rice instead of the normal steamed rice. 

While my food was decent, he wasn't much of a fan of his. I think that had alot to do with his expectation of it being similar to the dinner dish he normally orders, unfortunately for him it wasn't the case. The fried rice was also ok. Overall, everything really lacked spice for me, from the soup to the fried rice nothing had any sort for spice or seasoning. With that said I would like to come back because I feel that if I tell them to spice my order up it would make a huge difference. Will be back one day.
author: Harman B.

description:
The food was really good, ambience was nice, I'd give 5 stars for the food but unfortunately 2 stars for service. Thats a bummer.

Location is great. The seats are not the most comfortable, but the food makes up for it. The portions are really big. We got the chicken yellow curry and pineapple fried rice.

The fried banana ice cream was also really tasty, although I wish it came with an option of vanilla instead of coconut ice cream.

Suggestion to owner: please work on the service and you'll find me coming back here!
author: Arjan N.

description:
We waited at the table for 10 plus minutes and nobody came to take our order.  The server that we summoned was really confused and asked whether someone had taken our order.  Upon learning about the wait time, she simply said "let's do it now" and took the order in vexation.  She ended up forgetting one of the drinks and we had to place another order in with another guy, who also failed to place the order.

Shrimp chips:  complimentary app from the restaurant.  Wish the waiter could have told us that after dumping it off at the table and took off without saying anything.

Papaya salad:  solid.  Tart and spicy.  Strong flavors of fish sauce and lime.  

Stuffed eggplant with green curry:  interesting idea wrapping minced chicken with eggplant.  Texture's interesting and all but nothing special in terms of flavor as chicken was somewhat tasteless.  Green curry however was well balanced in terms of sweetness and savoriness.  Not too heavy nor too sweet.

Pad Ke-moo:  the spicy wide noodles lacked the heat as promised in the title. The skirt steak slices felt like they were boiled in water dumping into the plate with the rest of the greens and noodles.  

After receiving the check, from the same girl that placed the order earlier, a credit card was placed in the plastic card slot.  Another ten minutes went by before we got her attention and she looked at us confused and frozen solid like a deer staring at the headlights of a vehicle.  Took her a minute or two before figuring out what she missed.  Opened the plastic folder and looked back at us saying "So.... you done?".
author: Ken L.

description:
The original intent was to dine at the ramen place next door but they had a line so we came here instead. I wish we had driven away to another place but sigh. 

We ordered the roti appetizer which was good , some bean cake entree which was average and the pad thai . We asked to make the pad thai vegetarian, however when it arrived it had a super strong smell of fish sauce. We asked if we could return it and the waitress was super rude, fighting with us about how there was no fish sauce in the dish. I didn't know why they were so worked up, i thought they would offer to change it or be nice enough to take it back and not fuss so excessively. I am aware that a lot of thai entrees are made with fish sauce but I have never found it so unbearable before. I wouldn't recommend this place to vegetarians. There are many many more places in SF with amazing food and polite service.
author: Anju J.

description:
Came here alone for a weekday lunch after getting fingerprinted at the store down the street. I was seated immediately at a small table and I ordered a Thai Tea and a veggie Pad See Ew (My go-to for Thai restaurants). The waitress asked if I would like it with coconut cream and I said yes because - why not? I've never had my Thai tea served with coconut cream before. It was interesting. I'm not sure if I would want my Thai tea that way all the time but I didn't hate it and once in a while owuld be nice.

It took a bit for my Pad See Ew to arrive, but when it arrived, it didn't disappoint. It was saucy and the noodles were soft. There were an array of vegetables. I would definitely come back and try the other dishes. Solid Thai place if I were ever in SOMA again.
author: Judy H.

description: Decent Thai place that is a good spot for a pre-show meal. Good flavor and fast service, and definitely a busy spot even on a weeknight. However for price and quality, I've had much better Thai food elsewhere in the city so I won't be back. Glad we came for happy hour where appetizers were $6.50 instead of full price.
author: Tu-Quyen P.

description:
This is one of the best Thai restaurants I have been to in a while in terms of food.
We took the Yellow curry, pineapple fried rice and beef red curry. All the dishes were delicious.
The best was the dessert, friend banana and ice cream.
Good ambience too! Service could be slightly better.
author: Japna C.

description:
Came here for dinner to celebrate a girlfriends birthday.

We were seated at a large table in the back of the restaurant. The food was ordered before I arrived but I tried the pumpkin curry and pad thai. Very good, but honestly, I think it's hard to mess up pad thai.

I really like the ambiance and environment, perfect for a date night or a group gathering.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Every Thai restaurant I go to, I get exceptional service and Basil Thai is no exception. The servers are very attentive and the restaurant itself has a nice, calm atmosphere. My friend and I got the mild chicken curry with potatoes as well as the spicy pad see ew (not sure if I spelled that right). The noodles were flavorful and not too oily. As for the curry, I would have wished the potatoes were cooked a little longer (not enough moosh to them). Overall, I enjoyed my meal! Portions are large so don't order too much~*

PS: They have brown rice
author: Sui N.

description:
My friend and I decided to come here due to the great reviews and the proximity Civic Center bart. 
From the moment we walked in, we could tell this was a cute date spot! there were candles in the middle of each table. The menu is super diverse, and it has most of the items you'd see in any other Thai Place. 

The reason for my 4 start instead of 5, is that I thought our food wasn't cooked thoroughly. My vegetables were fresh, but pretty hard I have to admit :( 

Other than that, the service was good, and the food was pretty good! I would recommend.
author: Elisa R.

description:
The pad Thai and mojito were very good! I get pad Thai often and this one is up there in top pad Thais I've had. 
The pan fried potstickers were way too fried, bf and I didn't eat them. We often order the same thing elsewhere and never had it so fried. He said his chicken cashew nut stir fry was alright.  

Slow service but that's ok. Relatively full of patrons on Tuesday night, but no need to wait for a table. 

Decently zen ambience with low, chill tunes.
author: Victoria M.

description:
Came here on Friday night after some natural wine at Terroir (love). It was completely packed/ honestly a little hectic with how the hostess was noting parties. I had little confidence she would remember us/ seating was a little Wild Wild West for my liking. This could have also been to my hangry state (to everyone's dismay). 

We ended up spotting some seats at the bar and quickly pulled up seats. Side note, the bartender did not acknowledge us for at least 10 minutes (but it felt like 30, again, hangry).

We eventually put in food orders and moods were improved all around. We had some mild food allergies (peanuts and bell peppers) among the group and I was pleasantly surprised how easily they accommodated this/ were able to remove from our dishes of choice (even more impressed Bc this meant things were being prepped to order). 

Meal was good, my favorites were the fresh rolls and eggplant and shiitake dish. Would pass on the coconut braised pork shoulder curry which was a bit disappointing, I found the meat tough. 

All in all, probably would not go out of my way to return, but if you find yourself in the area this is a solid choice for elevated Thai. Trendy atmosphere and full bar are an added bonus.
author: Adele T.

description:
This is a trendy Thai restaurant that would be a good venue for a casual date or meet up with a few friends. The food and drinks are definitely higher quality and the flavors are on point. That being said, it is a bit on the pricey end for what it is. Granted this is SF but having spent so much time in Southeast Asia, it is hard to wrap my head around the enormous difference in price.

Despite the price, I have been to Basil twice already mainly due to the authenticity of flavors. Thai food in the United States tends to be towards the sweeter side while actual Thai food is a combination of tart, fresh, spicy and savory. I think Basil delivers on this well.
author: Joan S.

description:
This review is for the service. I (a very nicely dressed woman) asked to charge my phone for two minutes so I could call a Lyft and wouldn't have to walk home. There were 3 tables in the whole place occupied and the host told me No.

How rude.

Karma dude, watch out for it.
author: Lisa P.

description: Had dinner here tonight as a party of four. A waitress tripped and spilled sauce all over my dry clean only shirt. Totally understand that things happen by accident - but there was no action taken by the restaurant to remedy this. Very disappointed in the level of service after such an incident. I think that the very least the could have done was comp my dish, provide a free dessert - literally anything to have made me feel better about the situation. Won't be coming back.
author: Vivian C.

description:
Came here with a friend last month when I was in the city, after a long day walking around town and seeing the sights. We were excited to try it, as my friend had had it bookmarked for a while, and we were absolutely not disappointed!

Usually when I go to Thai places I end up defaulting to either the pad thai or the pad see ew, but I'm really happy that we tried some of the less common entrees because they were both delicious. The praram rong song (grilled marinated skirt steak with house curried-peanut sauce and steamed vegetables) was tender and delicious, especially with the peanut sauce, and the kang gari gai (slow-cook 1/2 chicken, onions, & potatoes in mild yellow curry) was fall off the bone delicious and perfect after a chilly December day in San Francisco.

Dinner prices are extremely reasonable, especially considering we had enough of each entree to take home for leftovers. Service was excellent and the inside of the place is small but elegant. Would love to come back here again the next time I'm in the city.
author: Lucy M.

description: Popular restaurant during lunch hour and it can get pretty loud. Had the squid salad for $13.95 -- squid was pretty tasty, didn't taste frozen. Salad felt very clean and light -- good item if you're trying to order something healthy for lunch. Wait staff also try to be attentive. A little pricey overall but maybe for the area, this is standard. Parking can be slightly challenging, especially with all the one way streets and left hand metered parking. The overall area is about 3 grimacing faces:
author: Cathrin P C.

description:
Shared a couple dishes with the coworkers for dinner tonight! We got the radish cakes, corn fritters, pumpkin pork red curry, and fried catfish. My overall impressions were that the food was on the oily side (this is perhaps we ordered fried things only) and that the herbs they used stood out compared to other Thai spots I've been to.

The radish cakes were basically like Chinese ones, except without the mushroom and sausage that are in the Chinese version. I didn't like that they were so fried, but my coworkers did. A 3/5 for me.

The corn fritters may not have been as crunchy as they could have since we got delivery. They were floury and the corn was more broken up. Tasty, but not too memorable.

The pumpkin pork red curry had a strong coconut base. The pork was of the solid variety, but fell apart easily when poked with a fork. The pumpkin could have been a bit more soft. A 3.5/5 on this.

The catfish was also breaded and fried, but felt too covered in breadcrumbs for my liking. Good flavor though. The eggplant in the dish was cooked well. A 3.3/5 for this. 

Overall, a solid 3.3 for me! It wasn't the taste that was missing as much as the oiliness / fried-ness. I would come back to try less fried dishes!
author: Nicole H.

description: Great meal. They have these yummy, crispy chips they give you as an appetizer that we couldn't get enough of. We had a big party so ordered across the menu - soup, chow mein and chow fun, seafood dishes, beef dishes and curry dishes, and we devoured it all. The food was really tasty, not too spicy, and the ambiance was enjoyable. The wait staff had a hard time understanding simple things like hot sauce, jalapeno in vinegar (they brought us a spoon), but other than that, all good and very delicious. I would definitely come again!
author: Alex K.

description:
Ordered the Pad Kee Mao from here as part of a Postmates order and it was decent. It came with beef and there were a variety of vegetables. The noodles were mostly pretty well cooked too, there weren't any overly broken pieces.

The drawback was that it needed a little bit more spiciness, the beef was kind of dry in some parts, and I feel I have had better for the price.

A few notes though, they forgot to provide any utensils with the order which kind of sucked.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Fabulous tom kha soup and beef curry. very fast for take out orders. but can be a bit crowded to eat-in and a bit of a wait. However the service is solid and very professional and polite.

Part of me wishes this place redesigned to be more of a 'date' spot. Part of me wishes it did post-bars take-out food. Part of me wishes it had more tables for large groups. but being right in the middle of these in SoMa seems to work well for Basil Thai.
author: Mike V.

description:
Good place for big parties, but not authentic Thai food. 

I dined here for a friends birthday. We had to a set menu - two appetizers, 5 entrees, and one dessert. Portions were small (there wasn't enough chicken satay for everyone). $25/person plus tax and tip, expensive for the amount of food I ate. 

Ambiance was quiet and nice. There's a bar up front for some alcohol if you so choose.
author: Angela T.

description:
Basil Thai is the best! The pad Ke-mao is perfect! The spring rolls, curry, everything! Is so good. The service was quick and the best thing about it is the consistency. That's what keeps us coming back. 

Trustworthy!!! Also, I forgot my phone there right before they were closing and when I realized it - they were closed but I called and they said they had it and waited for me to come pick it up! Nothing to do with food but everything to do with customer service and going above and beyond for their guest. Which says a lot about a restaurant!
author: T B.

description: Yum. Food was excellent. Could have done without the PDA from the cop from YMCA and his husband, but I'm sure they're not there all the time. It is San Francisco, but c'mon fellas, you're in public. Leather and PDA are fine in moderation, leave the heavy petting for private time. Not appropriate. Food probably would be acceptable for second tasting, but thankfully we were satiated and left before the fellas made us ill. Food was awesome. Heavy PDA, gay or straight, not awesome.
author: Dave F.

description:
This place had delicious food, and some good appetizer and drink deals for happy hour! 

I would recommend the curry puff appetizer, pumpkin curry, and the crab fried rice. The mojito was also good.

The Thai spiced corn fritter appetizers were fine, but didn't have as much flavor as I was expecting.
author: Elena K.

description: I'm so glad I found a solid Thai restaurant near my house! I have been finding food in SF to be generally overrated...This place is a cute Thai restaurant in Soma and it was pretty easy to get a reservation on Friday night.  I had the fried tofu to start (definitely big enough to share between 2-3 people), which was pretty good, considering I'm not a big tofu fan.  For my main, I ordered the minced chicken stir-fried with eggplant, bell peppers, basil, and Thai bird's eye chili with brown rice.  This was excellent and a big enough portion that I had another meal of it the next day! To drink, I had a cocktail with tequila in it, which was also delicious! I'm only docking a star because service was very slow and spotty, but maybe it's because it was a Friday night.
author: Arthi N.

description: If you are in the Civic Center area and are looking for a quick walk down  over to Folsom I would say: "find yourself a seat asap at Basil Thai Restaurant & Bar". The food and service was quick and excellent! Highly recommend the Pan-fried Indian bread (roti) with eggplant/green curry. Yes the eggplant and fluffy roti were so worth it and the green curry was just spicy enough to make you want more! My co-worker and I each orders a lunch entree (gai gra prao + panang short ribs) and yes they were both the bomb! The Gai Gra was spicy and a healthy portion and I loved the addition of eggplant with the chicken as it made a great pairing. All 3 things came out around $40 which isn't bad for a lunch date and all in all I will be coming back to try some more!
author: Ankita C.

description:
Came here with coworkers. There's a bunch of us so they enforced a set menu family style which apparently has half vegetarian items. The problem is... These people consider fish sauce vegetarian?! And when you order vegetarian they'll automatically assume you are the kind of vegetarian who's ok with fish sauce???!!!

We only found out about this because I'm vegan and they were clear to me that a curry was vegetarian but not vegan.... At least they knew what's vegan.
author: Rao L.

description: I've been here a few times now, and while the food is consistently good, the service is lacking. My most recent visit was on a weekday, for dinner with a friend. We shared the fried lemongrass wings to start, and wok-fried lamb and crab fried rice as the mains. There were also a couple of cocktails ;) The food was all great... when we were finally able to order it. What I mean is that it was very difficult to get the attention of our server to order, order more (i.e., drinks, or even just water), get the bill, and pay the real. Really, it took so unacceptably long (considering it wasn't even that busy at that time of night) and she didn't even apologize when she finally came to the table. In the end, we ended up just asking another server for things, since she was way more attentive and helpful. So, while the food was good, the experience with the service was really irritating so it'll be a while before I want to return here since there are still other good restaurants in the neighbourhood to dine at.
author: Bianca C.

description: This place is great.  Always full of people but usually quick to get a table without a reservation.  As far as food goes: vegetable rolls, pad thai, chicken, shrimp, and green/red curry dishes are all great.
author: Rita K.

description: We were in the area and tried this place for the first time. The food was surprisingly good, though service could be improved. They weren't full, yet it was a bit hard to get their attention. However, for the food, we'll come back if in the area again.
author: yummy A.

description:
Great service. We were meeting friends from out of town and weren't happy with a corner table near the restrooms. They promptly changed it to a good window table.

Awesome food and good cocktails too, especially the mango one. The fish green curry was delicious. Would definitely recommend and return.
author: Peri A.

description: Excellent Thai food, especially the minced chicken with eggplant and basil. Service was good as well.
author: Tina C.

description: Rude costumer service. Had reservation at 7pm. My girls were late. Got it. But at least sit me down? Gave my table away. Ignore me until my parties arrived. I noticed people were late for a party of nine? N they okay it. Food was okay. Would only go if I am around and super hungry.
author: Mai X.

description: Very good Thai food. Good vegetarian options. I especially loved the pad Thai but everything we ordered was delicious.
author: Namrata J.

description:
I ordered the green curry here. Nice flavor and overall texture. The vegetables were well-cooked. 

There's a counter bar in the restaurant. The bartender looked like she knew what she was doing, but who knows. I mean, in this culture of fake-it-tell-you-make-it, you never know.

The layout is actually a bit strange but seems to work. Location of the restaurant, not so nice. Inside is pretty clean. I'd def come again.
author: Juliana P.

description:
Came here last week before seeing a dj at 1015 Folsom. Perfect spot for dinner and drinks and within walking distance (few blocks) of 1015 Folsom. Great selection of food items on menu, including vegan options (major plus).

Food 5/5
-Jungle Beef: amazing! Very generous portion. Recommend this with brown rice. So yummy! Brought leftovers home and still tasted good after 2 days.
-Fried Banana: great for sharing! So many pieces, enough to split between our party of four

Drinks 4/5
Mango Cosmo: must get if you like sweet and fruity!
Old fashioned: decent but wouldn't recommend.
Manhatten: say yass to bourbon! you won't regret this.

Service (4/5): pretty fast at the start but once the crowd comes in, waiter left us hanging for a bit when we asked for more drinks. We didn't receive waters throughout our meal and we're unsure of this was customary??? Also, we requested for 2 separate checks at the beginning of dinner, however, they were unable to do it at the end.

Beware: language barrier is there so be patient with the waiters.

Overall: would definitely come back to try more food items and drinks!
author: May A.

description: Went during lunchtime with coworkers. Cute interior, modern clean lines. I love the cement bar top! Food was fresh and delicious, however if you are in a hurry or have limited time time don't come here. Plan on coming when you have time to chat and maybe indulge in a cocktail before your meal. Service is friendly and attentive, it just takes a while for the food to come. I will definitely come back for dinner. I had the fresh spring roll pictured.
author: Daisy G.

description:
My friends and I were around Market street after the pride parade and decided to go to this place after reading the yelp reviews. We were starving and were looking forward to eat at the place.

We ordered the spring rolls, Mojito and rum thai to start of with. The Rum thai had very little Malibu or rum and tasted like ice water after the first two sips. The same goes with the Mojito. 

They offered us Shrimp chips(with exactly 4 chips to be shared about 3 people)  which was on the house. We decided to ask for more and the owner ( who was serving us) did bring it to us but, did not mention that we will be charged for it. At the end of our meal we were really bummed that she did not mention it to us upon seeing 7$ for a few shrimp chips on our bill. 

The other entrees we tried were the Crispy chicken and crab fried rice. They are okay and I would definitely give this place a pass and never give it a try even if I am around the block. 

This is just my honest and personal experience. Thanks !
author: Aparna G.

description: Basil was a nice intimate dinner spot. As quick as you'd like. With many options for beginners, experts and spice lovers.
author: Joe W.

description: They have a large menu with items not usually seen at other Thai restaurants. We tried the BBQ chicken with papaya salad and the seafood garlic noodles, and both were really tasty. We also had the mango sticky rice, which was decent. (If you're craving that dessert, Marnee Thai's is much better!) The ambiance and location are nice, but the service could use some improvement. They never refilled our waters even though we asked, and they combined our leftovers into one box. That was weird and a bit upsetting since we expected them to use two boxes to keep the flavors separate.
author: First L.

description: Stopped in for a quick bite making our way through to Napa from the airport. The service was excellent as was the atmosphere. The food however was amazing. I had vegetable pad Thai extra Spivey and my coworker had chicken pad Thai. Highly recommend!
author: Amanda U.

description: This place is awesome! The place is located on Folsom st and what a gem! The place is rather small but we had no problem getting a table for a party of 6! (Make sure to reserve a table ahead of time). The customer service is great and super duper fast! We got our drink orders take quickly and not long after our food order was taken. We waited a maximum of 15-20 minutes for our food to be ready (mind you for 6 people). The food was amazing and it was nicely placed on the plate (which I always appreciate). Everything tasted amazing. The place itself was cozy and had a modern vibe to it. I will defiantly be coming back to this place again! Very happy costumer!
author: Anne R.

description: This is my favorite Thai food restaurant in the city. The price is average (~$13-18 per dish), but the quality is outstanding. The seafood dishes stand out, including the tiger prawns and spicy friend catfish. They also have a wide assortment of unique dishes and curries and every dish we have ordered has been spot on. The restaurant is usually busy in the evenings on the weekends or as the weekend approaches, but it's never too hard to find a table nor have I ever experienced a large wait. If you have a large party though, it may be worth calling ahead. Overall, Basil Thai is wonderful!
author: Harshith A.

description:
Attractive inside, delicious Thai food and such a great thai iced tea! I ordered the pad see ew which was tasty (though slightly salty). You get a choice of coconut milk or cream for the Thai iced tea - go with the coconut milk! So yummy.

It gets crowded and noisy during peak lunch times, so I recommend going before or after the rush if you want to have a conversation.
author: Apple P.

description:
I have come here three times already, each time hoping my negative opinion about this restaurant gets less negative, but each time, I come to the realization that their cuisine is one of the worst I have ever had.

This is one of the worst, most overrated Thai restaurants in Northern California. Not only their food is extremely bland and simplistic, but their customer service is subpar. They are rude, inconsiderate, and quite unacquainted with the culture of the city. But the worst part of it all is the food quality.

The reason why they have a steady clientele is their bar and their location: their clientele are white collar workers whose offices are in the vicinity, so it is a convenient place for them to have a meal and some drinks after work--or before going back to work.
author: Raymond F.

description: COCKROACHES!!! There were roaches in the restaurant and the servers pretended like they didn't notice when we pointed them out. On top of that there are was bad service and mediocre food. Stay away!!!
author: Bobby M.

description:
Came here for two birthday parties. Basil Thai is very spacious and has a lot of big tables for large parties! We had about 13 people each time.

The food is very good and the portions seem right for the price. However, I was a little shocked that most of the curries did not come with rice! I'm not sure if that's the authentic way of eating curry, but I always thought rice would be included. 

I tried the crab fried rice, pineapple fried rice, grilled vegetables (egg plant, zucchini, bell peppers, mushrooms) in green curry, as well as some other classic noodle dishes. The flavors were great and my friends and I were able to share and enjoy the meal family-style.

We also asked the servers to cut up a cake for us, and they charged us a cake-cutting fee, which I guess isn't too surprising. The restaurant also got really warm and stuffy by the end of our meal, and at the peak of its heat, the servers came by and put multiple candles on our table. I get that they were trying to create a nice ambiance, but I would rather have had them increase the overhead lights a little bit instead.

Overall, the service was good and we all had a good time!
author: Hanna K.

description:
Ordered the pad thai and the coconut soup. Both were outstanding. I've had pad thai a million times but this is definitely by far the best I've ever had. Not even really sure how to describe it but there was a clear difference in taste between this place and any ordinary Thai restaurant. The coconut soup was yummy too. It had the sweet brothy flavor but with a tangy kick in the end. Very good! I also really enjoyed the ambience here. It had a nice cozy and classy vibe. 

The food and overall experience I had at this restaurant has lived up to its standards!
author: Annie H.

description: The pad Thai was good but the service was pretty dismal. I had my food and waited over 5 minutes for utensils (after I asked 2 people) and 15 minutes for water. It was strange, just because I was in workout clothes maybe they were ignoring me?
author: Christine L.

description: This is the best Thai food I've had in the city. Flavors and presentation are on point. My only wish is that the food were a little bit spicier.
author: Eric H.

description: I have eaten numerous times at Basil Thai and have really enjoyed the food and service. Yesterday I ordered food via their contracted delivery service, and the food was completely different. The pineapple fried rice was gummy, had very little flavor and was extremely greasy. There was very little flavor in the cucumber salad. Big disappointment this time; however, I may return in person one day (after my upset stomach settles), and see if the food is any better.
author: Tyree R.

description: My review is for a catering order to our recent event at work. My coworker had ordered  pad Thai with chicken and two gravy dishes for vegetarians with 50 rice orders. All we got was pad Thai with shrimps and tofu( who does that blunder) and rice looked like sufficient for not even 5 people. I do not think they honoured our entire order. Food was good but do not mess up with orders.
author: Neo R.

description:
came here for dinner the other night with a group of friends and it hit the spot.  they're portions are generous for individual plates and the price is right for the amount of food you get.

I had the spicy crispy catfish, but it wasn't very crispy as the sauce had made its way through the crispy batter.  nonetheless, it was still delicious with just the right amount of heat that was not too overbearing.

the pineapple fried rice plate was huge. it had a good amount of shrimp and pineapples.  loved it!  probably one of the best Thai places in the city.
author: Roger K.

description:
Great food!  Service was good but had a little attitude, in the beginning, with our large party even though we had reservations.  I recommend the coconut/sesame crusted sweet potato, way better than the standard fried sweet potatoes, very light and tasty. Corn fritters with cucumber salad is a must. Tamarind prawns had good flavor but too much bell peppers. I would definitely reorder the stuffed eggplant, duck with snap peas and Pad se-ew but the best was the pork belly with Chinese broccoli.  PB was crispy on the outside and perfect in the middle, broccoli wasn't overcooked.  I would pass on the pad Thai, thought it was too bland. 

I will definitely return here when I'm in the area.
author: Sally S.

description:
If you don't want to read a long review, my summary is that the service sucks and the food is pricy, but the food is pretty good. Now, for the details:

I made a reservation for 10 through Yelp for a friend's birthday. I called to let them know 45 minutes in advance that a few of us were running late because of the pride parade street closures. 5 of us got there at 6, and 5 of us got there at 6:15pm. No one came to greet us or offer to take our order until we walked over ourselves to ask someone to take our order. By this time, it was 6:35pm, and the waitress said we missed happy hour. We told her that no one came to take our order. She spoke with the manager and the manager was very rude and unapologetic and told us that she would only let us have 2 drinks at the happy hour price. Let me remind you that there are 10 of us here to celebrate a birthday. Because we were on a schedule, we couldn't walk out although I really wanted to. 

After placing our order, the food took forever to come out. We had also brought a cake, and there was a $2 per person cake cutting fee. While waiting for the check (which had to be fixed because she ended up not giving us the 2 drinks on happy hour is course), one of my friends was on a juicing cleanse and had her meal in a Mason jar (she was not drinking it at the restaurant but took it out of her purse and placed on the ground to make sure it didn't spill), but  accidentally kicked it over breaking it. The manager heard the commotion of us trying to gather the glass and ran over. We thought she was concerned about the glass, but she was more concerned that it was a Mason jar. She essentially scolded us saying they do not allow outside beverages. I apologized and told her that it was an accident, and it was clearly full meaning she hadn't been drinking it in the restaurant. The manager just continued giving us dirty looks even though we were genuinely trying to help clean up and felt bad about the mess. 

All in all, the only saving Grace was that the food was pretty good. We were there for more than 2 hours, not by choice but because of the slow service, the bill was over $300, and the customer service was terrible. We tried to make the best of it for our friend's birthday and didn't want to make a big deal, but most of us were very upset about how much we had to pay and how poorly we were treated. I will never come back here again and would not recommend large parties unless you want to be disrespected, embarrassed, and treated horribly.
author: Margaret N.

description:
I got the rice, pineapple, cashews, and prawns. Pretty good. 

Wonderful service. 

On the pricier side.
author: Josh M.

description: They messed up my order. After a 30 min wait had to wait another 15 minutes. Food ok,  Nothing special.
author: Johan W.

description: If you are looking for a tasteless, overpriced kinda soup and need a bowels cleanse, this is the place for you. Great service.
author: Ol Y.

description: I am visiting from southwest Florida and I have to admit, there is nothing that even remotely compares to the level of authenticity at this place. I had the vegetables in tamarind sauce and the Indian roti with green curry sauce for an appetizer. Both my meal and the app were amazing. I had the sticky rice with mango and coconut cream sauce for dessert and thought I was in heaven. This place is fabulous and I only wish I had more time in town to come back to try more items. Great selection for vegetarians. Highly recommend. Service was excellent as well.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Good Thai place in the city. Solid 3.5 stars. 

We went to this place with a few friends for dinner on a Sunday night. It was easy to call ahead and get a reservation and they also allow reservations through the Yelp app. So that helps knowing that you will not have to wait too long. We were seated instantly upon our arrival, which was a good start to the dinner. 

The complimentary shrimp chips were also nice. Who does not like something free to munch on while you wait for food... I love it.

We ordered the Crab Fried Rice, Pad Ke-mao (wide noodles which at many places is called drunken noodles and is one of the things that I use to judge the level of the Thai food of the restaurant) and Kang Gari Gai (slow cooked half chicken). We ended up making two orders of Pad ke-mao as we did not realize it was with beef as a default and had to order the chicken version also as our friends did not have beef. Out of the three entrees we ordered I liked the Crab Fried rice and Half Chicken the most. The Pad ke-mao was fine but could have been a little more spicy and tastier. But, the half chicken was the dish that I was impressed by the most. Well cooked, tender and juicy with good flavors of the yellow curry. It was a solid dish along with the Crab Fried rice. I had the Thai Ice tea and it was good but I wanted it to be a little sweeter. 

Overall a good experience and I would go again if I am in the area.
author: Nipun S.

description:
If you're craving Thai in SoMa, this is probably one of your best bets.

Got into town for a conference, and was staying in SoMa. Tired and hungry, I decided to look up places to get take out from. On a Sunday, places tend to be closed, but Basil Thai was opened and about a half mile from my hotel. I called and was able to order the duck curry with a side a brown rice. Pretty straightforward, although it was hard to hear the waitress on the other end, as the background noise was very loud.

I arrived at the restaurant 30 minutes later, and my food was ready. Note: they don't normally give you utensils (I had to ask for chopsticks and a napkin).

Once I returned to my hotel, I was finally able to try the food! The duck curry was delicious, and I especially enjoyed the chunks of pineapple in it. The portion size of the brown rice paired perfectly with the amount of curry, which I always appreciate. For the price, the food is what I would expect.

Only thing to note is the area around the restaurant can get sketchy in the evening, so I wouldn't walk there like I did if it was dark!
author: Angela C.

description: Pretty good food. We got the red curry and the pad se-ew, which was fantastic except the chicken was overdone. Food took way too long though which is why 4/5
author: Chris X.

description: Super food and nice service! We really enjoyed our datenight here :) we had the crispy chicken en beef curry, both very tasty!
author: Danielle D.
Miko B.

description: I was very impressed with this restaurant in addition to traditional Thai favorites they offered some dishes that were quite creative and delicious.
author: Michael P.

description: My new go-to Thai restaurant. Spacious and comfortable interior, easy street parking, great service from wonderful staff, fantastic menu.
author: Jan Z.

description:
The food was really good. 

The staff was not so great. 

Was not accommodating to our group of 10. 

Would've returned again, and will if the staff is upgraded.
author: Angel K.

description: We enjoyed the food very much but the service was not good. Bartender seemed completely unable to keep up with drink orders. And servers were very slow in providing any service.
author: Phil L.

description:
Came by for dinner before heading to a show at the Orpheum - hands down some of the best Thai food I've ever had, and one of the best meals I've had in the city in a long time!

Must try dishes include the roti with green curry appetizer and the coconut braised pork shoulder in red curry with pumpkin. The roti pancake was perfectly flaky, and the green curry with veggies was flavorful with just amount of spice and crunch for the vegetables. The pork shoulder was also cooked just right, with tons of coconut and curry flavor coming through. 

We also had the pad see ew, stuffed eggplant and banana leaf wrapped sea bass - all of which were full of great flavor and spice. 

Looking forward to an excuse to come back here again!
author: Katie S.

description:
I wish I could give a higher rating, since I did like the food. I've been to a handful of Thai places in the Bay Area and they were all horrible (Osha Thai, Lao Table, Thaiphoon) - to the point that I'd refuse to go out with friends if they wanted Thai. I suppose I'm spoiled since the Thai food in LA is better.

This was the first time I found a Thai restaurant I liked in the Bay Area, and their food is pretty good. Not the best, but solid. We had pad see ew, papaya salad, and the pork curry. I loved the curry - good flavor and the meat was tender. The pad see ew and papaya salad were pretty good - nothing to write home about, but tasty nonetheless.

I'd give Basil Thai a solid 4 in terms of food given the other Thai places I've sampled in the Bay Area, but a 0 in terms of service. We were meeting with a friend there, and she was seated awkwardly in the front of the restaurant when the rest of the patrons were seated in the back, which had a nicer ambiance. I thought she was just waiting in the front so we could see her easily - but it turned out she had already asked for a table in the back and they refused. She even asked twice and they said no both times. What is this, the 1950's in Alabama? 

I understand restaurants want to optimize their seating arrangements (put younger adults / families with kids in the front and couples looking for a quieter dinner in the back), but I've never been to a place that refused to give me a new table when I've asked. My friend's one of the kindest, most positive people I've met, so as the cynic I need to even out the Yelp rating a bit. 4 for food + 0 for service = 2 on average.

Will not return, as I heard Farmhouse Kitchen Thai is better.
author: Larissa M.

description:
The Panang Curry Chicken is a must! They don't have it specifically on their menu, but the servers can guide you through a couple of similar options. Came in a good sharing size - my party of 4 was able to share it along with their pad Thai, pad see ew, and egg rolls (appetizer). 

Everything we ordered was pretty solid and I was happy to see that the portions were more than enough to share. They have a pretty extensive menu so I'd like to come back and try some other things on their menu. :)
author: Esther K.

description: I ordered from Thai Basil in SF using their chosen platform for delivery. They delivered all of the food except for a few items. When we called to get a replacement, no one from the app was able to help so we contacted the restaurant and they ultimately refused to bring us a replacement or a refund. Terrible customer service through their delivery platform. I do not recommend. Just pick up the food on your own. They're too incompetent to handle a three person order.
author: Sara G.

description:
Good place for large parties, but not the best place for a birthday dinner. Not only will they treat your group with no consideration, at all, they will also charge you a "cake cutting fee"....PER SLICE. So, to serve each person at the table a slice of cake (that you bring yourself), it is $2. If it's a party of 11, just to eat the cake you brought, it's an additional $22.  Maybe that's their attempt to tell you NOT to have any parties with cakes at that restaurant.. I don't know!! We were seated by the bathroom, even though we made a reservation like 3-4 day in advance. They shucked us in the corner, and didn't come to refill our water AT ALL, until after the  meal. My friend's thai milk tea, never came, even though we told the waitress like 4-5 times. The other tables seemed to get their massive drink orders promptly, but the ONE thai milk tea at our table was somehow lost in the abyss. Everything we asked for (water, why our food was taking 2-3x longer, menu) required us asking a few times. It's funny though, that when it came to the bill, they were pretty instantaneous. 

Other than the shitty service, the food was pretty good, so one star. My pad kee mao was flavorful. My boyfriend's curry was rich and tasted great and everyone else at the table seemed to enjoy their food... However, I won't be back. :(
author: Chia W.

description:
This restaurant was delicious and really fast.   Came here after shopping nearby and had a hard time deciding what to eat because everything on the menu sounded amazing. 

I wanted seafood and the curry smelled so yummy so I decided to try it and the brussel sprouts with pork belly were literally calling my name so I couldn't resist. 

The portions were definitely entree size.   For two people we were barely able to finish the whole meal but the prices were very very reasonable.   

I will definitely be going back!
author: Kimberly L.

description:
Full disclosure: I'm not a huge fan of Thai food (or sweet / spicy food in general), so Thai cuisine is usually near the bottom of my list. When I do go to a Thai place, my go-to is some kind of fried rice, because almost everything else is either spicy or too sweet.

However, I have frequented this Thai place quite a few times. I stumbled across it maybe 2.5 years ago, and I was very surprised by how much I enjoyed the crab fried rice I got. I loved the combination of the garlicky flavor with the very generous portions of crab meat that came with the rice. Since then, I have come back to this restaurant 3 more times and ordered the same exact dish. I always enjoy it, though sometimes it is on the blander side and I need to ask for some salt.

I also love the complimentary basket of shrimp chips they give you. During my last dinner there, I went with a group of 5 other people, and for some reason they didn't give us shrimp chips. I saw neighboring tables getting it though, so I had to ask for it, but they're usually pretty good about bringing it out to the table.

One complaint about this place is that their menu is really hard to read. They have all these options that are closely printed together which makes it hard to read through the block of text. You can see this from the dinner menu PDF on their website: http://www.basilthai.com/dinner_menu.pdf

Service also isn't great at this restaurant. Despite the number of servers running around, it can be surprisingly hard to get someone's attention.

Prices are about what you would expect for Thai food in the city, with most plates ranging from $11-16. I ended up paying $20 after tax and tip for my fried rice.

Parking in this area is all street parking (and mostly metered). I've driven here twice on the weekends and usually was able to find a spot after a couple minutes of searching.

Overall a very solid place for crab fried rice. Plus it's on the same block as Raven so you can head over there afterwards for drinks!
author: Dianna H.

description:
My companion and I experienced extremely poor service Sunday evening September 3, 2017.

We ended up leaving after waiting nearly an hour for 1 appetizer and 2 noodle entrees that were never served.  No apologies from the manager, only ridiculous excuses.  Definitely will not be back and will not recommend.

We were a party of 2, seated right away without a reservation.   So far, so good we thought.  We check out the menus, decide on what we wanted and started to chat while we wait to be served.  About 15 minutes go by.  No sever, no water.  Finally growing impatient, I wave to the nearest waiter.  I ask if the crab fried rice has real crab and if we can please have 2 ice waters.  They serve imitation crab (gross) so we decided against ordering that item.

About another 20 minutes go by, and our waters arrive without ice.  I kindly ask for 2 cups of ice which arrive within minutes.

Our waitress finally comes by and we order their chicken wings, pad Thai and pad see ew.  We never saw our waitress again - nor the food.  Upon seeing patrons who arrived after us get served their meals, we approach the nearest staff member who refers us to the manager who cannot explain what happened to our order, only that the kitchen is busy along with other excuses - never any apologies.  We left and will not be back.
author: Jo I.

description:
Came here on a Thursday or Friday night dinner with R, I believe. Usually, R gets takeout but we had time. It's a spacious (by SF standards) Thai restaurant. Basil was half empty when we arrived around 8 PM and we were seated promptly. It is a pretty popular take out destination but I am sure that they are usually packed during the weekends, what with its mood lighting and numerous tables for 2 (hint hint, good for dates). 
We got the chicken rolled into eggplants, crab fried rice, and a prawn curry dish. The chicken-eggplant rolls were super interesting! I've never had something like it before at any other Thai restaurant. It's basically thing strips of eggplant wrapped around chicken and cooked. It's quite savory as well. The crab fried rice had a large amount of crab on top and the curry dish wasn't too spicy, which I appreciated. These were huge portions. We found ourselves struggling to finish everything towards the end and were glad that we had walked to Basil instead of driving. We also got the leftovers to go. Basil's a great deal because it's affordable, comes with large portions, and delicious!
author: Michelle R.

description:
I am currently working in SF and am always on the hunt for some affordable Thai restaurants within walking distances so I saw the reviews on Basil Thai Restaurant and decided to check it out. What I came to realize is that the food was decent, service was fine, and the overall experience was good, but there was nothing special about my meal or my experience there. 

The portion sizes were relatively small as well. For example, when I order chicken satay, usually I get around 4 skewers, but this time there were only two and the shrimp dish that I got was also not as filling as I hoped it would be. They did give us delicious shrimp crackers at the beginning of the meal which were wonderful and tasted great, but the rest of the meal was just average. Probably the most disappointing part of my experience there was that I asked my shrimp to be extra spicy just because I want to see what each Thai place is capable of, and was sorely disappointed when my shrimp was only mildly spicy.

Anyways, this place is decent if you're looking for a taste, but if you want to be filled up with food, this probably isn't the place to go.
author: Michael L.

description: It's been several years, I visited this restaurant again last week and still am giving it five starts. Still think it's the best Thai restaurant in Foster City/San Mateo area. Good food and service, and a nice walk along the Bay water front across the street.
author: Jeff M.

description:
It's good food, and the ambiance is pretty good.  But service was slow and inattentive.  Took more than 20minutes for food to come and drinks remained empty.  Food is on the pricey side and any Asian restaurant that doesn't offer free or unlimited refill rice rubs me wrong.

Rice is like less than $1 a pound and they charge $2.5 for a small bowl
author: Nathan Y.

description: I came here for lunch.  The servers were nice and the food (when I eventually ate it) was awesome.  The problem is the noise level was obscene as the walls and open floor plan along with very crowded tables made for terrible audio.  By the time the food came I had a migraine and a panic attack from the noise and claustrophobia from rubbing elbows with people I don't know.  Go here if you want good food and to feel like you attended a metal concert after.
author: Beverly H.

description: Full menu with many delicious choices - comfortable interior. They have a full bar as well - a good choice before heading to Orpheum theater.
author: Francie S.

description: There is a dish here that's to dieeeeeee for and it's the red curry dish with the pork and pumpkin. The meat is super tender and fresh. Must get this if you like to eat like a queen. It tastes great with white rice and my portion was big enough to share, but it's so good u kinda didnt want to. But I did......Everything else I ordered was pretty good but nothing that was like wow!!! The rice and noodles were cooked to perfection. I hate going to an Asian restaurant as an Asian female and eating partially cooked rice or noodles. So you don't have to worry about that here. The food was good. None of the dishes here was a disappointment. Everyone who works here is super nice. So the reason I gave a 4 star, was that we asked for a table in the front with windows, they didn't give it to us even through I also had reservations. I didn't understand it bc that table that they saved it for didn't come until we already paid for our meal. This place is a hole in the wall and the facilities isn't great. There was a smell when you first come into the restaurant. But it's all worth it for that one dish !!
author: Ciara N.

description:
Came here since we only had a limited amount of time between arriving in the city and getting to our show at the SHN Orpheum. Food was generally good. Using the more generic names, we had the spring rolls appetizer which were full of fresh vegetables and had a good sweet oil served with them. We then had the Jungle Beef (medium spicy is the norm for this dish) and had the chicken pad thai ordered as "spicy", and we clarified that as medium spicy as well.

The jungle beef was excellent. I ordered it partly because of other reviewers, and it certainly delivered. Every part of the flavor and dish was delicious.

The spicy pad thai was TOO spicy...and I like my spicy foods! It was just barely one notch below the level of my wife being able to eat at all, and even for me it was one or two notches above what I consider enjoyable because, after a few bites, the heat overwhelmed the taste of the dish. Consider yourself warned.

The restaurant is reasonably close to the Orpheum, maybe a 10 minute walk at most, with a decent amount of street parking available free after 6pm in between the restaurant and the theater. Neighborhoods could be better, but seem safe enough though dirty.
author: James W.

description:
This is my second time here! It's a tiny restaurant with a nice bar area and quick service. Tried it for lunch on a Wednesday afternoon . Got a table quickly and the food tasted very fresh and great!

The Monk's delight: this was a good mix of vegetables! I asked for a side of white rice. I loved this dish! It was fresh.. had all the right vegetables...and the red curry was yum!

My friends ordered pad Thai with prawns and other vegetables.. attached photographs. They mentioned they really loved their dishes !

I like this place enough to visit it again when I crave Thai food! A good number of options for vegetarians!
author: Nayana R.

description:
We ordered couple of items for
Both vegetarians and meat eaters. The server was rude and made comments about food we ordered stating your are not going to like it since you seems to be vegan and I was surprised with the comment. Never mind, food was okay and not worth coming back again. Regular Thai place around the corner.
author: Ishpreet R.

description:
Basil Thai is definitely my favorite Thai place I have found in SF. While it may not be the most traditional, the food is spectacular and you really feel like you are eating in an upscale environment. I have been here for dinner twice now and both times, I have always left floating on cloud 9.

Both times I have come during happy hour which is every day from 5:30-6:30. All appetizers are $6, beer is $4, house cocktails are $6 and glasses of wine are 1/2 off. This is a fantastic deal and one of the best restaurant happy hours I have seen. While the time span is short, it is definitely worth it to try to make it in. The value is incredible. 

My favorite items that I have tried are:

-Roti appetizer: So good and the green curry has a really good bite. This isn't too heavy either and is easily shareable.
-Pad Kee Mao: My benchmark for Thai food. Basil's is well above average and quite hearty! Definitely delicious
-Kang Bpet: This duck dish is SO good. The red curry is delicious and the vegetables inside create a good texture. Highly recommended
-Chocolate Mousse: I never expected dessert at a Thai restaurant to be so good. This dessert is infused with Jasmine so it has a very nice twist on traditional mousse. For $7.50, you feel like you are getting a much fancier dessert.

On my last meal, the 2 of us each got a drink (HH-priced), split an appetizer (HH-priced), 2 entrees, split a side of rice and split dessert. With tax this came out to $58 which seems steep but considering we had alcohol and 3 courses of high-quality food, this is a great value.

Overall, I cannot wait to go back. I question why I am not there more often and would highly recommend it to anyone in the area for a great meal.
author: Carrie W.

description: Every dish I tried here was amazingly delicious! I tried the duck red curry, basil beef, and pad thai. The curry was creamy and duck meat tender. The beef had the right amount of flavor as well. Lastly the pad thai had a nice sweet sauce and came with shrimp and tofu. My friends also ordered cocktails, which were strong and refreshing. I will say the food is a little pricier than most Thai places I've been too, but the quality of food doesn't disappoint!
author: Jamie L.

description:
Just finishing up lunch here. It looked promising, but if good service is important to you you might want to think twice. 

When I walked in at 11:45 there were only about 2 other parties here. So it was slow--before the lunch rush, which you would think would be a good time to get attentive and fast service. 

I asked for and received the cute little table in a nook by the front window, good start. 

After looking at the menu for a couple minutes, I waited...and waited, for a server to come by. "Out of sight, out of mind" apparently. When it appeared no one would come, I stood up, poked my head around the corner and finally got a staff member's attention. Two were deep in conversation so my wave was not recognized by them, another server kept her head down and at last someone acknowledged me and came to get my order. 

I ordered the wok fried shrimp and eggplant dish and asked for water. My water came and at the bottom of the glass was a food particle so asked for another when my food came. 

Finally, the dish was flavorful with just a hint of spice, but the chili sauce was a bit on the watery side. They were generous with the shrimp which was cooked well, and at the end of the meal, I felt basically satisfied. 

However the experience was spoiled by the bad service and it's unlikely I will return.
author: Alicia A.

description:
Kama was closed for the holidays so my friend and I came here instead. We both ordered the spicy Pad Thai, which wasn't too spicy. Prices seem to be on the higher side for Thai food in the city but to make up for it the portions are huge! I only managed to finish a little over half and I was pretty full. There was a decent amount of shrimps too, so I think overall it was worth it.

They give free shrimp chips as starters which were tasty. Service was also pretty good as they kept refilling my water. Overall I wouldn't mind completely by back.
author: Sophia H.

description: I would give ZERO stars if I could. The service that I have received on my graduation night was UNACCEPTABLE. I don't know if the waitress could handle a big party of 15, but she was SO RUDE. All of my family members were being respectful to her, not once were we rude. Being a server myself, I understand that big parties are hard to serve, but you do it with a smile and respect. If you cannot do that, then DO NOT be a server. I asked our waitress for some napkins because mine was gone, and I did not know if I may have dropped it on the floor while getting up to the restroom. She says, "your napkin is on the floor." So do you want me to pick it off the floor and use it to wipe my mouth? That was the first strike. The second strike was when I had given her my credit card in advance to pay, and she says, "all of it?" I don't know, I think I only want to pay for $10 of the bill. Obviously all of it. You think that because I have just graduated from college that I cannot afford the meal? It was honestly so disrespectful and it ruined my appetite. After paying, I asked one of the servers for the manager, and she points to the rude waitress that was serving me. I'm sorry, but if this is the type of person that is managing the restaurant, it will not go far. Yes, the food is good and it is located in a good area, but I am beyond disappointed in the service that I have received. This has happened on Friday, May 25th, and I am still livid. She ruined my graduation night, and the owners should definitely check who they are hiring to be the "manager." Definitely a disgrace.
author: Brenda K.

description: We came here in a group of 10. I ordered "spicy" pad thai with no tofu yet the pad thai arrived with tofu and was quite sweet. Drinks were good. However, the service was not on par. The candles arrived towards the end of dinner. Water had to be requested. The worst part of it was this being a birthday dinner, we had them bring out the cake ( bought by us) at the end of dinner, we were charged 2$ per plate = 20$ for just cutting the cake where we cut the cake got by us. They even forgot to get the knife when they brought out the cake. This is unheard of...Most good restaurants offer a complimentary dessert or pastry for birthday person or at least don't charge for bringing cake from outside. If you can't improve the experience then at least don't spoil it.
author: Tejashree M.

description: We made reservation on Yelp for 5:45 on a Wednesday. It  was not very busy. We ordered drunken noodle and pineapple fried rice. The food came in ten minutes. The restaurant has a pretty good selection of wines. I ordered Luli Chardonnay and it was perfect to go with the food we ordered. We had a little spill accident. The waiting staff responded immediately. Thank you for that!
author: Youzhu S.

description: Love this place!! Best Thai in the city for sure! We dinner here quite often, both dine in and take out. The pan stickers are next level! The skirt steak salad, chicken satay and the fired catfish are some of my favorites. They bring out fried shrimp chips as a complimentary pre meal snack- omg! They're so good!!
author: Jessica H.

description:
Very mixed experience. My wife loved the chicken in yellow curry. She prefers chicken on the bone as the overall dish is more flavorful and the meat is usually more moist than pieces of boneless white meat. 

We shared the cauliflower in garlic sauce. At $11 it was very mediocre. The cauliflower was on the al dente side and the sauce was very bland. Definitely not worth it and I usually adore cauliflower. I had asked the waiter for assistance in choosing between three vegetable dishes - not sure why he suggested this one. I also had the pineapple fried rice. I could see scallions, cilantro, cashews, cherry tomatoes and half rings of canned pineapple. This was the most tasteless version of this dish I've ever had. I asked the waiter for some hot sauce and salt. He did bring hot sauce but not salt. I was able to improve the leftovers at home adding some spice, salt and extra cashews.
author: Marco M.

description:
OH MY YUMMMMMM!

this is a cute hole in the wall spot, in the heart of soma. delicious thai food, and every time i've been here there's been NO wait. 

while I'm guilty of this too-- skip the basic thai stuff, curry, pad thai etc because what they really master in is their speciality dishes. i've had their curry and pad thai and while it's good it's nothing too special. some good reco's dishes

+ pla rad pik (Deep-fried whole Tilapia with chili, shallots, cilantro, bell peppers, and sweet mango) truly the star of the show!!!!! it's so delicious and the fish is cooked PERFECTLY. *** FAV DISH HERE
+ dtom yum goong (Shrimp and mushrooms in spicy and sour lemongrass soup) YUMMM perfect for a cold winter night. sour taste makes it so delicious w plentiful of mushrooms and shrimp to go around 
+ seafood bamee (Stir-fried garlic noodle with prawns, mussels, squid and fresh basil) while not as good as the rest of the two dishes, this noodle dish is definitely my favorite. not too oily and perfect to go along w the tilapia

the foods a bit expensive for thai, but it's more of a bistro than a casual restaurant. would come again!
author: Cathy Y.

description: Decent American style Thai food offered in a casual modern dining space. They forgot two of the appetizers and were slow to refill cocktails and water but quick to bring the bill. Flavors were mild and smaller portions but cooked well. Spent approx $150 for 3 people, each had 2 drinks an appetizer and an entree. This is not a place a would go out of my way to go back to but not bad either.
author: Sam L.

description:
My team (6 people) came here during a weekday lunch. 

Upon arriving we were sat at a table near the window almost immediately. Though I've heard from colleagues it can sometimes we difficult to snag a table, especially with several people. 

I was really impressed with the size and creativity of their menu. We ordered the coconut sweet potato with peanut sauce for an appetizer. Large portion, and delicious. I got the pad se ew with shrimp (instead of pork, which is how it's listed on the menu). While everything was tasty, it was a bit expensive for the quality of food. Overall it was good, but not great. 

The ambiance is nice, with large windows and modern furniture. The waitstaff is friendly, and attentive for the most part.
author: Angela F.

description:
Stopped by here when visiting San Fransisco and I have this older bookmarked to come back! 

Thai food was amazing and service was great. I ordered Pad Thai- it came with rice noodle. Although I'm used to a thinner flat noodle it was still great. Take note if you want to request another noodle you can. 

Tom kah- ( forgot full name) the coconut milk soup was so good! I didn't place a spice request so it came out probably with the lowest spice possible. Regardless this is a great starter. 

Speaking of starters I ordered the shrimp  egg roll appetizer and it was okay. Do take a look at others, I'm sure there was something else better on the menu. 

Would eat here again when in the area!
author: Stormy B.

description:
The food at this place is really good albeit over priced. I recommend the pumpkin curry with pork, the pad kee Mao, and the Tom yum gong. Each dish ranges from $13 to $17.

That said, the service can be pretty hit or miss. If you're eating there it's OK, but it's strange that they have tons of wait staff, few customers, and yet still fail to be attentive whenever you seem to need extra chopsticks, hot sauce, or whatever. 

However, God forbid you have to order takeout. They play super loud music and their English isn't great; so ordering on the phone can really suck, and they seem to get pissed off easily. Today I called, they couldn't hear anything since they were blasting electronica, told me to wait a sec, then just left there phone off the hook for literally 5 min. Not hold either; literally just put it down. Of course eventually they picked it  up, just to hang up. 

Thanks
author: Alexander C.

description:
I hosted a dinner party over the weekend and decided that, rather than cook, I would place an order with Basil Thai via Doordash. The delivery arrived on the dot of my requested time, and the food was hot. 

Since I ordered fourteen different dishes, there was ample room for error, but Basil Thai came through with flying colors. They labeled each dish and packaged the appetizers separately from the entrees - very considerate and took the guesswork out of setting up the buffet. Each dish was delicious, and my guests and I were very happy. 

It was my first time ordering from Basil Thai, but it definitely won't be the last!
author: E. G.

description: Perfect lunch option.  I went with the curry that had eggplant and squash.  A bit spicy for me but delicious and filling.
author: Karen L.

description:
Came here in a crazy hot evening in SF. 102 degree. 
NO A/C in the restaurant. 
Food was ok.
Service was ok. 
Will not come back again.
author: stella m.

description: Fresh and flavorful. Is it out of this world? Nah. Not better than Thailand but probably better than 75% of typical Thai joints in the city.
author: Jojo S.

description: Great ambiance, great pad Thai. They even take the tails of the shrimp off for you. That's a first in my experience.
author: Nicholas L.

description: A great place, great atmosphere and friendly staff. The food was pretty tasty. Parts were slightly limited compared to menu pricing, but the overall atmosphere and positive experience helped make this an opportune time.
author: Colette L.

description:
When I first moved to my neighborhood almost fourteen years ago, I remember how impressed I was with Basil Thai as a go-to Thai spot so close by. In fact, my first review nine years ago attests to that enthusiasm. Unfortunately my most recent visit reflected a gradual decline that I've been noticing with what was once very attentive and helpful service. The food has also lost a bit of its luster in the intervening years, and to top it all off, I am disheartened to find their health inspection score drop to 54, which ranks it as one of the lowest graded restaurants in the city while it rates an impressive average of four stars on Yelp. I wonder how many of those diners paid attention to the score.

Jamie W. and I sure didn't when we came here last month. Even though we came late in the evening, I couldn't help but notice that the complimentary shrimp chips were nowhere to be found on our table. I always thought of those chips as mandatory for all guests but I guess not. It wasn't until I brought it up after we ordered that they handed us a small bamboo basket with just a few in it (photo: http://bit.ly/1QQqNIa). Since it was late, we ordered a dish each to share. Jamie went for the $12.50 Pad-Se-Ew because he loves the flat wide noodles that are pan-fried with pork, Chinese broccoli, peppers, tomato, and black bean sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/1PfkNHT). It didn't disappoint taste-wise as that's one of their signature dishes.

I went for the $13.95 Grilled Eggplant stuffed with minced chicken and cabbage and then ladled in a basil green curry sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/1ipRg3p). It was my first time trying this dish, and i have to say it was rather lackluster with not enough heat to provide some kick for sport. Even though they were closing in a few minutes, we noticed how the staff has become less attentive over the years, and it took a while to get the bill. I think Basil Thai is capable of better than this particular dining experience, but I think they need a wake-up call on how some of their more long-standing customers are feeling about the place. Once I saw the '54' though, I can tell you I'm probably not returning until that score moves up dramatically.

FOOD - 3 stars...feeling some slippage here but the big shocker is the '54' health inspection score
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...still feels the same as it originally did...spacious and a bit dark
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...here the slippage is more pronounced
TOTAL - 3 stars...sad to downgrade a neighborhood favorite but sometimes you just have to throw a Thai iced tea in someone's face to make them wake up and smell the basil
author: Ed U.

description: Excellent, authentic Thai food and great service. I like my Thai food on the spicy side and ordered my Pad Thai at a 4 ( 5 is Thai spicy) and it had some good heat at 4.
author: Janelle H.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend to grab dinner before a Snakehips concert. From my past internship, I've only heard good things about this place, so we decided to try it. 

We made a reservation on yelp for two and got seated pretty quickly. We ordered braised pork and basil's eggplant. My boyfriend and I waited around 25 minutes for our food, which was kind of disappointing because there weren't a lot of people in the restaurant at the time and once they brought our dishes over, one of them was wrong. So we had to wait another 15 minutes for our dish to come out.

But all in all, we are humans and mistakes happen. The food was amazing 10/10 and my boyfriend said he would be willing to come back here, mainly for the food.
author: Emily F.

description: Consistently awesome! Yummy nouvelle cuisine Thai food, good wine list, friendly servers, classy atmosphere, reasonable prices, and they're open late! A true SOMA treasure.
author: Les S.

description:
Decent food--and I know my Thai food! Plenty of selections that covers your usual favorites. Thai staff were friendly and attentive.

It irks me a bit that their menu has a section called "Beginnings". Why not call it "Appetizers" or "Starters"? The actual word "Appetizer" is commonly used in the Thai languages these days. "Beginnings" sounds too spiritual for me and I get emotional easily!
author: Yad L.

description:
Man the service sucks... my friend stood up to go out and attend to his car and they took his plate with lots of food still on it, I told our server what happened, she came back from the kitchen and said she would cook a small piece of meat in place of what was taken away, good we thought, she came back out with a "USED" plate from the kitchen, it came with small bbq meat on it (that someone already chewed and spit out) and some rice(that probably got scooped out of the dirty dish pile) and she said " we found your plate do you still want this?"... WTF!!!!  REALLY.. REALLY... SERIOUSLY .. this plate was disgusting. . Why in the hell would you retrieve a plate that has already been piled up in the dirty dish bucket and serve it back to your customers, I am sure that waitress would not eat that either. DISGUSTING!!!
Monday I am going to call the SF Health inspectors office to complain about this. 
There was a lady that kept cleaning our tables like they wanted our party to leave because there was a wait outside. 
We won't be coming back here at all... if they can easily take back what was already garbage and serve it back to their customers, makes you think if their kitchen is sanitary at all.
Health department alerted!!
author: Kelly B.

description: We received a check that included an extra order that we never received and then when they brought a new check, it included a service charge that they didn't include in the first check
author: Kiran J.

description: The ambiance is nice here and the food was also very good. We started with the potstickers (5/5), then I got the pad Thai with tofu and shrimp (4.5/5), and my husband got the panang curry with beef short ribs (4.5/5). We would go back again!
author: Amber D.

description:
It's a solid place for lunch in the SOMA area. They're quick to seat you, take your order, bring and keep filling your water, get you fed and out the door. I like it because it's efficient. Food is pretty decent and I order the Grilled Pork Fillets. My coworkers have started ordering that since they've tried it. Kind of on the expensive side so I go if I can expense it.
