Overall, great experience. Great date spot as the place is somewhat dimly lit and the noise level is a bit above average, but you can still hear dining partner. We will be back for sure... Definitely tops the list of best thai restaurants in SF.
author: Edward F.

description:
The curry peppercorn duck was great. Not too spicy to overpower the flavor of everything else. The chicken satay was tender and moist. The peanut sauce was perfect and the pan stickers were great too.

Not only was the food and service good for a Saturday night, but the prices were surprisingly reasonable for the bay.
author: Veronica P.

description:
Do you like to pay $15 for a curry that doesn't include rice? Neither do I, but this place is arguably worth it.

I have had the yellow curry with chicken and the red curry with pork shoulder. Both were incredibly tender and bursting with flavor. Among the best curries I've had. The sticky rice, though I did not enjoy paying for it, was just how I like it.

I have seen people leaving due to not receiving service in a timely manner both times that I visited. So if you're in a hurry stay away.

Update: I had bad experiences the last few times I went, including raw potatoes in my yellow curry. This place is just overpriced.
author: A. Wolfram K.

description:
"BUSY DAY REVIEW"

3.0 for large crowds, clean bathroom, prompt filling of water, ability of waiter to answer "What's the most popular dish on your menu?"  Modern feel.  Ambience was mediocre, considering it was too dim at my table to read the menu.

2.0 for making reservations.  Would have greatly appreciated a courtesy note over the phone on the following.  If it's considered a "busy" night, I'd recommend bringing a small party (less than 6) because 1) your party better be hungry because on busy days there's a minimum of $15 per person, and 2) 18% gratuity on top of it.  Who charges a $15 minimum, seriously?  With my party of 9, half of the girls ordered appetizers.  Be ready to order at least one dish and an appetizer PER person.  I'm saying this because the most expensive dish is around 13.50, and the cheapest is around 7?  So plan to order dessert, drinks, appetizers along with it.  We didn't look forward to all the extra dishes that came out.  And couldn't reach the minimum so spent it on cake-cutting ($1.50 per person, FYI, in case you want to celebrate a birthday there, too)

2.9 stars for food.  Pad Kee Mao wasn't good, Pad Thai way too sweet, Tamarind Prawns (supposedly a house recommendation) sweeter than the Pad Thai.  And get this, I have a sweet tooth!  Of the 8 or so dishes, I think the turnip cakes were the best.  I'd come back for that.  But not on a busy day.  Cute, clean presentation of the dishes though.

All in all, my party would have had a better time given notice about their busy day policies.  I rated it 3 stars because they didn't charge us $15 for one of the members of the group who came during the last half hour of the meal.  I really wanted to give it 2 stars because I do feel it deserves a "Men, I've experienced better," but I'm kind of feeling indifferent today.
author: Janet T.

description:
Ordered the Stuffed Eggplant Green Curry and the Pad Ke-Mao. Both are delicious. 

Stuffed Eggplant Green Curry - not too spicy, just right. I would recommend you to order extra spicy if you like spicy. The chicken is soft consider most chicken curry in other Thai restaurant are pretty dry. I wish there are a bit more eggplants as they are sliced pretty thin. 

Pad Ke-Mao - it is not too salty and they put in good amount of meat in it. Nothing special but surely tasty.

The only reason I gave 3 stars is because they listed their pricing wrong. 

Stuffed Eggplant Green Curry listed $11, but they actually charged me for $12.95.

Pad Ke-Mao listed $10, but they actually charged me for $11.
author: Hunter S.

description:
Came here last night (Sunday night) with my boyfriend after looking for some good Thai places on Yelp.

I was very surprised by how nice and modern the place was! There was dim lighting, bar, and candles lit on each table. A very cute place to take a date! 

We ordered the chicken yellow curry and lightly fried prawns with peppers and onions. Prawns were delicious!!! One thing you should note is the yellow curry is served very different than other places I have usually gotten it from: sliced chicken, carrots, onions, potatoes and LOTS of curry sauce. This was served with 1/2 chicken (bone-in), potatoes, and a little curry sauce. It was hard to complain about it though because it tasted sooo good! The chicken came right off the bone and the potatoes were weirdly amazing. Just a note for those of you who like drenching your rice with curry sauce (like me) -- there probably isn't enough for that. 

Their rice portions are also super small for $2.50 (brown rice) each. But you do get some delicious shrimp chips for the beginning of the meal!

So if you're willing to spend a little extra money I think it's definitely worth it! (We spent about $50 out the door for two people and 2 dishes)
author: Vanessa P.

description:
Lers Ros is WAY better & so far, more trustworthy. And I think it's also cheaper. 

But Basil Thai is n my neighborhood, so I was hoping this would become my local go-to Thai place! Tried the place twice. First visit was decent (about 3.5 stars worth! had ordered the spicy beef salad & a curry). 

On the second visit, the "fiery lamb" was neither fiery nor lamb. It was beef (or poor quality flavorless lamb) cooked in an overly sweet brown syrup (& no spicy kick whatsoever).  The waitress insisted it was lamb & didn't offer any explanation of why it didn't have any of the flavor or texture characteristic of lamb meat.

The coconut chicken lemongrass soup's broth was good, but they added the already-cooked chicken in at the last minute instead of cooking it IN the broth (the chicken was dry & flavorless...it had neither absorbed the flavors of the broth nor retained its natural juiciness). 

Most dishes were overwhelmingly sweet; the other flavors were lost in the syrups they cooked the meats in :/
author: Sandy J.

description: The pad Thai was way too sweet, we've each had a bite and left it untouched. The jungle beef was rubbery and overcooked. Wouldn't ever come back again.
author: H S.

description:
My date and I went to this gem of a restaurant on a midweek evening and could not be happier with the service, the quality of the food, the ambiance or the prices. We started with the crispy wrapped tiger prawns and chicken satays for an appetizer, and they were incredible. For the entrees,  I had the braised short-ribs with curry sauce while she had the grilled lamb fillets that were fork-tender and just plain delicious.
If there was a problem with the service, it is that it was too good.  It seemed like every time I took a drink from the water glass, there was someone there refilling it within 30 seconds. I loved the interior of the space-the cement top on the bar was minimalist cool without being cold and the place was inviting and friendly without kitsch.  Overall just a lovely place and great food.  One of our new favorites!
author: Daniel M.

description:
Pretty good thai food in Soma (on Langton & Folsom)... 

The pad kee mao, extra spicy with the steak was really good. A bit greasy, but delicious nonetheless. Ask them for 'Thai Spicy' if you really enjoy spicy food, it was hardly spicy at all.

Also, the crispy veggie rolls are a delicious appetizer.

I'd recommend making reservations, otherwise be prepared to wait 30-40 minutes for a table. It was very packed when we went for dinner.

Ambiance is chill, low-key type of restaurant, good for groups.
author: Roy C.

description:
Love this place! The food is perfection! 
The curries are light fresh and with a modern twist. Larb Gai is a delightful chicken salad, basil and lime! It's my favorite! The Pad Thai is the best I've ever tasted!!
author: Bobby R.

description:
Another great meal here.

I had a very late dinner with a friend and this place was packed and busy, especially for being a Wednesday night!  We waited about 20 minutes to be seated, but it was worth the wait since everything was great: Chicken Stuffed Eggplant in Green Curry and Panang Short Ribs were both fantastic!  Both dishes were seasoned very well and tasted extremely fresh.  

The service was very fast and friendly.
author: Ken G.

description: Pad see ew noodles are amazing! Way better than any other place I have tried, good flavor. Will go back again soon.Ambiance is decent , very clean and service is good.
author: Aj C.

description:
Tips to make the most of your Basil Thai experience:
1. Make a reservation or call ahead. This place gets crowded. 
2. Order something with seafood! It's not common to find a Thai restaurant with such fantastic seafood dishes.
3. Get excited to consume complementary shrimp chips before the meal!

We ordered: 
* Seafood Bamee ($9.95) - Basil and Garlic Egg Noodle Stir-Fried with Prawns, Mussels, and Squid. Yummy! Definitely had a kick to it!
* Keow Wan Talay ($10.50) - Tiger Prawns, Scallops, Mussels, and Okra in Green Curry. Really good! Unfortunately, you have to order rice separately for $2.

The portions are filling but not overwhelming, the prices are right for the quality you get, and the options are unique. This restaurant is popular for a reason!
author: Talia G.

description: Food was tasty, staff was attentive.  Neighborhood not so great.  We made a reservation and our table was waiting for us upon arrival.
author: R K.

description: Love this restaurant. Great place for date night too. Pad see ew is good, not too saucy. I was a big fan of the eggplant/shiitake mushroom dish (AMAZING sauce) but then I found out it wasn't completely vegetarian and they can't make it otherwise, so that was a big bummer but id definitely recommend it to everyone else. I've ordered food from here for pickup plenty of times and they're always quick about it
author: Pallavi K.

description:
Came recently for lunch with friends without a reservation. We got seated without waiting. Place is clean and simple. 

Service is fine. Water refilled regularly.

What we had were not true Thai food. Those of you have had true authentic Thai food (what Thai people eat) will know what I mean. They are sorted of Thai-Asian-fusion. Which are fine. They are good nevertheless.
author: Mango M.

description: The food is always good here, the place is small but cozy, nice atmosphere.  Staff is always friendly and prices are fair.  Portion sizes are a little small but still filling.  My favorites are the pad see ewe and the banana with coconut ice cream.
author: Colin G.

description: Love it! My first time here and it just gets me nervous when I try new things. The two dishes I had were pad-ke-mao and some roasted duck curry (in a la cartes menu). I have to say the duck curry was phenomenal! It had a perfect blend of some spice, sweetness, and coconut milk. The roasted duck was perfect with the curry.  If you're a big fan of curry and you like duck meat, I'd recommend this here. The pad-ke-mao dish was like a pad-se-ew kind of dish. It was a stir fried wide noodles with "skirt of beef" and bell peppers. There's basil in every dish(even in dessert), hence the restaurant name Basil Thai. I'm definitely coming back to try other dishes on the menu.
author: Mone C.

description:
About half way through our dinner, the servers brought out this double birthday party's cake. They lit the candles, people sang, etc.

... Then the servers iced the birthday people. 

... If you don't understand why that is awesome, don't come here. 

(The minced chicken is really good too FYI.)
author: Emily D.

description:
I have lived around the corner from this place for years. I can't count how many times I have eaten there. Sometimes the food wasn't quite on point, but 'good enough' so I kept coming back. All in all, the food tastes good.

My issue is that it is a bad value. And I'm not complaining about the price. I know how to read a menu and add. I am upset that the owners of this place price food at one point but their standard for doing business is much lower. Like 54-health-rating-from-SFDPH-low. 

Granted, this was in April of 2015. As of January 2016 they are up to a 77. Vermin infestation is no longer a risk. This is public record. Link is on the department of public health website. But I warn you: you can never un-see a number once you see it.... and along those lines is why I have stopped eating here.
author: the k.

description: Went here to eat Dinner with friends after a long tiring day. We were seated immediately and the place was super nice. Very relaxing! It took a while for the waiter to get to us! But it's alright over all the food was great! I loved the beef braised panang curry! It was the BEST I've ever had, the curry was super delicious and the beef was perfectly cooked. It was tender and just melts in your mouth. It was sooo good that I just had to lick the bowl clean. We also had the lamb it was good too. We got sticky rice as the side, however I felt the sticky rice was little too hard and dry! Other than that it was good food!
author: Kalyani R.

description:
Probably a 4.5.

The menu is fantastic.  So many choices and it was hard to make the decisions!

The place is very open and airy and I enjoyed sitting down there.  We came right when they opened on a Sunday, though, so it could be different on other days.  It was empty when we came in but was filling up quickly when we left.

Great selection, very nice staff, very quick with the food.

My husband had the pad thai.  It was delicious and I would recommend it, though I am not a fan of prawns in my pad thai so I would order without in the future.

I had a vegetarian dish from the "wok" section and jasmine rice.  I have had better jasmine rice and mine was good but they added red peppers to it and it kind of through off the flavor for me, as red peppers were not listed on the menu.  It was supposed to have tofu, green beans, mushrooms, and onions but I asked for no onions.  This through off the dish for me a bit.  It was little spicy, which was good, though.  I don't know that I would order it again but it was good none the less.

The lamb satay was sooooo delicious and so were the curry puffs (duck and sweet potato puffs).. both of these I would order again in a second and I would also try the potstickers next time because they looked great.

The bread they provide free on the table was delicious and so is the light cucumber salad that came with the apps.  The penut sauce was to die for!

I had the Thai Black tea and it was good.  Nothing too special but very yummy.

We had a couple desserts.  I enjoyed the fried bananas and icecream the best.  I recommend this.

Overall, we will return.
author: Lyndsey C.

description:
My sweet bf took me out here just because. I'd give it a 3.5. There's nothing particularly bad about this place, it's just that nothing really stood out so it's a little above average in my book. 

The venue is very clean and kind of zen-like/trendy. There were many customers so the noise level was a bit high. The service was polite and courteous and the food was just ok. Nothing memorable at all. I think the only thing that really stood out to me was the interior design, but other than that, nothing spectacular. I'd come here again, I might recommend it if someone was in the area looking for a decent Thai place, but I prefer Grand Pu Bah, which is pretty close too.
author: Lucky N.

description:
Went there for dinner with my son and some of his friends who all work nearby.

The night we were there, there was a line out the door - but they still honored  our reservation after a five-minute wait (a really Big Deal to me).

Food is better than good, worse than great, but tasty in a Thai-comfort-food way. I had the pad ke-mao  and the noodles were delicious; veggies nice and crisp and steak somehow just decent.

The shrimp-and-pork dumpling appetizer was awesome.

The place was crowded and loud as hell, but some dinners are improved by that.
author: Marc D.

description: This place was pretty good for my roommate and I on a Sunday for an early dinner. They had complimentary shrimp chips (limited to 2 baskets though only...we tried to get refills). Food came out quickly and was really good! The green curry, pad rad kang, was my favorite. The curry was hot and very flavorful with the eggplant. Pad se-ew was good, but nothing phenomenal. I'd try the pad ki Mao next time perhaps? Loved the ambiance and cute coy fish pond in the entrance. Only thing my roommate and I had wished was for our server to tell us they had a happy hour from 5-6pm daily (we were in the door right at opening at 5:30pm), including on some appetizers. We had no idea until we got the receipt and were never told it was happy hour to begin with. Would have been appreciated to know for ordering but overall, great Thai food to check out if you're in the area!
author: Janki P.

description:
I'm going to be taking a hiatus from eating here, after seeing their latest health inspection score of 54.

From the San Francisco DPH report:

Improper food storage Low Risk
Improper thawing methods  Moderate Risk
Insufficient hot water or running water Moderate Risk
Inadequately cleaned or sanitized food contact surfaces Moderate Risk
High risk vermin infestation High Risk
Contaminated or adulterated food High Risk
Improper cooling methods High Risk
Unclean or degraded floors walls or ceilings Low Risk
Inadequate dressing rooms or improper storage of personal items Low Risk
High risk food holding temperature  High Risk


I've also noticed, over about the last year, increasing consistency issues with the food here. The only thing keeping me from rating Basil as one star is that I've enjoyed the food here in the past and hope their management can correct both the consistency and apparent cleanliness issues.
author: Boogee Z.

description: A pleasant surprise. Must try- the thai fritters with the cucumber peanut sauce and the eggplant with basil stir fry. The minced basil chicken also turned out to be great. Definitely not your regular thai restaurant so don't expect currys and such. Go and explore.
author: smitha k.

description: One of the better Thai meals I've ever had. I would go back and order five more things just to taste.
author: Roger S.

description: Came here years ago and remember it tasting so much better. It was just ok. Will try somewhere new next time.
author: Shauna G.

description: I thought the interior had a nice vibe to it, nothing that special, but still nice. The food that I had was absolutely amazing. I got the pad Thai, and requested some substitutions and the staff was very accommodating to my requests, which I really appreciated. My vegan friend also had some requests for her food, which again the staff was very kind about. The food was absolutely delicious, some of my favorite pad thai ever. Would definitely come back here!!
author: Megan D.

description: Awesome food while it was going down...until the next day when I had the worst stomach aches and other things I won't go into detail.... It's been four days and I still feel pretty terrible. Probably won't be going back :/ service was ho hum.
author: Katy T.

description:
Awesome place with great service and food. 

My group of friend decided to spend NYE in the city last minute, so we were scrambling to find a good place to eat for dinner the day of. We were staying near union square, so Basil Thai was perfect since it was relatively close. We were pleasantly surprised that they were able to accommodate our group of 6 since we made reservations so late. 

The service was amazing. All the servers were very attentive and friendly, our water cups were never empty for long. The food is excellent, amazing flavors, big portions, and reasonably priced. 

I'd recommend the crab fried rice and the pork belly with gai lan.  Although the pork belly was super rich, the veggies made me feel like I was eating very healthy. Very good flavors, and the sauce was yummy. My friend raved about his yellow curry with 1/2 chicken. It looked more like a whole chicken with the amount he got.
author: Wendy G.

description: Rude service you're not done eating and suddenly they start removing the plates, if you give them more than 4 CC they charge a fee of $3.00 extra.
author: Leo L.

description: Food was great! Service was ok. Drinks were awesome. We were a party of 9 and it was a $3 per card if paying with more than 4 cards... Not too happy about that. Tip is included in total sale.
author: Astraea N.

description:
I really like this place. It's clean, the food is good, and the staff are efficient. 
I recently had pad see ew, which was DELICIOUS, and my friend ordered a wonderful grilled steak with crispy shallots that was equally amazing. I've tried a number of things on the menu, and it's all good. from curry to noodles to soup, it's pretty much a sure thing :)
Many points for being close to work!
author: Salvina B.

description:
I love, love, love this place.
I've been having bi-annual parties there since it opened years ago, and we reserve, and take over, the entire bar.    All my friends love the food, and of course the cocktails, and I get such great feedback about how much they enjoy the place.
The service is terrific, friendly and quick, and the food is sooo tasty !
author: Whitney D.

description:
3.5 stars

Pretty average food. This place won't blow your mind but will fill your belly leaving you satisfied. 

Nice decor and ambience with friendly staff.

We came in on a random Thursday and we were seated immediately. They only had a few people there. Worth a shot if you're hungry and don't want to wait to be seated.
author: Lyle D.

description: The worst place to have dinner with your love ones. I came to have dinner because my family and friends were celebrating a special occasion and we had the worst experience of our live. The waitress who according to her is the manager at the restaurant treated us very rude not only did she prevent us some service as asking for extra sauce but she made funny faces at our table. The waitress threw our plate in the table in a bad manner and made us very vehemence. I felt very uncomfortable eating at this place, I was hoping of having a good time and I had the worst in my live I couldn't eat my plate because I felt so disappoint it by their service. After experiencing the worst service I talked to to the waitress about her attitude and the bad service and she didn't even apologized. Do not come to this horrible restaurant.
author: Karlo V.

description:
Basil Thai used to be my favorite Thai restaurant in the world.  I have taken out-of-towners there on numerous occasions, and it never failed to please.  Well, that was many years ago.

I recently went there for dinner on a Tue night, and we ordered the Grilled eggplant stuffed with chicken and cabbage in basil green curry and the prawns stirred fried with tamarind, both dishes that I have ordered many times before.  Granted I haven't dined here for a while, but boy, the taste was a major let down.  The delicious and nuanced spice and flavor that I remembered from my previous 30 or more visits are gone.  The dishes were insipid, lump, and absolutely amateurish.  I understand sometimes the A chefs take a weekday off, but this was bad.  The energy has declined as well...  Too bad, Todd the owners and his staff have woven together a beautiful formula, but it can use a little jolt and a little more strict quality-assurance.
author: Remy H.

description: My film professor would take us here usually after shows by one of the nearby galleries. Curried diced duck with sweet potato, steak/lamb skewers, and curry peppercorn duck hit the spot. What's unusual about this place is they have a lot of grilled meats you dont see at many other Thai joints. I've promised myself to go back for that reason and I think it's time I did.
author: Kim N.

description:
(See pics)

Review #1030.

Nice setting with bamboo chairs. And I have a feeling they strategically seated us by the window to attract more people to walk in.

The food was alright. The spring rolls were crispy and the green curry stuffed eggplant was mild medium spicy but not too hot. The dishes did look better and aesthetic than the taste.

Service was courteous and with a smile.
author: T L.

description:
Loved the energy and the overall ambience. Service was very responsive and polite. The bartender actually observed our reaction to the drink and came to offer to fix the drink as seemed too sour. 
Very good food  - specifically we tried the garlic noodles and 2 veg curries and the chicken in tamarind sauce. Definitely recommend going!
author: Abhishek A.

description:
Came here a year ago, forgot about them for some reason, then suddenly started frequenting the place again for a few weeks. Not quite four stars, but a solid 3.5, due to them having a very long list of okay dishes, with just a few worthy standouts.

The one dish I'd really suggest getting here is their pork shoulder and pumpkin curry, which is probably my favorite dish on their menu (when they execute correctly, as I've been disappointed once). Some other notable dishes included their duck curry, tom ka gai, and pad kee mao, although the latter was a bit too sweet for me. Their curry puffs are also pretty tasty. Personally, I'd stay away from all their "from the wok" dishes, as these have tended to be fairly lackluster whenever a dinner partner ventured to try one.

Service is not bad and waits are usually not terrible, but some people may find that their portions are a bit small. My smaller appetite doesn't mind, because it's enough that I'll still have some extra to take home, but, larger appetites, be warned. And for those who are inclined to drink, the cocktails here aren't too shabby (but, Bloodhound is right down the street, and is SO much better).

For those in wheelchairs, yes, the front entrance is up several steps. Just have someone let the wait staff know, and they'll let you in through the back of the restaurant - yes, down that somewhat dark, sketchy alley. Don't worry, it's perfectly safe!
author: Johnny W.

description:
Funny ass story:

I'm a regular customer, since I live nearby.

A little pricy for what it's worth. Often crowded inside, but the food is awesome! Not friendly service, however. Pretty dark inside... dimly lit, but they turn up the lights a bit upon request :)


Watch out when ordering their Pad Kee Mao noodles... for some reason they put beef in there by default without even asking you "What type of meat?" since it's like that on their menu... this is not how a typical Thai restaurant does things lol! So if you don't want it with beef, be advised that you have to explicitly and expressly tell them to hold the beef or use another meat instead.

I made my order over the phone for pickup and said "Pad Kee Mao with tofu", and it ended up with beef in it even though I don't eat beef. And then when I came in to pick up my order, the young Asian man gave me my order and escorted me out but FORGOT TO HAVE ME PAY FOR IT!! :O

About 30 mins later I realized that I hadn't paid and the guilt was killing me, so I drove back and paid up my $60+ bill. While paying, I told him that my little Pad Kee Mao part came with beef but I don't eat beef... but that Asian guy just got pissed off at me and told me to leave. He refused to give me his name :( oh well, I ordered a whole lot of other dishes along with it, so it wasn't too big of a disaster.
author: TJ P.

description:
Full bar. Great service. YUMMMMY food. We ordered pad thai and a beef dish. Both very tasty. We had a HUGE party of like 10 and they were accommodating when we ran on Asian time and were over 30 min late for our reservation. Everyone liked what they ordered and since the restaurant is in such a great location, we just bar-hopped afterwards. 

Very good food! Nice ambience. Happy camper.
author: Liz T.

description: Ordered the Sea Bass and Bok Choy for lunch.  The fish was old, fishy, and not even close to being a sea bass.  Not impressed at all.
author: Miles C.

description: Great place for a group dinner with friends. Food is solid - crab fried rice and whole fish were favorites. Inside is nicer than picture looks - chic and intimate, we could hear everyone talking without shouting. Service was great for us. Daily happy hour specials before 6:30 - 1/2 price wine YES.
author: Jessie Y.

description:
An awkward location, yet on a saturday night it was pretty happening.

Upon entering, we were seated within 5 mins- Albeit our table was small and could barely fit our party of 5's eating plates.  We were nonetheless seated promptly. 

We ordered pineapple fried rice, fried tofu skewers, pad Thai and pad see ew to share. The plates the dishes arrived on were huge! But the amount of food on the dishes barely covered half the plate. The only thing I really liked was the fact that they brought out Shrimp chips as a complimentary appetizer. 

The taste of the food wasn't bad. However, I expected a tad more food for the price we paid. Granted we were in SOMA and basil Thai is practically the only Thai restaurant in like a 5 block radius. I still expected a bit better. For our dishes we paid about $45 not including tip. 

Two hours later... We were hungry again.

So if you're here for the atmosphere it's definitely worth it. The service here is great! But if you're here because you're hungry. I would choose another place. Or order a couple more dishes!
author: Jess s.

description: I had lunch here yesterday with my adult son, he works in the neighborhood.  I ordered pumpkin curry and veg curry both were very tasty.  He ordered the beef with broccoli and loved it.  Very nice decor and clean.  Our server was new but very courteous.  Definitely we'll be back.
author: pochini m.

description: Tom yum soup and pineapple rice are good. Meat and vegetable dishes taste terrible. Too sweet. service is really bad too. Won't visit again.
author: Qianqi L.

description: My friend Miguel and I had a reservation here July 3,  7 p.m. I asked if they would make my favorite dish, red seafood curry (only green was on the menu) and they did and Miguel liked it too.  He ordered Grilled marinated skirt steak and steamed vegetables which were delicious esp. with house curried-peanut sauce (yum) .  For appetizers Miguel asked for a green papaya salad which was OK but it's never been one of my favorite Thai dishes.  The grilled squid that I ordered was tasty but a little tough - I know it's very difficult to get it perfect, tough if you under or overcook it even a little. We each had a cup of superb lemon chicken soup made very thick with white rice. The entire meal could have been spicier. I like the decor and the service was superb, the staff letting us take our time with each dish so we didn't feel too stuffed when we left after 2+ hours.  I mean we were stuffed, but not too.
author: Paul S.

description:
I'll go straight.  

Padthai is ok, they use different kind of noodle than what they are in asia, taste is there, peanut and chilli need to be more.

Crab fried rice is plain tasted, for the price there should be more crab than onions. Need to add $3 for egg is expensive as well.

Ginger tea is tea bag type, not punchy enough

Thai iced tea is good
author: The P.

description: So happy to find a great Thai restaurant close to home. I recently relocated to the city and thanks to Yelp, this restaurant did not disappoint. Started out with dumplings then we had pad Thai and cashew chicken for entrees. So, so good! I'll be back!
author: Mark G.

description: I don't understand the love affair my coworkers are having with Osha.  This place is way better.  Super friendly, fast service.  Excellent flavorful dishes.  I'd take this place any day over Osha.  Just sayin'.
author: Cindi R.

description:
The food here are not really delicious compared to  San Jose's Thai restaurant. 
Duck curry and the rotti (forgot the name) are not as actually good as I expected. About the duck curry, the sauce, curry is pretty good but the duck wrapped inside is so so. About the rotti, it does not worth to try.
Fried rice is okay. Compared to other dishes here, this one fits my taste best.
author: Janice N.

description:
Not a place to bring a date to. Unless you like to yell over the crowd. Good vibes though. Lots of big groups here. 

All the food was great! 

Except the wok cooked skirt steak dish and the Brussel sprouts dish were soooooo spicy! If I had known I would have had them tone it down a lot! I hadn't mentioned a spice level when ordering and I don't recall anything on the menu saying so. I ended up eating a lot of the crab fried rice bc it was the only thing that we ordered that I could handle.  

I can never tell if a dish has MSG in it but that's probably bc most restaurants do that. Or it just tastes so good....

Mango with sticky rice was good but small for 6.95. 

They put a candle on our mango and sang happy birthday for my friend which was nice. 

A funny thing happened tho, one server put dessert plates and spoons on our table before the other one brought out the birthday dessert that I ordered secretly. So then I had to play it off like "why are they bringing these now? Shouldn't we get the dessert menu first" and I am soooo lame at covering things up! Lol

Thanks for the find #yelp!
author: Arlene H.

description: Service was great, food was great, energy was great, and drinks were great. Nothing to complain about. Great spot to hit before heading to Slim's for a show or Butter to ... you know, it's Butter.
author: Merylynn V.

description: Love this place!  All their food is delicious as well as a very nice ambiance.  My wife has Celiac and their Gluten Free menu is absolutely incredible especially the beef short rib curry, the steak salad, and the beef flat noodle.
author: aaron h.

description:
Not to be confused with Basil Canteen, the sister restaurant, which is on 11th and Folsom and is totally sub standard and expensive for what it is.

Basil Thai is wonderful! Friendly and prompt service, really good (if not unexpected) Thai food, and the best part is that the prices are insanely reasonable. 

I came with a party of 6 girls and we ordered two appetizers and three entrees, were all sufficiently full, and the bill came out to $13.06 each girl.
author: Julia C.

description:
Great Thai restaurant in SoMa.  Fast service and cordial servers.  
Vegetarian dishes are very limited.  We ordered two vegetarian dishes and they are very similar in taste.  The dishes have a nice touch of heat but a tad too heavy-handed with the sauce.  I find the brown rice compliments the dishes and soaks up the sauce nicely.  
This is a nice place to go when you are in the mood for Thai food.  Fast service and Good food for the price.
author: Veritas V.

description: This place has a great atmosphere and is a wonderful place to dine with friends. The service was great and prompt (never needed to wait for service). I don't normally like Thai food, but decided to go here because my friend does. After trying the Pad Thai dish, I needed to reconsider my stance on Thai food -- as it was very tasty!
author: Michael C.

description: Super yummy and everything looks and tastes amazing also. They give good size portions. Curry smells delicious and also tastes wonderful. The ambience might seem a little fancy but it's not at all. I went in during lunchtime and there seem to be a lot of reserved tables - it usually is very popular. I like eating the peppermint candy after my meals!
author: Annie D.

description: Great romantic dinner spot.  Great food, amazing tastes.  Every thing from the free app to the paid-for-apps to the main course was so uniquely delicious.  Candle lit tables, make the person you're sitting across from look extra great.
author: Tom W.

description:
I Wandered in here when trying to find a healthy solo dining experience around Folsom street and my modest expectations were delightfully destroyed.

I ate at the bar and had a fantastic papaya salad accompanied by just enough conversation with the bartender. The place is a gem and, after sharing my own story, the bartender disclosed that he knew it.

Great atmosphere for a modestly priced romantic dinner or a reflective night out alone. Plus, they have drawing paper on the table which gives them an automatic thumbs up on my list.
author: Sajid R.

description:
After living in Bangkok, I'm pretty critical and harsh about Thai food in the states. However, Basil Thai exceeded my expectations and pleasantly surprised me! I can't give it a full 5 stars because I had some complaints, but overall, it was a delightful meal. The cocktail menu is superb - I definitely recommend trying some of those. I got 2 of the "Ginger Drops" because I'm a vodka gal and that was super tasty and refreshing. Of course, my meal wasn't complete without getting a Singha beer either. For food, we got:

Green curry/roti: This was one of my favorite things ever in Thailand. Of course, this can't be replicated here, but it was still pretty damn good. Note: if you're vegetarian, make sure to tell them that. Fish sauce is used for the green curry, so they can substitute it with yellow sauce, which is entirely vegetarian. Both are really yummy. We had 6 of us at dinner (and some people were vegetarian), so we got one order of the green and one of the yellow. It was more than enough.

Vegetable spring rolls: I think 8 pieces come in an order, which is perfect to share. Crispy and delicious, you can't go wrong.

Larb Gai: I absolutely love this salad. It's hard to find that in the states, as this is a really common and popular dish in Thailand, but I was stoked to see it on the menu. It's minced chicken mixed with mint, lemon, leaves, etc. It's super healthy and has a ton of flavor in it -- the mint makes it excellent, in my opinion. I would for sure get this -- also, the portion is huge.

Vegetarian pad thai: Probably my least favorite thing. just tasted oily and unauthentic. I would skip out on this, it doesn't taste anything special.

Chicken pad see ew: Awesome. Way better than the veggie pad thai. 

Panang curry with chicken: Good, but a little heavy on the curry for my taste. 

Tofu curry with yellow sauce: Again, they need to use yellow sauces for veggie dishes. This was good, but not great. The tofu chunks were huge.

I would have cut one noodle and one curry dish out, as the portions were humongous, but I was still very happy with the meal. Bonus points for the fresh cut thai chilies in fish sauce - absolutely makes a meal!! :)
author: Priya G.

description: Highy above average. Good, spicy thai food. The service is generally competent here, but nothing amazing. Servers tend to be humorless and need reminders. Food is overpriced, but guess that's for the white table cloths. Good flavors and good place for a business lunch.
author: Amar M.

description:
I was feeling adventurous the day I decided to come here. Usually I eat somewhere around the Sunset for some good cheap Thai food, but hey it was a Friday night and I wanted to "explore". 

My friends and I found parking pretty quickly. I made a reservation in advance because I had read the reviews about it being crowded. The hostess  was super friendly and told us to wait about 5 minutes, but the table we were waiting for took their sweet time, so it took a little longer.

The portions were decent enough for 3 of us to share; then again we did order 3 dishes. I'm not usually into food cooked with pineapple since I like them separately, but the Thai pineapple fried rice was delicious! It had the perfect consistency and flavor. The Seafood Bamee was good, but I didn't expect it to be so spicy. I did enjoy the seafood in it though. The pad see ew wasn't anything really different than other Thai restaurants, so I would order it somewhere else for cheaper. 

Side note: It was dinner AND a show that night. I had just momentarily looked up and outside the restaurant windows onto Folsom St. There was a chick CHANGING in her apartment without any blinds/shades. I don't meant to sound creepy, but needless to say, anyone facing the window, including the waiters and the table in front of us caught a peek and were all in shock as well.
author: Kathy L.

description:
Basil has the best Thai food I've had in San Francisco, and perhaps anywhere.  It's absolutely worth goin g out of your way for, and worth braving the long lines.  First time I went, I had the Pad See-Ew, which was delish, and sampled pork shoulder and various curries from around the table.  Nothing wasn't outstanding.  Try the fried Indian bread to start.  Cocktails, too, were fantastic.  The Rum Thai (pineapple and coconut milk) is a tropical delight, and even though I'm not crazy about ginger, I loved the sip of Ginger Drop I tried. 

On my subsequent visit, I had the crab fried rice, which was also really good (although I think I prefer the Pad See-Ew).  I'm excited to try so many thing on their menu, and this is fast becoming one of my favorite places to eat.

So why did I leave off a star?  While the food itself is fairly reasonably priced, there are no free refills on sodas, which the server failed to mention both times I've dined there.  This can account for a little surprise on your check.  Second, cocktails are $9.  Reasonable food prices are counterbalanced by some craziness in the drink department.

Still, though, I highly recommend this place if you're after great Thai food!
author: Erin W.

description:
The only khao soi/soy I have enjoyed outside of Chiang Mai! Khao Soi is an egg noodle dish with pickled vegetables topped with fried noodles in a spicy coconut milk broth with fresh squeezed lime. This dish at Basil happens to come with deep fried triangle tofu and strips of steak. It is quite a bit of food. Next time I'll probably ask if I can get just one protein or a fresh version of tofu. I had half of the egg noodles left over. The broth was sweet, spicy, savory with a hint of sour from the lime. If you like STRONG flavor, you'll like this dish! It's only available for lunch though =). 

Good place to come if you're stuck going to Bryant street station for jury duty. Has a contemporary atmosphere with happy servers.
author: Hannah W.

description:
Stopped by here randomly one night for dinner, and was really blown away by the Coconut Braised Pork Shoulder And kabocha Pumpkin (kang Kua Mu).  It's pretty different from more typical thai dishes that I've had in the past, which is why I ordered it (was curious).  My husband, who ordered something else, was also super impressed with my dish, so much so that he tried to eat more of it, and then ordered it the second time we ate here.  I've also had the Jungle beef, which, despite the somewhat vaguely offensive? name, is also quite delicious.    

I've yet to have any of the more standard thai dishes such as noodles or curries, but there's enough unique items on their menu that I don't think I'll feel the need to try their pad thai anytime soon.  

The ambience was quite nice, somewhat fancy/modern feeling without being snobbish.  The service was good, with attentive but not overbearing servers.  Even though we arrived quite late in the evening, we did not feel rushed to finish and pay up.  The shrimp chips were a nice touch too.
author: Helen Y.

description:
Pros:
- eggplant catfish (eggplant was tender and catfish was soft but remained crispy in the sauce)

Cons:
- pad thai, pad see ew, pad kee mao were average

Bottom line: Food wasn't good enough to make me want to return
author: Jiann M.

description:
This is one of those places that you can taste that there are just too many items on the menu.  There are some dishes that come out that are really superb and divine.  The curry puffs were delicious.  The flavor is spot on, the texture is beautiful, etc.  That's hard to find.  And then there are other dishes that just were generic.  I don't think the Pad Thai or tamarind prawns were bad, but they were just very monotone. Overall, it's a good place.  With just a little bit of creativity it could be so much better.

Portions are small, so get two items per person.
author: Kenji M.

description:
Great food! Ordered pad Thai, chicken skewers, vegetable rolls. All were delicious! 

The service is great and I love how they take reservations. My friends and I usually come here for dinner and hang out for a bit, then walk a few doors down to Raven Bar & Lounge.
author: Nancy C.

description:
I called and made reservations for 8. We were about 30 minutes early for our reservation, but the table was ready. The service is good and attentive through a group effort. There wasn't just one person making the rounds. However, I think some of the staff members get it, while the others don't. It took one of the staff members a couple tries to get the lighting correct. Since we were a bigger group, we didn't want to dine in the dark and asked them to turn up the light right above our table.

Just a warning...the Pad Thai is spicy! My favorite dish that we shared was the Pad See Ew. The Thai Sukiyaki was sour, not that it was foul, but probably too much lemon juice. We ordered yellow and green curry. Both were tasty.

The Thai Ice Tea was just right, not too sweet with just the right amount of flavor. 

Overall, just as Yelp gives the option of 3 stars, it's just A-Ok.
author: Jean L.

description: Restaurant was easy to find and had plenty of street parking around. Food was excellent. Minced Chicken Basil was better than is have tasted before. Curry Vegetables and Sautéed Green Bean dished were delicious. I would recommend and go there again.
author: James P.

description:
Not the best thai food, small portions (therefore overpriced), but located in the heart of San Francisco so I can assume that a lot of tourists come here. It looks hip on the inside which is cool. We came at a very early time and there were lots of staff, just standing around and doing nothing.  When I worked at a restaurant, I was always told not to look like I'm doing nothing, even if I have to pretend to wipe the counters and whatnot.

Food - 2 stars
Decor - 4 stars
Service - 3 stars
author: Alyssa Z.

description:
I came with a party of 7 people on a Saturday evening. They don't take reservations and our wait was about 20-25 minutes but none of us minded the wait. The restaurant has a nice ambiance but I personally thought it was too dark inside. Everybody in my party has a relatively small appetite and some of us weren't too hungry to begin with so we just wanted to order 4-5 plates of food to split before a night out in the city. However, our waitress very rudely told us that we HAD to spend at least $15/person (This is a rule they have, and we didn't know about it before we sat down). Of course, $15 is not much for a nice dinner out but we all were very irritated by 1) the service and our waitress who was extremely rude 2) this very unnecessary rule of having to spend $15 per person when all we wanted was to quickly finish dinner and head out 3) the 18% gratuity on TOP of the $15/person. 

Anyhow, there was no way around it so we ended up ordering ~4 more plates of food which were mostly left uneaten and 5 drinks that we didn't really want to begin with but got them anyway to minimize food wastage. 

All 7 of us were really irritated by this experience and this definitely took away from our food experience. The food was good but not great. I've definitely had better thai food in SF. They do have a lot of vegetarian substitutes and we appreciated that. 

I would not recommend coming here with a large group. I've had better service and better food and definitely more fun at other restaurants.
author: Minati D.

description:
This place is the dopeness. I go there probably once every other week because my roommate is Gluten-Free and this is one of the few places we can agree on. It's not cheap, when it comes to Thai food, but it is delicious. Also the shrimp chips are bomb delicious. 

Make sure you get the pork belly with chinese broccoli.
author: Daniel K.

description:
This hidden restaurant is a solid place for a taste of Thai food especially for a small group.  Although the meat can be a bit tough to chew, the flavors from the sauces are tasty.  The curries and pad thai are good.  The best part is dessert with fried bananas and coconut ice cream.  

Service is fast and friendly.  The ambiance is plain and simple with dimly lit settings.  Parking is easier on the street than most places in the city.
author: Jenny L.

description: Lots of choice with very unique dishes, drinks, and dessert.  Flavor for the catfish and crispy chicken was a little heavy for me but they were very delicious.  Lychee Thai ice tea was very refreshing. I highly recommend the jasmine chocolate moose. The jasmine flavor was just right to lighten the chocolate, making it one of the most exquisite desserts I have ever had. Service was excellent.  I will definitely return to try other dishes!
author: Hungry D.

description:
Ate here last night with 13 friends... yup, I have an entourage, folks...

... Okay, wait, that's just not true. They were all there for Janice F's birthday and I was just an invitee; I'm just not that impressive (but she is that impressive and does have an entourage... and I'm her very bestest and most favorite of all her friends... okay, wait, that's just not true either; this is just sad, isn't it?).

The food was really fantastic! If you haven't been here yet and you like to hit up SOMA, you really need to eat there. They have a great selection of dishes, so there should be something for everyone. The drinks were really good too and we had a lot of them. And, the atmosphere is great as well.  All around high marks.

The price was surprisingly low for the location and quality; not cheap, but certainly very practical.

The only disappointing moment was when we discovered they wouldn't let us cut her cake unless they could charge a cutting fee (I guess that's like a corkage fee, but for tasty baked goods instead?). They knew we were coming, they knew we would be a very big group, and they knew they were going to make a lot of money with us; so the cutting fee was just not necessary.

So, if that's the only downside to a great restaurant, then I'd say it's WELL worth checking out.
author: Christopher J.

description:
I have a couple fuzzy-ish fond memories of dining at Basil Thai, so when I found myself on a month-long jury duty stint I made this my first lunch stop. Oh disappointment... greasy, bland pad thai and slow service. Boo. 

In all likelihood I'll come back before jury duty is up - like I said, I've had good experiences in the past. It's a possibility that the rice-based dishes are better. It's also a possibility that the alcohol consumed along with said dishes made them *seem* better. Time will tell, I guess. In the meantime, I pronounce this place "meh."
author: Janna M.

description: Hip decor, good service, okay food. Prices are too high so we haven't been back.
author: Susan S.

description: Basil Thai is my favorite neighborhood Thai food spot. Never an issue making a reservation and whether dining in or taking out the food is always delicious. Some of my favorite menu items are the crispy vegetable rolls, mun thet tod (kind of like sweet potato fries), pad thai and the jungle beef. Recently had the pad se-ew and the praram rong song (skirt steak with peanut sauce) which will definitely make it into my ordering rotation.
author: Tracy S.

description:
Great restaurant for Thai food.
Drinks are great, creative cocktail list.
Short Rib, panang curry, pad thai, eggplant green curry were favorites.
The desserts are the best part!
author: Leonard H.

description:
This is my favorite Thai restaurant in the city! Sooo yummy! I have yet to find a bad dish on the menu. I most recently tried the braised short rib curry and it had a wonderful sweetness amongst the flavorful spices in the curry sauce.  Secondly, I had the the brussel sprouts with crispy pork belly which had great flavor and spice. At first  the brussel sprouts were slightly under cooked, but the waitress kindly took it back to be cooked longer. 

Overall I would recommend starting your meal with one of their amazingly fresh and bright salads.  Then follow with a curry and/or wok dish. Lastly their fried banana and coconut ice cream dessert is a delicious way to end your meal if you have room.
author: Alisha R.

description: Had the special consisting of a curry dish and a meat/rice dish. The red curry was tasty, but a little too watered down. It did however, come with a decent sized piece of salmon, which was a very pleasant surprise. It was pretty well cooked too. I got chicken with the rice and it was decent as well. The food was filling and with the special I got a good variety of flavors as well. I would give this a 3.5, but I guess I'll round up.
author: George K.

description:
Careless and inattentive staff, with tolerable food. 

We are tourists in the city and went to this restaurant because of the great yelp review.  However, these reviews are completely misleading and not a good representation of the restaurant. 

I called ahead to make a reservation for 2 but was told it was not needed. When we got there, we ended up waiting half hour to get seated. Meanwhile, they were holding tables for people who were very late for their reservation.  Normally I would overlook this, if this was the only thing. But it just got worse from there.

1) Our waitress was short and impatient when we asked her for recommendation. 
2) Our food took 45 mins to come out, and during this wait the waitress did not come check on us once. Again we would have over looked this, if she had at least apologized or explained why it took so long, but she didn't even come to out table until we were half way through our meal. When she did finally come, we asked her to bring us extra spoon and fork, and she acknowledged that she heard us, but never brought it to us. 
3) If the food was spectacular, everything could have been redeemed, but alas, food was ok. Needed lots of hot sauce to make it tolerable.
author: N T.

description: A personal favorite of mine! So reasonable with better thai dishes then what I got in Thailand! Starters of the crispy spring rolls and calamari are delicious! Mains you got to try are the peanut sauce skirt steak, the pork ribs and the pad thai is awesome in that order!
author: Jack O.

description: Man I was really going to give this place 5 stars because they made the best eggplant dish I've ever had in my life. But I went for the third time recently and it was not the same. I was really disappointed. I don't know what happened! Other than that, everything else on the menu is really good. You can't go wrong with the pad thai and the panang curry. It's not difficult to get seated. I've walked in twice and got seated immediately. Anyways, I'm not too sure if I will ever come back here because I really only came here for the eggplant dish. And now that it's changed.... sigh
author: Amy X.

description: Food was tasty but nothing I would return for, and to be honest it out me more in the mind of Chinese than Thai. Oh and don't bother asking for spicy because that is apparently something they are unfamiliar with. We ordered the fiery lamb extra spicy and it fell far short of any spicy mark.
author: Melissa G.

description:
Dude. This place is bomb. 

Thai food is one of my favorite cuisines, so I've been to many Thai restaurants in the past. This place makes top 5! 

The curry puff appetizers were amazing. We also ordered a Chicken Pad Thai, Basil's Eggplant and a curry, but I forgot which one. The eggplant dish was SO GOOD! It's marinated in this super sweet sauce. I'm definitely ordering that again when I go back!

Environment was nice. Service was good, and the place was super clean. Therefore, I give you, Basil Thai, a 5 star! Horay:)
author: Chrisy Y.

description:
Ate here with my friends while we were staying in Millbrae (we're from SD). I got the see ew noodles and chicken yellow curry and shared with someone. I was thrown off guard when the chicken in the yellow curry was a whole breast and thigh with the skin and bones and everything. I'm used to the cut up boneless chicken. But the sauce was good, it could use a little more flavor. And the see ew noodles were also good. 

But the reason I gave this place 2 stars is because of the hostess. When I walked in with my friends, I told her I had a party of 6. She then asked if we had a reservation and I said no and this girl rolls her eyes at me and says to the other girl, in the sassiest tone, "they don't have a reservation" and then turns back to me and says five mins. Like how rude. I was right in front of her. And if it was only gonna take five mins to set up a table then why'd you roll your eyes and be a diva about it.
author: Ann D.

description:
Good food, well worth eating. I love the spring rolls and the curries.

Takeout container rating: meh. Most of the food comes in those one time use cardboard jobbies, but if you get something juicy, like a curry, it will come in a decent plastic tray with a lid.
author: Vivienne P.

description:
Great Thai food! Neat interior and a great location for dinner before a show at the Theatre.

We had the eggplant salad which was good. Some pieces of eggplant were melt in your mouth, others a bit undercooked, but overall really nice.

Tom Ka gi soup was nice, could have been spicier for my BF so next time he would ask if that's possible.

My mother enjoyed her padthai and I got the turnip cakes which were fun, although a bit too much deep fried.

$5 happy hour prices on their creative cocktail menu and starters was an amazing deal.
author: Pearl P.

description:
Youthful Thai Restaurant located in Soma's industrial neighborhood. 

Food was traditional and I appreciate they had a $25 pp family style meal menu. This allowed our group of 12 to share a family style meal and not bang our brains out on figuring what dishes to order. 

*Gai Sate [3 of 5] - Chicken Skewers

*Basil's rolls sampler [3 of 5] - Nice fried items. Fried Spring Roll and Fried Prawns with Fish Sauce.

*Pad Thai [3 of 5] - Pretty standard noodle. No complaints.

*Pad Pak Raum [3 of 5] - Vegetable Dish. General assortment of greens from the Asian Market.

*Tamarind Prawns [3 of 5] - Prawns were good size. No one had to fight for the last one.

*Kang Kua Gai [3 of 5] - Red Curry with Pumpkin. Very mellow, not that spicy. 
  
*Param-Rungsong [3 of 5] - Skirt Steak with Peanut Sauce

*Fried Banana [2 of 5] - Pretty standard. Not too oily or special.

Overall, I just really liked the family style prix fixed price and it is a clean place. But I think Osha Embarcader or Market Street is a lot prettier.
author: Janice T.

description:
I generally don't give bad reviews. I'm happy to review a place well, but if a place doesn't please or excite me, I consider it my own issue and keep my mouth shut. But this is the 5th time I've been to Basil, and every single time I've had a mediocre to terrible experience here. The only reason I've eaten here so many times is because it's near my job, and in this part of town there are very few restaurant choices. But after today, I can honestly say that I'd rather starve than venture into Basil again.

First off, for a restaurant of its size, Basil should have more than two servers. But at the busy lunch hour, when the place is packed, there are never any more than two to be found. Actually, scratch that. There is really only one server, because the two servers on the floor each do only half the job of a complete server.

On one occasion I walked into the restaurant with a coworker, was approached by one of the servers to be seated and as I was speaking to her she turned around and walked away from me. She wasn't showing us to a table. No, she was just done with us for a while. Today, this same server completely skipped over me when it came to drink orders. She stood right behind me and took everyone else's order and then rushed off without giving me even an opportunity to say, "hey what about me!" Nope, she was outta there. Maybe you're thinking she just wanted to get our drink orders up. But I doubt it. She didn't come back with the drinks for 10 minutes.

The other server seems utterly oblivious to the needs of a diner. He never supplied us with enough silverware or napkins, and when a dish was brought to us to eat family style, it had chopsticks in it--there wasn't a serving spoon or fork to be found. Love chopsticks or hate them, you absolutely can't serve food with them. But he, too, was outta there faster than lightening, so I had to get up myself and take silverware from an empty table across the room.

Food-wise, Basil is OK, but I have had much better in this city elsewhere. Sometimes the steak is tough and hard to cut. Sometimes the satay is made with cheap, dark chicken meat, like it was today. Sometimes there's more rice than main course on my plate. Rarely is the entire meal a delight. In fact, it's never been a delight. It's always seemed just a little half-assed.

Trust me, I hate giving bad reviews. Hate it. But Basil has disappointed me for the last time.
author: Derek S.

description:
I've been a fan of Basil since the mid-90's when they opened and they were one of the original anchors in the then fast-changing SOMA scene that was pretty desolate except weekend nights.

First, the restaurant welcomes you with a beautiful interior that's aged well over the past 15 years (industrial chic meets bamboo and soft tumeric yellow) and at night, with candles flickering, it becomes a little romantic spot. 

The restaurant does surprisingly well for lunch, too. You can get a table without a reservation but it's nicely populated. 

The menu is fusion & the food is inventive, at a good price point with very generous portions. 

Favorites are the fire calamari, any of their shrimp dishes and the beef dishes usually are excellent (although today the angus cubes in green curry were tough).

After many good lunches and dinners here, I'll forgive 'em for that one blip!

Full bar, great selection of sakis & probably the best Thai iced tea I've ever tasted.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Did someone pour a bottle of salt on my food?
I took my sister here based on the Yelp reviews, but it was a total disappointment.
Every item we ordered from the papaya salad to pad thai to the duck coconut curry dish was too salty.
I will never dine here again. I don't know if this visit is a good representation of how the food always is or if it was an off day...Nevertheless, it's a competitive industry and if you want to keep new customers coming back for more, you should always be on your A game.
author: Jo M.

description: The food here is AMAZING! We were a party of 6, and we ordered many different dishes (that comes with rice). The sauces were really really tasty. We all agreed that we have to come back. Bonus info: nice drinks as well! Sweet staff, pretty quick seating considering it was a friday evening @ 9pm (I think we waited 20 minutes).
author: Marie V.

description: contemporary modern atmosphere...trendy thai appearance without going overboard...menus and complimentary shrimp chips...bottle of leth gruner first $thirty-four...taste and pour of wine...focus on dinner...appetizer of "fresh" spring rolls...little dry and tough..dipping sauce quite sweet...not tasting fresh...spicy larb $eight...warm wet ground chicken slaw appearance with extra heat...slight tang and intense flavors good...tamarind prawns battered and over fried...lathered in intense sweet saucing...bit too sweet...another bottle of leth gruner to wash down...sharing between three, so it's okay...an order of the crab fried rice the favorite and pushing forward in what would have been an average dinner...requesting an egg to mix...every bite filled with crab meaty delicious...get the crab fried rice...cheers of gruner and finishing glass...$one-seventy dinner for three lush...
author: Hen A.

description: It's a pretty nice venue for a Thai place. Food was decent and service was mediocre. For Thai food, it did take a bit longer to get our food served. The staff is okay but a bit distant. Overall I would recommend trying it out at least once.
author: Ray A.

description:
Basil Thai is like your favorite pair of jeans.
 
Good for hanging with friends, family, or a date.  Also great for grabbing a drink or a bite at the bar, having a casual weeknight dinner, or being out and about on a Saturday night.  But every time, you are comfy and looking fly! 
 
I hadn't been to Basil Thai in awhile but I am happy to report that they've still got it going on!  The eats are consistently good, contain fresh ingredients, are inexpensive, nicely presented, and the portions are a good size.  Also, the service is friendly and attentive and the decor is nice (modern but casual).  
 
On my most recent visit, we started off with the Som Tum (green papaya salad with peanuts, lime, garlic and tomatoes).  Tasty but a bit too spicy for me.  I love the spicy (hello I'm Korean, it's genetic) but here I thought it overpowered the salad. 
 
I ordered one of my staples, Pad Seew (rice noodles, meat or tofu, egg, Chinese broccoli) and it was good as per usual.  A LOT of garlic in this dish (which I love) but a little greasy this time.  I also tried the Basil's Eggplant (Asian eggplant, tofu, mushrooms, scallions) which I also liked.  My friend ordered it spicy and they definitely hooked it up. 
 
For dessert, we had the Sweet Sticky Rice with Fresh Mango and it was perfect.  The mango was the right amount of ripeness and the sweet rice had little toasted grains of rice sprinkled on top and a sprig of mint on the side.  Hands down one of the best desserts I've had in recent memory.  (This is saying a lot especially since it didn't have any chocolate in it!)
author: Amy C.

description: The food is very good, and very classic. Service was great, our waiter was very sweet and nice. We got the Chicken kebab to share, and just a few tai iced teas to talk over. The chicken was very moist, and the sauce went together really well with the flavour of the chicken. Drinks were mediocre, nothing special, but still pretty good
author: Zoe S.

description:
The restaurant is very clean and service is pretty good, except the Thai guy who took our order was a bit snappy with a chip on his shoulder. We put our order in and we asked if that was enough food and he said rather condescendingly, "Well, I don't know how hungry you are."  The bus boy and the hostess was very polite and accomodating however. We never saw the waiter again, but the bus boy got our water, our food, and the other hostess brought us our bill. Good call. 

Food here is pretty descent. They bring out shrimp chips instead of bread. They're deep fried rice crackers flavored with shrimp. They were very light and airy. I remember eating these back home in Hawaii when I was a kid. 

We ordered a pad thai, green papaya salad, fried shirmp and pork dumplings, a bbq meat dish with citris, and panag curry. They were a little skimpy on the beef in the panang curry, and I was expecting it in a red curry sauce, but the flavor was spot on. All the flavors were very good, and I was so stuffed at the end.
author: Kenson K.

description:
This was our first visit here.  We first had our appetizer which was the rati bread with green curry.  This was very tasty. For my entree, I ordered garlic basil noodles with seafood and vegetables.  It unfortunately lacked flavor.  I asked for some red chili spice. It became slightly better.  My one friend ordered a lamb dish.  She seemed to enjoy it.  My other friend ordered the eggplant with green curry.  

The green curry seems to be a hit at this place.  Maybe I just didn't order one of the good items on the menu.  Our drinks were good, we had mango cosmos.  They had a lot of flavor.

The atmosphere is okay. I think if you work in the neighborhood or live close by, its a good place to visit for drinks., and appetizers. Unfortunately, I probably wouldn't come back.  There are so many Thai restaurants to choose from in SF with delicious food and beautiful ambiance.
author: Dannash M.

description: Great Thai food with not your typical flare. The flavor most of all is great and the seasoning is just right. Definately a place I will again.
author: P C.

description:
I honestly don't think I've eaten at any other thai places after eating here. Excuse my language but this place is muy delicioso. Everything I've had here has been good but the must haves are:

Pineapple fried rice
Pad Kee Mao

If you ask for spicy you will get spicy. If you ask for extra spicy then get a side of milk with your meal. And if you do what my friends and I did and ordered something extra extra spicy, then please call the food network channel because shit is about to go down and you deserve to be on Man vs. Food. They should make it some sort of challenge where you win a t shirt for your efforts. I literally couldn't eat my crab fried rice extra extra spicy but if you know me, I love the spice. I ate approximately 1 grain at a time while lathering my tongue in ice water. Would definitely do it again. 

EAT HERE




One tiny thing that annoys me here is that the waiter always forgets to hang up the phone so I can't make my to go orders... C'mon dude..
author: William L.

description: Love this place. Great service and when I was on my vegan diet they removed all eggs and animal products from the dish I wanted! Prices are very fair for the portions and quality. I'll be back
author: Alex K.

description:
Delicious.

We were craving Thai food and decided to try this place out for dinner on a Friday night. This place gets busy so I would definitely recommend reservations. Cozy atmosphere, a tad upscale yet still very casual. Grab a drink at the bar while you're waiting for a table! Service was friendly and polite. The food:

(Chicken Satay + Peanut Sauce)   Good, chicken was juicy and the peanut sauce was delicious. A nice appetizer.

(Pad Se-ew)   Always a staple dish for me. Delicious. Flavorful without being overly oily. Good balance of ingredients. Satisfying!

(Pad Ke-mao)  Tasty! I really liked the chili sauce on this dish which had a nice spice to it. Both noodle dishes tasted similar, so in the future I would not order both together. Portions are filling, we had tons of leftovers.

I'll definitely be back.
author: Ashley K.

description:
A friend of Sir Nicholas and mine works all summer long guiding trips of people around the country. Essentially he takes about a dozen or so people all over from the Pacific Northwest to Vegas to Grand Canyon, sometimes they camp and sometimes they stay in the cities. He happened to pass through town recently and was staying the night so we met up with him and a dozen strangers for dinner at Basil Thai one evening.

Basil Thai was actually pretty accommodating. We only had to wait about 10 minutes for a table, our order was taken painlessly and the food came quickly. All in all it was smooth eating for a large group.

I had some of a green papaya salad that was spicy and magnificent. And for dinner I opted for beef with steamed veggies, trying to eat a little healthy. The beef came with a peanut sauce that I really enjoyed and I would definitely come back here again for dinner.

The only downer was they refused to do split checks, even with advance notice, and couldn't take more than 4 cards on one check. Not a big deal if you're eating with a group you know, but with a large group of solo travelers it was a bit of a hassle.
author: Tiffany N.

description: Basil is the best Thai restaurant in SOMA. I agree. Food is 5-star, price 4 star, service  3 star - we waited long for everything.
author: Cecille C.

description:
GREAT THAI FOOD!!

Nice setting, easy parking (Monday night),good service. Thai food is often heavy, even greasy, but not here.  Very light and fresh with good use of spices and fresh vegetables. Try the curry salmon.  I will return.
author: James M.

description:
Almost went back to Super Duper Burgers for a quick protein fix, but so glad I decided to diversify and chose Basil Thai instead.  Was so going to order the pineapple fried rice but some dude Kevin L's review said that Stuffed Eggplant was the "Best dish".  Best dish you say?  I like me some eggplant, and I like me some stuffed.  Let's see what others have to say, I said?

And the reviews of the stuffed eggplant were very high.  So I placed my to-go order and said "okay, let's go find the place!" to which I did not do my homework and had to walk over a mile through dark shady areas where homeless people shouted at me as I jogged by with my earbuds in.  The restaurant itself is not in a shady area, shadiness was just along the path that I apparently chose.

The staff was nice, my food was ready right away, and they even let me know that they don't think the bus takes credit card.  So I did the Uber thing for the first time and that just rocked, nice clean car, gentleman with an entertaining foreign accent, I just needed him to say the word "family" and it would've been complete.  But this isn't a review for Uber. 

Got back to my hotel and was sad that the to-go order did NOT include utensils.  I guess they assumed that I was going "to go" somewhere that had a fork and knife.  Fortunately my hotel accommodated, and it was time.  And I was hungry.

One bite of the stuffed eggplant and the first thing in my head was "OMG this eggplant is BANANAS.  You know how good it is?  So good it's going to make me actually post a review on yelp for the first time in forever!"  Then I thought "saying bananas about a dish with no bananas may be misleading, hopefully bananas doesn't show up in the review aggregator".

But anyway this one dish that I bought for myself was damn good.  I don't know what the rest of their menu is about but I don't care right now, I'd go back and get this AGAIN.  The veggies they included in it are great too, I think I identified zucchini, red peppers, maybe other stuff too but it's drenched in delicious green curry so I couldn't identify it.  I probably didn't need to order the rice since the dish itself was pretty filling for one person on its own.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED: at least the stuffed eggplant dish.  Oh and the brown rice is like a wild rice, if you're into that.  I feel healthy eating it, and it's good.
author: Steve L.

description:
I love thai food. Other than Sushi, i can spend the rest of my life eating thai food every day. Ok...well maybe not everyday...but perhaps every other day and alternate the other consecutive days eating sushi (which is my other favorite! )

So with Thai food in mind, i must say I really enjoy Basil Thai Restaurant & Bar. Its a very comfy place for great food and great company. A few girlfriends treated me to a  birthday dinner there before, I've  been on a dinner date there before going to a party, and also celebrated a reunion dinner with childhood friends there as well. And all those times, the restaurant was always very accommodating. Although each occasion consisted of last minute reservations, we were always seated in a timely manner where our party never had to wait too long.

With Thai food, i usually order the same dish. It's either yellow curry with steam rice or pad thai. And both dishes are very tasty at Basil Thai. However, i should probably broaden my horizons because i'm sure this restaurant has more more to offer with the other dishes on their menu.

My friend (who lives 2 blocks away from the restaurant) mentioned to me that she literally goes there Thursday evenings just to order a dessert plate which is the slightly fried bananas served with coconut ice cream. Yummmmm.....i love this as well! If i still lived in the city, i would probably stop by every thursday night for this dessert as well! 

The location is great because you can find parking on 8th street and just walk to the restaurant. And after dinner, you can always stop by a neighboring bar in SOMA such as Ravens Bar or Bloodhound for a drink!
author: Karla M.

description: Bad service n food is totally over price!! Even king of Thai is better than them!!!!!!!!! I will never go back.......
author: V L.

description:
I stumbled upon Basil Thai while waiting in the rain for the bus to arrive. This restaurant was definitely a pleasant surprise (and a nice respite from the rain) because I was not expecting to find such an affordable and tasty Thai restaurant in the middle of SOMA. I'll definitely be back to try other dishes!

Shrimp Chips - complimentary appetizer that were really good. i wished i'd asked for more.

Eggplant Green curry ($11) - this was definitely different than your average green curry. There are slivers of eggplant wrapped around green curry, with plenty of basil leaves, bell peppers, and zucchini rounding out the dish. The green curry is thicker here than most other green curries I've had. The brown rice ($2) we ordered to go with this dish was more like the Korean-style brown rice than your traditional brown rice.

Pad See Ew ($10) - Yum, I would definitely order this again! The flavors were perfect and portion enough to feed 2 girls or one really hungry girl.
author: Jennifer W.

description: The best Thai in the city. Better than Lers Ros.  Get the pork shoulder, short ribs, and spicy beef pan fried noodles.
author: Julie N.

description:
Best Thai food in SF! Seriously, great atmosphere and great food. Don't miss the jungle beef green curry here, it's awesome! Really nothing on this menu is bad, it's all great, so it's hard to go wrong.

Great for a birthday, date, or special occasion for sure. The bar is pretty awesome to eat at as well.
author: Sonya S.

description: One of our local favorites.  My boyfriend and I go hear when we want a simple occasion-restaurant experience that's not too expensive and not far from home.  Great basil and chili noodles as well as meat skewers for appetizers.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Super over-priced and Americanized.  With so many other Thai food choices in the bay area, I don't get why people like this place.  Yeah, I guess the decor is nice .. but that's about it.
I mean, the food wasn't terrible, it just wasn't good and certainly not worth the price.
I had the pad thai, green curry and some pork and crab appetizer that was pretty much a fried greasy dumpling.
Oh and one thing that really bugged me was that they don't have the tray of hot sauces and peanuts.
Meh, indeed!
author: Michele S.

description:
Elegant inside, but prices not overly high either. Main courses range from $9-$12. Surprisingly have never had to make a reservation during lunch. One of the few nicer restaurants in the area to take guests to.

The pad thai was good, the fire calamari just ok. There weren't that many pieces of calamari. My friend's pineapple fried rice was a whole lot bigger.

Don't recall much about the service, but seems like there's a lot of mixed feelings about that. Will see if I notice anything next time.
author: An Y.

description:
This review is primarily for the two rude hostesses working last Fri night.  

The BF and I were given a 10 minute estimate for a table in the half-empty restaurant, so we waited at the bar.  Despite only 3 others being seated at the bar, the bartender didn't acknowledge us until a busboy pointed us out.  The hostesses seated two other couples that had come in after us.
