Ok, maybe they had reservations.  We flagged down Hostess 1, who replied "Oh, you want a table?" and said it'd be another 15 min for a table to clear.  WTF?  

We waited another 15 minutes.  We ordered appetizers, then our entrees.   Another couple came in and was seated.  Both hostesses continued to ignore us, so we flagged down Hostess 2.  She said a table was being cleared.  We waited some more. 

Halfway through our entrees, I stopped Hostess 2 to ask if we'd ever get a table.  Her reply: "You want a table?" WTF? pt. two. Were we being punished for unknowingly committing some diner's faux paux?  

When we were finally seated (40 minutes into the ordeal), the hostess brought everything except my plate.  After that, we gave up and decided to express our frustrations on Yelp.

Good:  The hostess treatment was odd, especially given that the wait staff while we were seated were awesome-- very attentive & courteous.  The ambiance was nice for a dressy-casual date/group dinner.

Food:  Disappointing.  We were really hungry and are generally easy to please. Also, I'll put up with rude service if the food is awesome. So we wanted to like it, but everything was just so bland.  Crab fried rice tasted like cheap Chinese food (which is cool, if you ordered something cheap & Chinese).  It was also blazing hot, like it'd just been microwaved.  Chicken satay appetizer was standard ok.  Curry salmon was overcooked and rubbery.  

Based on the quality of the food and the service, Basil is overpriced. Bill was $55 for a tiny appetizer and 2 entrees.
author: Dagmar H.

description:
*On our quest to try 52 new places in 52 weeks.* 

We came here around 8:30 on a Friday night and I'm so glad that we made a reservation earlier in the day. This place was packed with a line to boot. We were sat in the back, ordered some beers, and settled in. We ordered the "Thai Spiced Corn Fritters" and the "Golden Pouches of Crab" because the titles alone sound delicious and both came with cucumbers (my fav). The hubs ordered something with beef I'm sure, I don't remember, and I had the pumpkin curry which was delicious. Beware- it's a LOT of food. Being on our third or fourth beer over a few hours coupled with a long week made us exhausted (I thought the hubs was going to keel over) so we ate until we were full and brought a lot of leftovers home. 

Excellent service, excellent food, will absolutely come back!
author: Melissa N.

description: This place wasn't bad, but the description "Meh. I've experienced better" definitely fits. Maybe it was just the dish I ordered (corn fritters to start and a green curry), but it was on the bland side and nothing special... It tasted like something I could have made at home, and I am not a chef nor Thai. The meal didn't compare to plenty of cheaper of Thai places I've been to in Berkeley. I won't be coming back.
author: Claire K.

description:
This place is amazing. Truly the best Thai I've ever had. And I've been eating Thai frequently for 20 years. The fact that it's a block away from my new office is like a wink from the Universe. I should probably set up auto-pay from my bank account because there's going to be a heavy flow in their direction.

If you like seafood, you've got to try their Kang Talay. I literally had it for lunch and dinner yesterday. Kind of wondering if it's legal.
author: Jesse E.

description: The service was 5-star but the food was a 1-star. I had the crab fried (brown) rice with added egg. It was very lackluster and completely lacked any noticeable seasoning. Also, there was a very small amount of crab in the dish. However, My dinner companions loved their dishes so I will assume I simply picked incorrectly.
author: Patricia L.

description:
I lived a few blocks from this place for at least 7 years and never tried out this place. Now I know I may have missed a lot since I moved from the SOMA district about 7 yrs ago.

My BIL was in town and wanted to try an Asian restaurant for dinner with the fam. Because we don't want to worry about parking, I chose to try this place out.

The place was almost empty on a Monday early dinner.
We got seated right away and was greeted warmly.

I ordered Lychee saketini and the mango cocktail.  Saketini with pureed Lychee wasn't good at all, Mango cocktail was awesome.
For apps: we got corn fritters, calamari and dumplings.. they were pretty good except the calamari which was bland.
Our entrees: pad thai, turnips, some spicy pork shoulder, short ribs panang and sizzling beef.... all of them were really good but the turnips were surprisingly awesome.
Deserts: roti and fried banana.. awesome.

The place was clean, not too loud.
Service was pretty good.
Food awesome, price decent. (although would be nice for bigger portions).

Will have to come back.
author: Learnee L.

description:
This place is great!  The Panang short ribs seriously make me drool.....I'm drooling right now, actually!!

If you work or live in SoMa, you should definitely hit this place up for some tasty Thai food, in a place that's cleaner and a little more upscale than your average Thai place....
author: Michelle D.

description:
Yum! I prefer this one more than Basil Canteen even though everyone says the owner is the same and the similar menus. 

Recommend: crab fried rice (it's got real chunks of crab) 

The spare rib curry (the meat is sooo the tender) 

It is somewhat pricy since you don't get a lot with your food. BUT, i believe quality over quantity. Love this place!
author: Tina S.

description:
I've been here twice and I love it everytime. 

I tried their Mango cosmo cocktail..delicious!
Their spicy catfish, yellow curry are to die for. 
Also for dessert, try their fried bananas with coconut icecream!
author: Miri L.

description: Good tastes, fresh ingredients, simple atmosphere and presentation combine to make a decent meal in a place that would be suitable for a business meal. The only downside was that a request for extra tofu (for which I agreed to pay) resulted in four tiny cubes.
author: C M.

description: Great food, easily 3 stars and a 4-star pad Thai -- but the venue management has some SERIOUS issues to sort out. Firstly, I went to the bathroom and someone had vomited all over the toilet - disgusting. Secondly, my Coke had a distinct bleach taste about it. I drink a lot of Coke, even post-mix and this was NOT NORMAL. Disappointed because I had heard great things.
author: Simon W.

description:
I was impressed by the ambiance at Basil Thai. It was fancy yet comfortable, and the service was great. Honestly, I was expecting higher prices! You will likely pay an extra dollar or two for your entree as compared to your standard hole-in-the-wall Thai place, but no more. It's well worth it.

I tasted the pad se-ew and the panang short ribs. Both were great, though the panang really stood out --- the combination of the beef and curry flavors was a real winner. UPDATE: went back a second time, this time got the roast duck curry and the spicy wide rice noodles. Both were excellent. This place is a real winner.

It's a nice restaurant to take a date, and I'll definitely be coming back (again!)
author: Laurent L.

description:
My favorite Thai place in the city. I thought I was in trouble when I was on a date with someone that was allergic to gluten, thankfully they have a gluten free menu. 


The waitress was really nice and had good recommendations. I ended up getting the chicken stuffed eggplant in curry. It had to be the best thing on the menu by far . 

They cook a little on the safe side so even "Thai hot" isn't very spicy but it is super good.
author: Mark Y.

description:
Came here with a family member while they vacationed in SF. The service was slow but the food was great.  Been to a few Thai spots in the city and this place is up bear the top of the list. Had the Indian bread with peppers spinach and green curry for appetizer. Wow it was tasty. 

My entree was spot on, the service wS great an the price was relatively inexpensive. Altogether a great experience, will be back.
author: Tom L.

description: We went in a group of 10 for my boyfriend's birthday and we all had a great time. All the dishes we ordered were good, but the catfish really stood out. My only complaint is that the food could have been spicier, considering it's a Thai restaurant
author: Tanya R.

description:
Wow I rated them a 4 about five years ago. Well I don't know what happened to Basil Thai because the other night I didn't quite have the same experience. 2.5 stars and I was thinking about bumping them up to a 3 but the 2 star  description of "Meh. I've experienced better" pretty much sums up my dining experience to a T. Maybe I was expecting a lot more b/c of the rave reviews...I don't know but all I know is that I was pretty disappointed.

First of all, don't say that there is no wait, to come on in when a customer calls in to ask what the wait time is for 2 people. We were starving and when we walked in minutes later (we live nearby) and there were several people waiting near the front benches. They told us they are waiting for other diners to finish their meal before we were seated. At that point, we ended up just staying as we had parked and it was freezing outside. But I was definitely irked to say the least. We probably waited a good amount of time enough to be irked because they flat out lied or the person just never bothered checking.

My other issue with dinner that night was that our side dish or veggie fried rice tasted like FISH. They either did not wash the utensils or the pan when stir frying the fried rice but I immediately tasted some fishiness in my dish. Gross when you're not expecting to taste fish. What if I was allergic? Even their curry dish lacked flavor and it was just not a good quality tasty dish that I've had from other Thai restaurants. 

Service was attentive and the waitress/hostess was very friendly. I think that was pretty much the only redeeming quality of our experience that night.
author: Esther A.

description:
I went here for a friend's going-away party that she threw. We had a reservation for 22 people (yeah, it was a super LONG table) and a set menu of 2 appetizers and 5 entrees and rice, for $26 per person including tax/tip. Pretty good deal for a nice restaurant and that much food, I would say...

The restaurant is small but decor is beautiful. As soon as I walked in, I felt underdressed. But then I looked at some of the people eating, and when I saw many of them dressed casually, I felt better (until my friend's other guests starting showing up in their clubbing attire). Our table was very nicely set, with candles, even.

The following was our menu and my comments on each (See photos for pictures of each):

STARTERS 
1. gai sate: marinated chicken grilled on bamboo skewers served with peanut sauce 
   * I thought this was good, especially the peanut sauce!

2. Basil's rolls sampler: crispy rice paper wrapped tiger prawns + crispy spring rolls stuffed with vermicelli and cabbage, served with sweet dipping sauce
   * I didn't like this so much, but I only had the spring rolls (didn't realize there were two kinds of rolls on the platter). I really didn't like the dipping sauce, so I used the peanut sauce from the other appetizer and it made it a little better.

MAIN COURSE 
3. pad thai: rice stick noodles with prawns, tofu, beansprouts and chive
   * Mediocre. I've had better pad thai even at the fast food thai place in Berkeley! (incidentally, called Thai Basil...lol)
 
4. pak rad kang: charbroiled oriental eggplant, zucchini, squash, and tomatoes in creamy curry sauce (*spicy*) 
   * Actually, the curry sauce turned me off so I didn't try this. Sorry. Didn't hear anything exciting from other people though, except from the people who really hate spicy foods.

5. tamarind prawns: light battered prawns wok tossed in spicy tamarind with crisp shallots and garlic 
   * OMG!!! THIS WAS SOOOO DELICIOUS! Thankfully the plate was right in front of me and I kept taking more...hopefully everyone still got their share lol. It's not spicy at all, despite the "spicy tamarind" in the description.

6. gai-kra-prow: minced chicken sauted with fresh chili, basil and oriental eggplant (*spicy*)
   * This was ok. The minced chicken looked like ground beef (which is what everyone thought it was), and the eggplant wasn't too bad (but I'm not a big fan of eggplant). Slightly spicy in my trained-in-Korea tastebuds' opinion.

7. param-rungsong: grilled marinated skirt steak topped with peanut sauce 
    * DELICIOUS. I couldn't decide whether I liked this steak more or the prawns. They do a great job on the peanut sauce, I'd say. The steak was super tender and juicy, not dry at all. They were cut in pretty small strips though.

8. steamed jasmine rice 
    * Can't really screw this one up. Jasmine rice has always been my favorite type of rice.

I give 3 stars because I only really liked 2.5 out of the 7 dishes we had (rice doesn't count). The others were okay, but the price was pretty good for a dinner that contains a filling sampler of so many different dishes.

Random other tidbits:
Parking [street] is interesting. Before going, I checked yelp for parking reviews (just did a keyword search for "parking" on this page) and things looked pretty bleak. We decided to drive anyways and found a spot on the same block as the restaurant. Everyone else in our party seemed to have little trouble with parking. It was hard to tell whether our spot was legal since it looked like the sidewalk had been painted different colors at different times and it was all chipped off anyways. Other people were parked there so we figured it'd be ok - I guess it was since nobody got any tickets!

Bathrooms were single-occupancy only. Kinda annoying if you're a girl - pretty much have to wait every time, but it's a small restaurant so the line never gets that big. They have clever postcards for you to look at (and take) while you're waiting.

Watch out for your jacket - the chairs are not designed for hanging jackets and they slip off easily. There's also 4 coat hangers in the back.

Oh, I forgot this is a Thai restaurant. From eating at a couple other Thai restaurants with my friends from Thailand, I'm pretty sure this isn't very authentic. Some dishes are pretty good and it's a nice restaurant, but don't decide your like or dislike for true Thai food based on this experience.
author: Esther Y.

description: I had the mu yang (grilled pork shoulder) and the short ribs in curry (panang short ribs), both of which were great - I definitely recommend them. This was take-out so no comments from me on the service, but the interior did look like a place I would want to take in a meal with friends.
author: Michael L.

description:
I am a sucker for Khao Soi, it's one of those dishes you can't find at every Thai restaurant. Even though it wasn't on the dinner menu, the kitchen still whipped it up and it hit the spot just right.

Portions are fairly large. The restaurant is really clean and got a great atmosphere. Service is very good. I'll definitely be returning to try more stuff.
author: Sylvia W.

description: I've been going there for years.  It's always delicious, exceptional and reliable, using fresh and high quality ingredients. The service is always helpful and friendly. The best thing is that it's somewhat quiet, so good for casual meetings with out of town colleagues and parking available within a block.
author: Debbie L.

description: This was our last dinner before leaving for home, and I was certainly looking forward to it based on the reviews.  The evening started out with prompt and attentive service.  We ordered our favorite appetizer, Spicy Fish Cakes.  For our main course, my wife selected the Grilled Sea Bass Fillet.  I had the Thai Pineapple Fried Rice, substituting chicken for the prawns.  The appetizer was delicious and had me in full anticipation for the main course.  Wow, what a let down.  While my wife's dish was very nice, mine was very poor.  The chicken had no seasoning and had no taste.  I actually had to use my wife's green curry sauce to make the chicken palatable.  Very disappointed, especially as I had barely eaten all day, anticipating gorging on quality Thai food.  As it turned it out, it was just sustenance as I was starving and I have a strict policy about returning food at a restaurant.  At the end of the day I could not give a lower rating as my wife's dish was very nice, as were the Spicy Thai Fish Cakes.
author: Lester G.

description: Went there for dinner last night and after seeing how highly it was rated we were very hopeful but sadly were a little disappointed.  If you're looking for some Thai food with a kick, this is not the place for you.  The staff and ambiance were great and the food was good but we both felt the chef forgot the spice. Not bad but nothing to write home about.
author: Miriam S.

description: I recently hosted a birthday dinner here (25 ppl) and it was great. I highly recommend this place for large groups. They were very accommodating with my allergy requirements, I have Celiac's, they made almost everything on the prefix menu gluten-free. At the same time they made things egg free for one of the other guests and cilantro free for yet another allergy in the group. And a lot if it was vegetarian friendly for another guest.  The food was delicious and the overall cost was very reasonable (about 40 per person including drinks, tip etc).
author: Lisa L.

description: Came here for a date and she loved the atmosphere! Food is great and prices are extremely reasonable. Lots of good veggie options.
author: Adam G.

description:
I recently came here for a work dinner. They were very accommodating to our large group and didn't even mind when we changed our reservation time at the last minute to an hour earlier. Overall the food was pretty good and the prices were reasonable. The marinated lamb fillets and spicy catfish and eggplant are very tasty. The garlic noodles were a little disappointing since they weren't very garlicy. I was also expecting them to be thicker egg noodles but they were think and curly. They had a nice level of spiciness though. The sticky rice is not flavorful and is a bit too hard so I would recommend just getting jasmine or brown. For dessert the panna cotta was okay but a little too soft. Everyone who got the fried banana with ice cream loved it.

Overall not bad for a nicer thai restaurant although I still like osha thai more. This restaurant's location is also a little isolated and not in the nicest area.
author: Alice J.

description:
How have i not reviewed Basil Thai yet?!?!?

If you take me for a date here, there will definitely be a 2nd date...  the Pad See Ew is my favorite thing ever, but there was some pumpkin dish we had and it may have knocked my champion noodles out of 1st place...  

I better go back to make sure...   anyone feel like treating?
author: Phoenix D.

description:
Simply the best, most authentic, and, in general, most affordable Thai food in San Francisco. A must try for any foodie or lover of Thai cuisine. 

 My favorite dishes are their Pad Thai, Garlic Rice with Pork with a fried egg on top(ask for their red hot sauce, it goes perfect with the rice dishes), Tom Yum, Tom Kha, Seafood Fried Rice, and the Roast Duck Noodle. If you have a wide palate, you will not regret getting any of these choices.
author: Kent T.

description:
Nice Thai place with easy parking in the area. The space is nice too - contemporary with exposed beams, brick, etc. I can see it being a good place for a low key group dinner too. 

We ordered the crab fried rice, pork belly and chinese broccoli, and crispy catfish. My fave was the catfish. BF liked the rice. Overall, a nice selection of dishes, nice interior, and decent prices. Service was fine too. We were here on a weeknight so it was easy getting seated.
author: Veronica H.

description: I came here one evening for a friend birthday's dinner and the food at this restaurant is really Delicious. My first choice here would be crab fried rice. The rice was full of crab flavor and usually most restaurant is too cheap to add more crabs.  Secondly would be Pad Kee Mao, Indian bread with eggplants, Shrimp Pad thai, stuff eggplants, and red curry with duck. One thing I don't like about this restaurant is there is only one restroom for men, and one for women. I can't imagine emergency situation that someone is stuck in the bathroom for a long time . But regardless, I would definitely come here again.
author: Aniko N.

description:
Service here was lackluster and indifferent at best.  I expected so much better because the restaurant's space is gorgeous, on a great street with after-dinner venues for cocktails like Raven and Bloodhound.  The hostess who seated us was very confused, at first tried to take us to a table that was still occupied and let us stand around awkwardly before ushering us back down the entire length of the restaurant to wait for a table...when there were several open two-tops ready.

Busboys were very attentive with water but it took over 30 minutes for any waiter to show up to take our order.  It was unclear the entire time who was actually assigned to our table because at least three different waitstaff and possibly a manager brought our food/drinks, service was inconsistent.  At one point, after a disappointingly small bottle of sake for $8, my friend asked for the wine list again and that was never brought to us despite repeated requests.

The food itself: I have absolutely had better at probably a hundred Thai restaurants elsewhere in the Bay Area and on the East Coast--the greasy, paltry roti and beef curry actually made me pine for Penang in Cambridge, MA because Basil Thai's version is weak as hell.  Pan-fried dumplings appetizer was okay, as much as pan-fried dumplings anywhere are always good by their very nature.  The pad-see-ew was VERY bland and definitely needed a good hit of soy sauce and black pepper to punch it back to life as leftovers the next day.  

Overall, we felt fairly ignored as a two-top while the larger tables had attentive service and the food was mediocre.  Sorry, Basil Thai--try harder and perform to the quality of your lovely ambiance!
author: Karen R.

description:
The four star review is solely for the green curry we had: stuff eggplant with chicken in green curry was really good!  It was different from most green curries at other Thai restaurants. It was very creamy, (maybe a little more sauce would be perfect) and very spicy too!!!  We didn't finish the dish at the restaurant, and when we heated it up the next day, it was still really yummy!!!!  (if anything, yummier, b/c the rice was packed with the curry as left-over, so the rice soaked up all the curry flavor!!!) 

3 stars:

pad-thai:  nothing too special, and I find the noodles were a little too tough (could use another minute of cooking).

lamb skewers: it was not bad.  the sauce was a bit too sweet for me.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
We ordered some noodle dishes and they were terrible!  The noodles were too over cooked and ended up being extremely soggy.  Flavor wasn't there either.
 The atmosphere is good but that's about it.
author: Margaret S.

description:
It was my friends bday and she decided to come here. I remembered passing this place a bunch of times so it was good that I finally got to check it out.

Atmosphere is really nice. Dim lighting. Fancy for a Thai place. I ordered the Mango Cosmo which was delish and strong. I got the somtum which is the papaya salad. Refreshing and yummy. I sampled off my friends which included pad thai, pad see ew, duck curry, and tom yum gai. 

Overall it is a pretty decent place. Nothing to rave about but it wasn't bad either. Not a higher rating because I have had better and I am spoiled with a Thai auntie :)

3 stars.
author: Angela D.

description:
Overall I had a good experience here.  Came here to catch up with an old friend, and upon entering we were seated immediately and taken care of well throughout service.  Our water glasses were neurotically filled, and I half expected to take a sip of water and set it down fuller than when I picked it up.   They are that quick.

I ordered the Coconut braised pork shoulder and 'kabocha' pumpkin in tangy red curry (kang kua mu), and was very happy with it.  I am usually disappointed by the spice level of my food at thai establishments, so this time I gave our server a very intense look when I told her I wanted my food spicy, metaphorically grabbing her by the collar and pulling her in close to give her the idea that though I may be tall and white, when I ask for spice, I mean SPICE.  

She delivered spice, and the interplay between the thai chili, red curry, and pork shoulder was amazing!  The pumpkin was a great touch, and I really enjoyed the dish on top of some sticky rice.  

Overall a great spot!
author: Drew M.

description: Food 3 stars, service 1 star. Definitely not the best thai food I've had. Went there on a busy Saturday night for my friend's birthday. The head waitress made us feel guilty of being there. She would walk away before taking everyone's drink order, came twice within 10 mins after we sat down to take our food order, and looked pissed when we weren't ready, only smiled when she gave us the check. Yes you have a lot of customers so you can count me out from now on.
author: Viola W.

description:
The area has an abundance of thai food, in which this was not the most spectacular. They do have a quick set lunch type deal for $14 I believe. 

Our party of four had the potstickers for starters. The outside skin was a bit thick and came with a soy dipping sauce. I had the green curry with vegetables which on the menu notes that it comes "medium spicy". I guess I have a high tolerance for spice, so I did not notice any kick and asked for some dry chili on the side. It came with rice but no tofu or soup. The portion was just right. I kind of wished they separated the curry and rice rather than slathering the curry over the rice on a plate. 

There also was no wait for a table. If you're in a hurry and don't want to wait a while for a table I guess this would be a good option.
author: Stine H.

description:
My friend and I came here last Tuesday to experience some fine Thai food and we were not let down! Our server was attentive and took our drink and appetizer order. He returned shortly after with my thai iced tea. 

We started off with the porpia sod. Fresh rolls of vegetables & tofu served with crushed peanuts, chili, lime vinaigrette. Yum!!! The vinaigrette was amazing, as were the rolls. I could have eaten 12. 

My friend is vegetarian so we decided to split two main dishes. Basil's eggplant and the kang kua gai which we substituted tofu for the chicken. Here's where the -1 star comes in. It took quite awhile to get our main dishes and the customer service went downhill after that.

The main dishes were AMAZING. I mean seriously some of the best I've ever had. With the exception of Thai Orchid in South Lake Tahoe. The pumpkin curry was perfect. It could have been spicier, but the pumpkin was cooked to perfection. YUM!

The eggplant main dish was also fantastic. The basil-chili puree was perfection when mixed with the eggplant and shitake mushrooms with scallions. I could have eaten both main dishes by themselves, but I'm so glad I got to try both!

Overall, the food was amazing. I wish the customer service was on par with it, but unfortunately that was not the case. I would definitely recommend Basil Thai and I will be back for sure!
author: Kari M.

description: Service leaves a little to be desired, but the food is absolutely great. Really enjoyed the Duck Curry Puff Pastries.
author: Marco W.

description:
FANTASTIC Thai! I had the unconventional pork shoulder red curry and it basically melted in my mouth. They must have had it slow-cooking for days to get it that tender and flavorful.

The service was friendly, courteous, and very fast. Highly recommend.
author: Riley S.

description:
Let me start by saying that a year ago I did have a quite good meal here.  My husband and I decided to do an impromptu dinner out and remembered the ingredients being really fresh. Unfortunately, that now seems like a distant memory. 

On this visit, the potstickers wrappers had a strange texture, like they had been partially fried once, sat around, and were reheated after we ordered them. The potsticker filling was gristly even compared to supermarket freezer potstickers standards. My fish wrapped in banana leaf was so tough and overlooked that I really couldn't cut it with a regular table knife. The vegetables in my husbands curry were overlooked and mushy, and his meat overcooked and tough.

The positives? The waitress was very friendly and efficient despite the restaurant being busy.  The coconut juice was delicious.  The presentation of the food was very nice.
author: Kraig M.

description:
I really like the food here! My favourite Thai place in the city so far. I've come here a few times on a weekday night, and it's never too busy (so no need to make a reservation - though haven't tried the weekend). Service is good and food is quick. The curry is amazing and portion size is decent.

This will be my go-to Thai place.
author: Yan K.

description:
My go-to thai spot. The food here is outstanding. Be careful if you request your food to be spicy though, because it's no joke. I like to takeout form here, because it usually only takes 15 minutes, and it still tastes really good. 

Best dish: Stuffed Eggplant, Pad Kee Mao, any of the curries
Food: 5/5 stars
Ambiance: Casual, clean
Price: 15/person 
Service: I normally do takeout, but they're nice
author: Kevi L.

description:
Shrimp crackers as appetizers. Tasty round things that I haven't had since my last peking duck nom session. Prices are decent and lower than I expected. We got the golden pouches to start. The weird thing about dishes like this is that you can never tell what the meat is inside though I guess it doesn't  matter since it's fried? Shrimp pad thai was mighty tasty and I wish it were bigger! Duck curry was standard and the chunks of pineapple were a nice addition. Whatever we got for our third entree (enough for four people) was tasty, but confusing. It had a few pieces of little eggplant, and then a big scramble of chicken bits.

Also, right next door to Dragon. Somehow I never noticed this place.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Top 3 Thai spots in the city.

My man Domingo at the bar always looks after us. They have Trummer Pils on tap and usually an NBA game on TV if he's behind the bar. The spring roles are fantastic and you can't go wrong with the crab fried rice. The vibe is cool and all the staff is really nice. Parking is usually pretty easy and if it's super busy you can go down to Blood Hound and get a proper drink and wait for your table. You can even get carry out here and take it to Blood Hound and eat it there. Great neighborhood spot or destination.
author: Joe B.

description:
The food was really good here! I had the skirt steak and it was amazing. I also recommend the mojito's here, there were delicious. They have a great menu with so many choices of dishes. Great ambiance too.

The wait staff was attentive and quick with the food and drinks,
author: Sophia Z.

description: Food is decent, but they get completely backed up during the lunch hour rush. If you're in a hurry, don't come here.
author: Zal B.

description:
Green Curry = Very good

I'll be back to try other item. Co-worker swears by the Jungle Beef every time he goes there! I'll be back to try more items.
author: John H.

description:
First off, Basil Thai is awkwardly located. The inside feels more like a hallway than a restaurant. With that said, the food left me feeling unmoved.

We started with the curry puffs that seems to be all the rave and the goong gra bog. I can't tell if they're freshly made or if they simply took took them out of the freezer and defrosted.

Fortunately, the main courses felt more substantial. We had the nuer yang (Angus sirloin), kang talay (a seafood curry), crab fried rice and curry peppercorn duck. Nothing was bad but nothing stood out too much either. As I am writing this review, I'm having a hard time remembering the taste of each dish. 

Honorable mention to the Hou Hou Shu (sparkling sake)!
author: Tiffany U.

description: I ordered the Pad see Ew for takeout and it was so yummy! The restaurant itself is on Folsom street and has a modern, cozy feel. I'd definitely come here for Thai food again!
author: Lillian C.

description: Love this place! Best yellow curry and you get a huge portion of chicken! The pad thai is also really tasty!
author: Philip D.

description: We came here based on Yelp reviews and weren't disappointed. The flavors were delectable. We had a salad with minced chicken, lime and mint that was outstanding. The chicken stuffed eggplant and basil lamb curry were both delicious. I can't wait to come back!
author: Susan B.

description:
The food here is delicious.  Service is mediocre.

Get:
Spicy Catfish 
Pork Shoulder

Both had generous servings and tasted great.
author: Steven F.

description:
I love Thai food, but some Thai places are worse than others. Basil Thai is not one of those places. It's delicious. Everything I tasted had a lot of flavor and it was very filling and unique as well.
For starters they brought out complimentary shrimp flavored crispy crackers/rice cakes? Kind of addicting.

Second we ordered the keow wan roti - grilled Indian bread with green curry and oriental eggplant. Amazingly yummy. 

For entrees we got the Tom Ka Gai, and the Basil's Eggplant w/ Brown rice. Both tasted awesome.

I also liked the atmosphere, the friendly servers, and of course my company :)
author: Sonya D.

description: Nice ambiance and good for lunch. Decent Thai fusion food as well (would have given 3.5 stars if it were not for my particular experience). But I was Somewhat unimpressed with the service. I clearly spoke the entire line of my order (~7 words) when I ordered, but when the food came I realized it was not at all what I ordered, in fact it had some items mixed in that I shouldn't eat (some of the few things that cause me indigestion) or don't like too much. But I was hungry and with a group of people from work, so didn't want to sit there not eating so decided to poke at it until the server came. Except she never came to check in on us (this is pretty standard of  wait staff). Once my colleagues were more than half way through their food, I got up to fix my order. When I told the waiter it was the wrong item and again said what I ordered, she was still confused. She clearly did not know what I ordered was on the menu. She still didn't put the order in then and returned to the table to confirm I still wanted the right order and wanted to take the plate in front of me a way. I told her I would pick at it until my food came (so again, I wasn't the awkward one without food). When my food finally did come, everyone had finished eating, so it was still awkward. Not to mention that they added an extra filler to the dish that was not on the menu (I suspect they were running low on the  main ingredient - kabocha squash - because the pieces of it that I got still had green on the edge from the skin). All this could have been tolerated, but when she brought the bill, it had the extra item on it, so I had to get up and request it be removed!! This restaurant may have a nice ambiance, and good food, but it is not exactly a hole in the wall and isn't cheap so I expect them to operate like a proper restaurant and not charge people when the restaurant gets it wrong without being told what they have to do. Needless to say, I appeared like the problem one in the group and did not have as enjoyable a meal as it should have been since so many little things went wrong. I would have dismissed any one of these incidents as a one off but the combination of these events left me feeling dissatisfied and unsure of when I will return.
author: Kai J.

description: I should have followed my rule of never eating at a restaurant named after an ingredient it serves. You'd never eat at an Italian restaurant called, mozzarellas right? Not only did this place run out of fresh spring rolls, the service was absent minded and inattentive. Food was mediocre at best. I know there must be better in San Francisco. So, skip this place and find something different .
author: Melissa W.

description: Went there with my mom best Thai food in the city hands down service is like no other don't cheat yourself treat yourself
author: Charles E.

description: Really nice place, Me and my friend have been there couple days ago, and we really like it. Good atmosphere, friendly stuff and very very delicious food, indian nan and especially Pad Ke Mao my favorite ones;) thanks everything.
author: John M.

description:
Thank you Basil Thai for your utmost patience for my large party.

I initially reserved a table for a party of 20.  And of course for all you asian people out there.. Asian time of half hour ran over for many.. They kept asking us how many more people will be coming with kindness just so that they can offer more tables for incoming customers.  I felt bad but at the same time they were not rude about it at all.  Thank you so much again Basil Thai! We won't do this again to you!

We had a long table in the back of this cute intimate thai restaurant.  The bar is located in the front and the bartender was nice to offer advice on what drinks to get.  As you enter this wooden front of a restaurant, you will enter a dimmed light charming thai setting.  It is spacious with plenty of tables available.  The wait on a saturday night is not even bad since their service is quick and efficient!  

I got the chance to try their pad kee mao ( spicy version of pad see ew ) and it was just the right amount of spicyness to it.  I love thick rice noodles.  I also tried the roti, which came with eggplant ( eww ) but it wasn't as crispy as I would of liked it.  But the right amount of fluffiness indeed!  Also their curry puff balls were delicious!! Duck was inside!! It was great for an appetizer!

I would come back here for a more intimate setting!  Not for a group .. that's for sure!
author: Kathy D.

description: This place is a cute little place! It's pretty dark inside, hard to read the menu, but overall they have good services. The food is actually pretty good and it's not over flavored with sugar. Love the style of the dishes and almost, just almost like home cook food. The curry dished are great and the salad NAMTOK is BOMB!
author: Nayda M.

description: Not vegetarian friendly. Like most thai places even the dishes that lack meat have meat sauce. They made the veggie dish that had a green curry (with fish sauce) into a yellow curry without it and it was great. I wish I had a dessert. However we were uncomfortably sat at the bar because you really do need reservation or endure a 30 minute wait for the tables. Even the corn fritter sauce had fish sauce. They said basically all sauces have it so order accordingly if you are vegetarian. The prices are moderate-pricey it isn't somewhere I would eat every day, more like once a year. The service was good though, and the food is filling.
author: Onika C.

description: I think this is the BEST Thai restaurant in Soma.  Both times I came here, I left wanting more.  I tried their Jungle beef with sitcky rice and also their crispy pork belly with chinese brocoli.  Next time I am getting that crab fried rice.
author: sonya h.

description: We walked in and was told 45 min wait. Then 5 minutes later we were seated. Lol Thank gd because we were hungry and we walked down 7th street which was a nightmare! On to the food... We ordered wide rice noodles, coconut curry chicken, and veggie spring rolls. I ordered my favorite sticky Thai rice on the side with dipping sauce. Everything was absolutely great. Noodles were garlicy and dark soy saucey. Coconut curry was a bit salty but tasty and the Japanese pumpkin that was in it was amazing! The free shrimp crackers are addicting. I will definitely be making those at home. This place is great. I wish it was located in Ft Lauderdale!!
author: Jonathan A.

description: Omg! Yum! Came on a Saturday night and ate at the bar instead of waiting 15 min. for a table (which is not bad at all for no reservation). Excellent service at the bar! Ordered pineapple fried rice and pad ke mao. Pineapple fries rice had great flavor. Just slightly dry. Pad ke mao was delicious, but if you are a fan of spicy, you will likely have to add more chili. Ours was not spicy at all. Temperature equal to a pad se ew dish... AKA not hot. Surprising because Thai food can be quite spicy. I liked it. The bf had to add lots of chili sauce. Mango sticky rice was delicious! They put fried bean sprout heads or something like that which were amazing with the rice and mango! Like sweetened rice krispy cereal. I love that they use the same tea for hot tea as for their Thai iced tea!
author: Jenn D.

description: Excellent food, excellent service, and wonerful ambiance. The food is absolutely delicious!!!
author: Natalia V.

description: Yummy Thai food. I work with a group of hungry high schoolers and constantly in need of different food options, they are fed up with PIzza.  I'm glad I found a thai place that not only accommodated my last minuter order for 22 people, but also ensured that food was in big trays to avoid extra baggage.  I order the fried rice, Pad Thai, and other noodle options. All my youth were satisfied and loved the food. The food was savory and a little on the greasy side but it still delivered flavor and sazzz!
author: Linda S.

description:
Been here before, during my last trip to SF. I was a fan last time. I'm still a fan.

Did takeout this time. Got the ff:

1) The pad ke mao. This flat noodle dish was delish! Just remember kiddies, it's dense and filling. The subtle and bold tastes that linger are not lost simply because the dish is dense and filling.

2) The basil's lamb. Grilled lamb with carrots and sauce on the side. Tender to chew but you still need to get a knife. Better yet, just grab it with your fingers and bite. The damn thing is finger lick in' good!

3) The thai fried rice with prawns. This is divine, and rice belongs to any asian meal. This was no exception.

4) Side of roti. It's not a thai meal if this thing was missing, so I had to order a side of it. I wish they just gave some away.

Love love love the food here. The ambiance is very classy. The location is not far from Market street. The staff is very helpful, friendly, and most of all, available.

If you haven't been, what are you waiting for?
author: Alex L.

description: Great food, and service. The food is not very spicy, I would ask for it a level higher to get the proper Thai experience. The menu is huge and has lots of interesting dishes you don't see too often. It was a good find, and I would come back when in another Thai mood.
author: Jonah K.

description:
Best

Thai 

in SOMA

hands down - service, bar, apps and mains are all home runs

nuff said

(review based on 10 dining experiences)
author: Mark B.

description: Place made us wait another 10 minutes when we called 45 minutes earlier for pick up. They were apologetic, but the place still seems pretty badly run. The papaya salad was very pleasantly spicy and the pad see ew were good, but the duck curry portions ran a little small and the crab fried rice could've used a little more crispness to the rice. All in all, just ok.
author: Debbie Chiou S.

description: As far as Thai food goes, there are few places that really blow my mind. Basil Thai is a run-of-the-mill Thai spot that has the expected items on the menu that you can always fall back on. My boyfriend and I tried the roti, the crab fried rice, and the crispy chicken entree with sticky rice. The roti was a little too fried for my taste, and it lost some of the buttery flakiness of a good roti. However, the green curry sauce was great for dipping, and I ended up using it to flavor my fried rice as well. The crab fried rice had a good amount of real crab meat, but the flavor was a little lacking. The crispy chicken was on the opposite end of the spectrum, almost drowning in a too-salty sauce that made the crispy chicken not so crispy anymore. Overall, it was what was to be expected of any Thai spot and I filled up on decent food.
author: Ashley T.

description: Scratches the itch for Thai. Not the best I've had, and far from the worst.
author: Jennifer F.

description: Very good atmosphere and food. The drinks (coktails) are too expensive for their size but they are DAMN good!
author: Charlie S.

description: Recently visited Basil Thai during a business trip in SF. I loved the casual, laid-back atmosphere - definitely a true locals spot! The staff was friendly and most importantly, everything my husband and I ordered was fabulous! I highly recommend the "pan stickers," chicken yellow curry and of course the pad thai. All was seasoned perfectly and fresh. Will definitely come back again!
author: Tasha I.

description:
I've eaten here a couple of times and we always order something different each time.  So far, I've liked everything that I've eaten at this place. The curries are a bit on the sweet side which is fine with me. They're not very spicy, though.  The pork shoulder dishes are awesome because the pork were always tender and juicy. 

I especially like the "Jungle Beef."
author: LeTran B.

description:
Small restaurant in San Francisco with great service. The location of this restaurant makes parking a huge pain, but then again, where in San Francisco is it not a pain to park? 

Service here was great. Your cup of water is never empty over a long period of time and the servers are very quick with everything. 

The three dishes I tried were: 

(Appetizer) keow wan roti - grilled Indian bread with green curry and oriental eggplant

kang ped -  roasted duck, cherry tomatoes, & pineapples simmered in red curry 

panang short ribs - short ribs simmered in a basil kaffir panang sauce served with diced vegetables

I highly recommend the appetizer keow wan roti because it's very unique and tasty. The other two curries are good, but nothing spectacular. 

Overall, decent restaurant with good service. I'd come back again if someone else wanted to try it, but probably not a place I would go back to frequently.
author: Louisa T.

description: We don't go here all that often, but that's because, well, we forget about it until one of us is craving fresh Thai.  When that happens we head over to Basil.  (Which is a drive for us.)  The flavors here are spot on.  Sauces are not overly sweet or salty.  Service is always friendly and efficient.
author: Sarah P.

description: First time here and had a gluten free menu with many options!! I love spicy food and this place hit the spot!! Very knowledgable
author: Kym M.

description: Excellent. This is my new favorite Thai place. Very reasonable given the high quality.
author: Brent S.

description: Working downtown, I'm so sick of placing Thai orders through Osha.  Don't get me wrong I love OSHA but I wanted something different so I placed a lunch catering order for delivery Basil and dealt with Arun.  Arun is awesome.  I gave him my dish selections and told him we were a group of 20.  He made serving suggestions and personally delivered the order himself. We ordered a bunch of items but the absolute star dish was the pumpkin pork shoulder curry and the fried prawn rolls.  I'll have to visit their restaurant soon.
author: Lauren S.

description: Friendly service on Sunday night, wasn't terribly busy so that was nice. Sat at the bar as I was dining alone, tried the neur yang, ordered it medium and that's how it arrived. Very tasty food. Added some sticky rice to the plate since that gave me something to soak up the sauce. I highly recommend this meal.
author: Stephen R.

description: Good food! But I dont' like the fake presentation of the vegetables.
author: Philippe M.

description:
I had been craving Thai food for a while and my Sister seems to only like Asian food nowadays, so I found Basil Thai Restaurant & Bar on Yelp. 

We went on a Friday night around 9:30pm. The decor seemed a little upscale but still had a casual feeling. Considering how late it was, they had pretty good business. We were given delicious shrimp chips to nom on while we decided on what to get. We had the Curry Puffs to start which had curried diced duck and sweet potato in a puff pastry (much like an empanada), so good! For my entree, I decided to go with the panang short ribs which was also really good and not too spicy. Both of my Dad and Sister's dishes were really good too. They got the pork shoulders and curry lamb. My sister, who had the pork shoulders, finished her whole plate without leaving a single veggie or garnish behind! Me on the other hand tried really hard to finish my food but just couldn't do it. Since we were staying in a hotel, we didn't have a mini fridge so I tried to eat as much of my entree as I could since I don't like to waste food.

I wish I had room for desert though. Fried bananas with coconut ice cream was calling my name and all the reviews mentioned how good it was. Around 10pm, the waitress came to our table asking if we wanted dessert. She said that it was last call since they were closing soon. I don't think I've ever eaten somewhere where they had a last call for food. There was people who came in after she did this and they were served their dinner, weird. 

Our waitress was very hospitable though and made sure that a glass was never empty. All 3 of us enjoyed our dinner and had nothing but great things to say. I like to try new restaurants when I travel but would definitely think about coming here again if I'm in the area.
author: Michele W.

description:
I really like this place but for some odd reason I always seem to get looked over whenever I'm waiting to be seated.
Is it my height? Do I not have a strong enough restaurant presence to be noticed? 

Anyways, that's the only fault I had with Basil. They're food is yummy, my drinks are always icy cold, and they make me feel right at home by ignoring me. What's not to love?
author: Janey L.

description:
Came here in a group of 10 following our first day of conferencing at the Moscone Center. We walked over from there; it's not too far. We thought that the area would have been more active, but it wasn't. 

We didn't have reservations and although it was a Wednesday night, the place was packed! Coming from Chicago and as students, our idea of good Thai food is large portions of delicious food at hole in the wall places. This place had white table cloths and was very nicely decorated. A little concerned about how much it was going to cost, we were very shocked to see the very reasonable pricing. We ended up waiting quite awhile for tables and even at that, ended up sitting at three tables (4, 4, and 2 -- the table of two was far away from the rest of us), which is why they lost one star. 

My vegetarian friend and I ordered pad kee mao and basil's eggplant (+ jasmine rice), both with tofu and no fish sauce, which totally deviates from what is stated on the menu. The server understood exactly what we were talking about and didn't even raise an eyebrow (that sometimes happens in Chicago). Between the two of us, the two dishes were a perfect amount of food. The food was suprisingly delicious. (I am always a little suspicious of made-to-look-fancy ethnic food.) Friend wasn't as thrilled about the eggplant but that may have been because he simply doesn't like eggplant that much. I would definitely order the same thing again. 

Overall I think that everyone enjoyed their food and left stuffed without emptying out their wallets. The location seems kind of out of the way (that's my visitor perception anyway) but I would pay them another visit if I was in town again for a conference!
author: Nirmal G.

description:
The food is just so good.

We found certain things on the pricier side (like roti), but damn, the food was so good that it ranked top San Fran eatery on my boyfriend's list. 
We had the red duck curry, and the duck was SO moist without being mushy, and absolutely delicious. We weren't about to miss out on the green curry after reading the rave reviews on here, so we did the roti green curry eggplant appetizer and the green curry definitely does not disappoint! The roti, although pricier than we expect for roti, is a crispier version than we are used to having and it is so much better!
We also did a skirt steak, eggplant, squash -something from the wok, and that was alright. 

Take-away points: The curry is a must-eat. Red duck curry and Green curry. Go. Do it.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
My boyfriend bought me here on my most recent birthday. It was a very elegant with candlelight setting.  There is a bar at the front of the restaurant.

I started off with a "mango cosmo" which was vodka and mango puree with fresh lime. This was the perfect combination. It gave me a pretty good buzz throughout dinner.

My boyfriend and I started off with "tom yum goong" which was prawns in spicy lemongrass soup.  It was delicious! It came in this really neat serving bowl with revealing fire in the center of it. Aside from the presentation being cool, the soup was very flavorful. I love to eat spicy, so this soup was perfect. This filled me and my boyfriend up before our entrees even came out. I highly recommend this.

My boyfriend ordered the "pak rad hang" eggplant, zucchini, tomatoes, mushrooms green curry. It was very bland in my opinion, maybe because I like meat in my dishes.  Nothing special, but it was one of the top mentioned items on yelp. Try and see for yourself- but nothing special to me.

I ordered the "pad ke mao" spicy wide rice noodles. It was very flavorful but not as spicy as I imagined it to be. My boyfriend loved my dish, and I ended up letting him eat it since I was so full from the soup.
author: Karen X.

description:
I love Thai food. I will try any Thai-related restaurant at least once. I can't begin to say how happy I am Basil Thai is so close to home!

When I first try a new Thai place, my go-to dish is always (yawn, I know) pad thai. If a place can do a good pad-thai, I move on to curries then wok then to soups and finally finishing up with the noodle dishes. Yes. Its a process.

Basil's pad thai is a-maze-ing. The dish was juicy without being overpowering, and the vinegar balance was spot on. If you've been to other places (I'm looking at you King of Thai. $5 is great, but eating a plate of vinegar is not), you know what I mean. 

Ambiance is decent, its no Marina Osha "OMG COOL WALLS" space, but its also not Tu Lan (yes, I know, not a Thai place).

The price is right, the pad thai delicious, I will definitely be coming back here again!
author: Aaron M.

description:
REAL taste of Thai in nice and calm atmosphere w/ good price.

We had three dishes with steamed rice.
-Pan-fried dumplings of shrimp and pork served with Thai ginger soy  (basil panstickers), which are huge!
-Spicy southern Thai stir-fried pork shoulder with asparagus and bell peppers  (kua kling mu) is very hot (better to have with rice)
-Sizzling stir-fried skirt steak with wild ginger, apple eggplant, yellow squash, and green curry * (jungle beef) is very tasty.

All of these are very tasty, and used real Thai seasonings.
author: Yas K.

description:
Considering where this place is located in SF (near downtown) the pricing and portions are pretty good.  I came here with 2 of my friends, and since none of us could decide on one thing, we all ordered a dish and split it 3 ways and we were all really satisfied and full.  They even serve nice shrimp chips as appetizer finger food!
We ordered the Thai pineapple fried rice with prawns and cashew nuts, Pan-fried wide rice noodles with pork, chinese broccoli, egg, in Thai black bean sauce, and Stir-fried garlic noodle with prawns, mussels, squid and fresh basil.  I was never really a fan of pineapple fried rice, but this place's was really good; the flavors were evenly distributed and the sweetness of the pineapple flavor nicely balanced the prawns.  
The stir-fried garlic noodles with seafood was surprisingly spicy (but not too spicy) which was a nice.  The pan-fried rice noodle with pork and veggies was pretty good too.  I usually get Pad Thai when I go out to eat Thai food because it's safe and you can't really screw it up.  But the this pan-fried noodle of pork and veggies is now one of my new favorites  :)
The ambiance of the restaurant is really nice and feels kind of classy which I really like, because let's be honest, how many inexpensive Thai places are kind of fancy.
A comment I would like to mention is the service was a little smothering.  I mean, the service staff here were very nice which is great, but my friends and I felt at times the servers were smothering us.  So I don't know if I would consider that a bad or good thing.
I recommend this place to anyone to try :)
author: Angelica Y.

description:
Stopped by for an early dinner and ordered the fresh rolls w/ tofu.  They were served in sushi cut pieces.  Sauce was good with a bit of heat.  I prefer the rolls down the street at their sister restaurant, Basil Canteen however.

Also ordered their house romaine salad w/ onion, tomatoes, and cucumbers.  It too was served with fried tofu...now I know tofu does not have much flavor at all...but this had none.  Zip.  Zero.  I was a bit confused.  The salad had a warm peanut dressing which made the entire dish.  Loved it.  I was suprised about it being warm as I don't think the menu described it as such, but thinking about it in hindsight, of course it made sense.

The decor was odd I thought.  The wicker patio style chairs at the tables did not go with the cement bar top and dark wood chairs.  I've sat in those type chairs and find them very uncomfortable and awkward to sit at a table in-but I was at the bar-so maybe not the case?

Service was quick and attentive.
author: Teri X.

description: Stay away from this place. I extremely disappointed with the service. I have been to basil thai about 15 times with non-minority friends. I came with my family being a minority. We were unlucky enough to have the manager yesterday at 8pm as a waitress. The most prejudice waitress I have ever dealt with. She was extremely rude. She refused to give me more sauce. Another waiter came and closed the sauces almost so we wouldn't touch them. Her and other co-workers were starring at us and laughing their asses off. I asked for the manager and she said she was the manager. I told her politely how I felt and she did not say anything with a smile on her face. When we were serve water it was almost spilled caused she had aggressive pours. She ruined my meal and my family's dinner. One of the worst human beings I have met in my life.
author: Oscar P.

description: Very pleasant surroundings but indifferent service.  The menu indicates a dish made with duck breast however only duck skin - no meat.  On a second visit I pointed this out to the waitress and asked if I could get some meat this time, the answer was no. Fresh but unsatisfying food.  Also she filled one water glass on the table while leaving the other four empty.
author: Barry F.

description:
Average American Thai with the above average price. Everything was edible but overly greasy. Also, they failed hard when the on-the-house appetizer was not introduced as containing shellfish. Actually he just kind of plunked it on the table and walked away.

I can't help but think they gave us lame service because we weren't wearing suits.
author: Bonnie G.

description:
Service was fast and attentive, but the food I ordered was pretty sub par.

The grilled skirt steak salad had fresh vegetables, but the meat was so rough and unchewable. 

Also ordered the fresh rolls which weren't so fresh. The rice paper was dry and the roll itself was thin, lifeless, and overpowered with blandness. 

I've easily had a better cheaper meal at Osha (or most Thai places in the city by that matter). Perhaps this excels at the hot curries and meats, but the simple fresh orders failed to impressed.
author: Huan L.

description:
Such a cute little restaurant in the middle of nowhere.  We were looking for a place to take my coworkers for dinner to celebrate the new year and this restaurant popped up.  It's very trendy and modern and it literally is a restaurant filed with professionals.  

You can make reservations but I don't think you should have too much difficulty getting seating.  

1. Chicken (gai satay) $5. - comes with 2 skewers and they were GOOD.  nothing really special or unique but you can't complain about good taste and good quality.  

2. Chicken and oyster mushrooms in lemongrass, galanga, and coconut milk soup (dtom ka gai) $8. - love love love this soup but if you want THE BEST, i would go to Lers Ros for this.  It's got tangy, sweet, salty, smooth, and spicy all in one sip.  seriously amazing soup.  

3.  Thai pineapple fried rice with prawns and cashew nuts (kao pad sapparot) $10. - good, but the portions are a little small.  we had a party of 5 so this definitely was not "splittable"

4.  Flame grilled pork shoulder filet served with grilled pineapple and tomato (mu yang) - $12  - not the greatest dish i had.  preparation was good but didn't have full flavor and was actually a little tough.  i wanted it to be more tender as you should expect with pork shoulder.

5.  Prawns, calamari, and mussels stir-fried with zuchini, onions, basil, and fresh chili * (pad talay ruam mit) - $13. - this was probably my second favorite dish.  they had lots of variety but again, portions were a bit small.  all the taste was great, the food was fresh and made to order!

6.  Angus steak cubes, snake beans, and apple eggplant in green curry * (kieow wan neur) - $13. -  this was my favorite but it had more veggies than meat!  i want juicy bites of angus steak with every spoonful i grab.

overall good, definitely a little on the pricy side for the amount of food you get.  nothing to complain about but i know there are better alternatives.
author: Sandy L.

description: Very good and high quality Thai food. Probably my favorite Thai restaurant in the city so far. $10 for lunch!
author: Thomas C.

description:
Pad ke-mao = Win
Kua kling mu = VERY SPICY, but if you like spicy food as much as me, biggest win!

Their coconut juice is also really good, although I'm sure it's been sweetened for taste.

Service was good and water refills kept coming.  The complementary shrimp chips were also a nice treat.

Would come back if I was in the area.
author: Christopher L.

description: Great dinner, busy on a Saturday night, but no queues and good service
author: Sophie M.

description: One of the best lunches I've had in a long time.  My first visit a couple weeks ago and I found the food fresh, tasty, and the presentation quite nice. Service is prompt & friendly. We started with basil panstickers, keow ran roti (so pretty!), then on to pad ke-mao and lab gai. Wow, what wonderful flavors. This could be my fave SF thai place. I'll certainly be back and I can't wait to try the sister location, Basil Canteen, just up the street.
author: Chris E.

description:
Why is the food so heavy with oil? 

Saturday night, I ordered three items:

paupia sod (Fresh rolls of vegetables and tofu with peanuts, chili, and lime vinaigrette)

It is only item that I would consider ordering again... if I were to return. However, for $7.5 the volume of food should have been double. Not a good value. Priced like sushi.  

kao pad sapparot (Thai pineapple fried rice with prawns and cashew nuts)

I think something is wrong when pineapple is the only flavor I could taste (when a piece was in my mouth) amongst a medley of rice, prawns, cherry tomatoes, cashews, green onions, egg, cilantro, and oil and more oil and then some more oil and then a little more oil... resulting in a very heavy and bland dish. 

gai pik khing (Crispy sliced chicken, string beans sweet & spicy 'pik-khing' curry)

I could not eat much due to the oil, again. Chicken was less like strips and more like remnants. The ratio of good meat to sugary battery covering was low and not appealing. 

Opened the left-overs after arriving home, to see if worth eating later. Yuck. Oily and disgusting. Straight to the trash. I wish that I had gone some place else. $35 wasted. 

PS: My particular server was somewhat flat or disengaged expressing little interest in my experience; but then acting happy and animated and visibly smiling/laughing at the place where the wait staff congregates at the order terminal. Management was politely informed so they can have a chance to fix that problem. Not sure what they will do about the food. 

Basil Thai's best days may be in the past, or maybe you will get a good experience based more randomly on which cook is working. It's hard to say. I will not waste my time, nor money, with this place again.
author: Keith U.

description:
Pretty great Thai food! Found parking super easily on a Saturday evening around 6. My friend and I were seated quickly as well. We sat at the bar since the other spots were all the way in the back where it was really loud and dark. 

1st, I don't know they did but they have the most delicious shrimp chips. I mean, wow. I actually bought an order (only a dollar) for the chips because they were that good. Really thick and crispy and fresh. We ordered the fried veggie rolls which were pretty good. Super hot from the fryer and very tasty. Tasted fresh. We ordered the pad thai as well which was pretty well-received. Big portions with lots of shrimp which was nice. It definitely filled me up. The thai tea was good too, not overly sweet like some other places make them. Overall definitely a good place and I would go back if I was in the area
author: Dustin H.

description:
I am not typically down in this area but found myself at Basil today and wanted to write a review on my experience.

What a great spot. Was having a business lunch here and could not have been more impressed. I had a fantastic bbq chicken dish that was just spicy enough that I did not have to drink 100 glasses of water but spicy enough for great flavor. 

After reading a few other people's reviews I am going to have to check it out for Dinner sometime soon!
author: Ryan B.

description:
To keep my Thai food kick rolling on I gave Basil Thai it's chance and I was definitely not disappointed. I took a special lady out here, warned her this was my first visit, and Thai Basil totally came through.

It's a more upscale Thai location compared to many in the city, definitely a good date spot. Dim lights, candles on the table, all that good stuff. Lot's of dressed to impress couples and parties who are looking for Thai without feeling like they're at a hole in the wall. Because of the atmosphere you're paying $1-2 more per dish than the competitors but who really cares. Tidy little drink menu too, the gin cocktail I sipped on was delicious. One date with two dishes, appetizer and a cocktail was $38. Not bad at all.

The menu is smaller which I actually prefer, I enjoy a specific menu that I know they'll execute well over a tri-folding double sided deal with a ton of options that often taste too similar. Over all I definitely recommend this place and should I be down in SOMA with a hankerin' for Thai I'll be back!
author: Justin N.

description:
Solid Thai food 
Big portions 
Good service
author: Numa R.

description: I love this place. I've been here twice. Great service. There are many food options. Indulgent to healthy. It's across the street from city beer store and a block away from cellarmaker brewing. I love to be able to drink a great brew, eat great food, and have another great brew. I highly recommend eating here.
author: Angeline C.

description: I love going to Basil Thai to celebrate birthday lunches at my work! Why? Because I can email them a reservation request and we can work out a pre-fix menu that is ready when we get there! Easy! Done!
author: Theresa D.

description: Came here on a date. We went to the movies and roamed around looking for grub to hold us over. I am really, really picky when it comes to Thai, so I was pleased when this restaurant exceeded my expectations. Pad kee Mao was fantastic. Pa nang chicken was bomb. We got lettuce wraps as an appetizer that were solid. Glass of red for me, glass of white for him-- perfection. We were stuffed and still had leftovers. Cool place-- tvs at the bar area, dim lighting, romantic setting.
author: Ashley J.

description:
Had dinner with my boyfriend a few weeks back. Excellent service, very prompt and friendly.
The duck was delicious, very mouth watering. Eggrolls were quite nice as well.
All and all, very nice place, reasonably priced with a great menu selection. I would certainly recommend checking this place out.
author: Elyse C.

description:
Unfortunately the good food doesn't make up for the BAD service.

I came here for dinner. When ordering the entrees, my wife had a few questions about the plates. She chose one, and then after asking about it, said "never mind, I'll take X instead". The server must have missed this since both entrees came out. Mistakes happen, and this seemed like a miscommunication. However once my wife pointed this out to the server, she became defensive and aggressive. The waitress stopped coming to our table after that, and would look at us while talking to other servers.
author: John M.

description:
Everything at Basil Thai is so flavorful and the portions are huge! I loved the yellow curry, which had an entire half of a chicken in there! It's impossible to finish by yourself, so make sure you share. I also loved how they put complimentary shrimp chips in a dimsum steamer as an appetizer, too. I just thought it was too cute not to mention...

The service and decor are great, so it really adds to the whole dining experience. I wouldn't mind coming again, although I would probably go with trying a new place if I come back to the city anytime soon. If you've never been, I can imagine Basil Thai being a good place for a casual dinner to end a day of hanging out in SF.
author: Angelic L.

description:
This place has great food and even decent beer, Racer 5.

I've eaten here twice and enjoyed it both times.  Don't let the neighborhood of the exterior put you off, this is a good place for lunch or dinner.
author: Rudyard K.

description:
The veggie fried rice is AMAZING. Add fried tofu, basil does a really good job with their fried tofu. It has plenty of veggies in it, and though its on the greasier side, its yummy.  Great meal if your hungry and craving starch! And their veggie spring rolls are yummy too!  Everyone I've taken to Basil has enjoyed their meal, so though I don't eat meat or fish, I've been told they apparently do a good job at that too. They have an octopus dish that looks insane but is supposedly tasty as well. 

 Nice ambiance inside and good cocktails. It's pricy but worth it. Always ask for extra soy sauce if your ordering to go, they tend to be stingy with that, but if you ask they'll give you plenty.
author: Rad S.

description:
I called around 4PM Black Friday and recieved a call back 10 minutes later to confirm my reservation for a party of 8 for 6PM. 

Upon walking, in the ambiance is very modern contemporary. The woman knew exactly who I was when I walked up to her for our reservation and even said my name without me telling her.

Food was pretty good, some dishes better than others and prices were fair.
--------------
Tom ka gai soup: chicken, oyster mushroom in kalanga coconut milk soup, which was similar to many other Thai restaurants. It was a little too sweet for my liking, but lots of flavors.

Tom yum gai soup: sliced chicken breast, mushroom and tomatoes in spiced mint-lemongrass soup, which was a lot better than other places. It had the right amount of zing, spices, and heat level! It had that great spicy after-taste at the end. YUM! I would definitely recommend this soup!

Kao pode tod: spiced yellow corn & bean cake fritter served with tamarind vinaigrette cucumber salad , which was like a little cake. It was a little too* doughy and heavy for my tastes, but my friend said she enjoyed it. Meh. I would pass on this dish.

Curry peppercorn duck: roasted duck & stringless snap peas wok-tossed with curry paste & peppercorn. The duck was too salty =(  I wish I could have enjoyed this dish a little bit more! The snappeas on the other hand were awesome! They were light and sweet and still had that nice crispy bite to them.

Ka na moo krob: oriental broccoli and house-cured crispy pork belly wok-fried with garlic and chili. The crispy pork belly was just that: Crispy. YUM! This was one of my favorite dishes out of the night, but the chinese broccoli was uneventful in this dish. If only they swapped the vegetables of the two dishes we had, then this dish would have been even greater. YUM!

Pad ke mao: spicy wide rice noodles & sliced beef stir-fried with basil, garlic, & Thai chili. The noodle dish was really good here. It's on par with other Thai restaurants and a solid dish to order. I enjoyed this one as well.
-------------------
Service here is impeccable. They checked up on us a few times to make sure we had everything, re-filled our water before it got too low and when they brought out our dishes, the waitress even knew who's dish was who's amongst the 8 of us! I thought she was really on point with that!  

Although the dishes were really good or needed a few tweaks in them, my experience was more so on the positive side. And like other Yelpers said, it is definitely a better establishment for larger groups!

Note: They can also split the tab up to 4 credit cards too for those larger groups!
author: Ling H.

description:
I give this place 4.5 stars and I did not give the full 5 because I have only been here once and need to try more things on the menu before giving it the best rating.
However, so far this is one of my favorite Thai places in the city.  The ambiance is delicate and warm, just like the food,

To sum up my experience in a few words:
delicious food, great service, yummy curry and affordable prices!  
Therefore, I highly recommend this place!

Try the roti for an appetizer it was yummy!  And if you are a vegetarian like me get the vegetable curry dish.  I was also told the gai kra-prow  (chicken dish) is awesome.  They also give you fried shrimp as an appetizer but since I don't eat meat I did not try them. Parking can be a pain so come earlier than later to avoid the fuss.
author: Molly M.

description: I really like the atmosphere here - brick walls, industrial balcony. The food is so nicely presented too. A very very pleasant thai restaurant indeed.
author: Mark S.

description: Food was good as Thai food goes in SF (either that or I was absolutely starving).  I walked in and thought this place was going to be a fusion spot, but they seem to serve fairly traditional dishes.  Tip: they serve the full menu at the bar.  My friends and I seated ourselves there and avoided the long wait for a table.
author: Pam S.

description:
I'm not sure how this place has such great yelp ratings. Nice setting and great service, but very meh food, especially for vegetarians. They pre-make all of their sauces, which is actually a bit unexpected for a Thai restaurant that isn't fast-food. The bad thing is, most of them have fish sauce in them. They only had about 4 entrees on the menu that didn't have fish sauce (along with several appetizers). We ordered all of them, so I got to see most of the menu that is vegetarian. We got off to a nice start with the fresh spring rolls, but then went downhill pretty fast with everything else.

Long story short, I wouldn't recommend this place, especially if you have vegetarians in your party.
author: Sheel M.

description:
Oh I'm such a fan!  What a great restaurant with creative menu items, drinks and decor!  My bf and I came with another couple and we shared:

*Tom yum soup - the most flavorful and sour Tom Yum I've ever had...so delicious!
*Pad kee Mao w/ cubed beef - quite disappointing 
*Green curry w stuffed eggplant - the eggplant is fantastic and full of flavor and packed w/ meat and other ingredients
*Roti - I feel like these were twice-fried..extra crispy and perfect for dipping in curry
*Crab fried rice - OMG I LOVEEEEE THISSSS DISHHHHH...they don't skimp on the crab either =)
*Spicy catfish - great sauce and perfectly cooked, flaky fish
*Mango sticky rice - mediocre
*Roti w coconut ice cream - I loved the ice cream!

I love how creative they are with their menu and take traditional Thai dishes and put their own twist on it.  I would love to go again soon!
author: Jen Y.

description:
This place is pretty nice and the food was pretty good.

We had the pad thai and the red duck curry and both were pretty good. The portions were just right for the two of us. The shrimp chips they give you as a snack were addicting and we couldn't stop eating them! 

The service was pretty friendly and attentive. The atmosphere was pretty nice also and I don't think it's a pricey place either.
author: Chris T.

description: Loved all of our dishes. Curry puffs of duck and sweet potato were delicious- seemed to be popular with the other tables as well. Steak with curried-peanut sauce (recommended by our waiter) was tender and flavorful. Liked that there was a whole half chicken (instead of diced) in the yellow curry. Pad thai was good too. Decent portions, reasonable prices, and a sweet hostess.
author: Sophia B.

description:
This place is great.  They can make dishes very spicy if you ask them to.

They can seat a lot of people and I have never had to wait too long to get a table, even on busy nights without a reservation.

This place is one of the best thai places I've been to in the city.  Much better than any Osha thai chain thats on every corner.

Catfish with fried basil is my go to dish.
Beef salad is tangy and very satisfying.
Pad thai very good here as well.
author: Baek C.

description:
This was an amazing dining experience all around.

We walked in, and were told that there may be a 25-30 minute wait for a table for 2, but... they had a few reservations that were no-shows, and we only waited 10 minutes before we were seated.

Service was prompt, albeit from 3 different servers at times. Each one was helpful, but the main guy helping us was especially great - he didn't feel like he needed to be elsewhere when we asked for details on a bunch of menu items.

We ordered:
- Minced pork and shrimp pansticker appetizer
- Skirt steak with curried peanut sauce
- Seafood curry (we ordered it with yellow instead of green curry)
- 2 Thai iced teas

The appetizers were a great way to kick off the meal. My only problem with them is that the filling seemed to be more of a sausage that sat in the middle of the dumpling rather than filling it to the corners. Just a matter of aesthetics, though, as it was very very tasty. The sauce that came with was great, too.

The skirt steak with curried peanut sauce was most likely the highlight of this meal, if I had to name one. It came presented very well (as did everything else), topped with peanuts and garnished with ripe tomato slices. There is no way to describe how good this was. They don't provide you with a knife because you don't need it.
