It was ok because the bartender was very nice to look at . Get the ginger drop. At first I wasn't too sure about a savory cocktail. Believe me I was pleasantly surprised. It was sooo good. For food I got the pineapple fried rice. Hmmm. It had this weird rice and was not good. The flavors were not there (aka it was bland). The shrimp was the one benefit. I would go back for drinks only.
author: Whitney G.

description:
grab some:
param rungsong - grilled steak w/peanut sauce
moo yang - grilled marinated pork filletes
kang kari gai - chicken and potatoes in yellow curry

add some white rice and your good to go!!

perfect place to grab a bite before you head to one of the numerous clubs/bars on the street...

not as good as mom makes it but does a great job filling in for her!
author: Gino J.

description: Ok, admittedly the main draw of Basil Thai is the fact that it is block away from my house. But the food really is very solid, and I think that I would come here even if it was not in my back yard. The ambiance is nicer than your average neighborhood Thai restaurant. I always order the pad se ew, it is super garlicky and the portion is really large. Since I am a noodle girl, I have also ordered the pad thai, but I did not care for it because it was a bit too saucy and way too sweet for my taste. My boyfriend loves the yellow curry, although it is served a bit differently here because the chicken is cooked on the bone in the curry. We have also tried the flank steak with the peanut sauce, it was good, but really really rich. They also do take out, but I found that the quality is not as good when you take it out as when you eat it in.
author: Dana H.

description: the lady usually seen there, she is with too much attitude. I ordered take out food and mention spicy. While i was eating it was so sweet as it has more than 10 spoon sugar instead no spicy. I then asked i don't like sweet, she replied just add chili on the same order. I then ask her to give me another which is without sugar. She may be repeat me to add chili on same food I had but I then told her to give me another something else. I just had few bite from that food but she kept saying I almost ate and mumble. That moment i felt like I am asking food on free. I can't believe that customer is treated like this. I also work in restaurant for part time, for me if customer says food is something wrong I do not even charge them and big sorry. But this restaurant they fight with their customer......The waitress do not know how to handle their customer. It's worse experience ever. I was regular customer but won't order never........
author: Sub L.

description: Been here at least a half dozen times because the food is amazing.  The spicy catfish is my favorite dish since I love spicy food.  Cool decor ,  good service, and tasty thai iced coffee!  Pricing is probably average $15 per person, wine selection is lacking , but the food makes up for it.
author: Lisa T.

description: Yum, yum, and yum!  You cannot beat the food here.  For $35 we had lab salad, fresh vegi rolls, shrimp chips, lamb kabob, and grilled vegi curry.  The service was great and the atmosphere was chill.  I love to bring friends here when they want Thai food.
author: Jasmine B.

description: Been coming here for as long as I can remember. Always have a great experience. The food is consistently delicious and high quality. I have too many favorite dishes to list.....Prior to having kids, we use to dine in very frequently...and now we do take-out....and have never been disappointed.
author: Mojgan J.

description: This place is amazing! Their spring rolls and the fish/peanut sauce is ingenious...so is the keow wan roti - indian bread with curry sauce...and the wrapped fish is light and delightful...I am definitely going back....
author: Angela J.

description: What can I say that 512 other people haven't already said?  This is a good bet.  Try the corn fritters and be sure to order something with basil in it--like the ga kra prow.  Tasty.
author: kathy m.

description:
This is in my morning commute direction. Guess it's name found it's way into my subconscious on one of those days when I was inhaling fumes from cars stuck waiting for the signal. So, I had to try it. 

I tried their roti appetizer, it's inspired by Indian bread, it's a typical malasian/singaporean style bread. Tasted good. For the entree I tried their eggplant green curry and turnip cakes. Both tasted good. However, the portions were too small. I don't have a large appetite, but still! Also, my subconscious is not loud , so I doubt they read my mind.

I had 12 one dollar coins in my pocket that day (caltrain's ticket vending machine did that in exchange for a $20 bill). I asked if they would exchange them for paper currency, but the bartender refused - apparently it's against their policy to do that. I still am giving 3 stars, despite that.

Verdict: Food was ok, price didn't match the food, service could've been better. Oh well it's off my list and subconscious
author: Vinod S.

description:
Not the best Thai in the Bay, but the best in SOMA. I can ride my bike here from my office and bring it inside with me (my bike folds up like a clown tri-cycle, really) and they don't care.

Wait staff is mellow, but the fried fish is better at Asha - it's crispy there and kinda soggy here. Nyet!

Tamarind shrimp is good though - check it out.
author: service p.

description: I went here with some friends on Saturday.  It kind of reminded me or Osha, similar prices, but I think a little more authentic (but not much).  The portions sizes were bigger than Osha which I was happy with.  It's a good place to go with a small group of friends or to take a date.  Nice and quiet.
author: Peter W.

description: I love this place - i eat here like one a week. After a hard day at work , a couple of Chiprehinas and a plate of curry is what i need.  Some of the menu gets kinda mundane at times- but their is always something new that i haven't tried before.
author: Sean B.

description: It's something i'd expect from a SOMA joint: asian fusion-style (more like Thai infused, pan-asian) place sandwiched between two warehouses. It's also the following: trendy, sleek, hip--but not in a vapid Marina sort of way. My sis raved beforehand about the slightly spicy crispy catfish filet sauted in kaffir red curry paste and fresh peppercorn and rightly so. It was everything you'd expect from a dish that's expertly pan-fried with not too much batter nor oil. Our noodles were a tad oily, but not rich enough to spoil the savoriness of the catfish. Amazingly enough, my first attempt at a carapinheira didn't go too well with dinner. Strange that it's on the drink menu, though.
author: Chris C.

description: Another place with tasty food and great prices. Casual but fun atmosphere with good service. I think family-style is the way to go. Everything we had (about 8 dishes) was good but dishes I'd go back for: Angus sirloin cubes stir-fried with lemongrass, bell peppers & roasted chili paste, calamari with bamboo shoot, scallions in lemongrass-chili puree, and grilled marinated skirt steak topped with peanut sauce. Yummy.
author: Lizelle G.

description: Maybe my review is unjustifiably harsh.  The food is actually quite nice.  I just feel like when there is so much competition for my thai food attention you really have to stand out.  Everything is very well prepared and presented.  They have mango with sticky rice which is a huge plus but it only comes with like 1/3 mango which is crazy, especially when mangos are in season.
author: adam b.

description: Nice place for a date, had the tamarind prawns which were yummy! Staff was pleasant and prompt.
author: Shannon B.

description: I went to Basil for the first time last night. YUMMY! I love Thai food so this was a great find! The three of us went for a late bite: 4 cocktails,3 apps, and a main dish for $50 bucks not bad!  Their lemon grass soup was to die for! I am craving it as we speak! I am going back for sure!
author: Jennifer O.

description: Mmm....yummy Thai food at reasonable prices on Folsom street.
author: Rob P.

description: Everything was average, except for the food, which was below-average. I'm Asian and have been blessed by the serendipitous Thai restaurants in Pittsburgh for 5 years. I mean, how can you run a place with crappier food than a random restaurant in the obscure town like Pittsburgh? Maybe this place will serve a little bit better as a bar at night. But I was definitely unimpressed with the food here.
author: Inbae L.

description:
i'm giving them a 5 star rating but i would give 4.5 if i could
love the food
the basil tofu is amazing
brown rice is good
spring rolls are awesome
pad thai minus shrimp is delish
green curry on indian bread appetizer was nomlishous 

if i could take half a star away it would be for not having a real vegetarian section and also for not having any waiting area or hostess booth.. might seem petty but i hate walking into a place and waiting around awkwardly wondering if im in the right place until a hostess finally notices me....  not that bad but .. eh

wasnt worth taking of a whole star though =)
author: Amber F.

description: Like their chicken satay, shrimp and works for pre-dancing in SOMA. It's location means parking only has to happen once, get a drink to get started.
author: miriam b.

description: Hands down the best thai in the city.  Very elegant, fairly priced dining.  I live across the street, so I frequently drop by and order a dish at the bar.  Nearly everything on the menu is absolutley *fantastic* - don't be afraid to be a little adventurous.  My favorites:  Gai Prik King (Chicken with Fried Basil), Pad Se Ew (Pan Fried Noodles with Chicken & Chinese Broccolli), Stuffed Eggplant (Eggplant rolled around minced chicken in green curry), Hoi Ka-ta (Scallops with Tempura Long Beans), Pla Dook Pad Pik (Spicy Fried Catfish)
author: Timothy D.

description: Awesome food, clean, and friendly establishment in SOMA.  A must see and close to Club Dragon (Fridays) and Endup.
author: Ben L.

description: How lucky am I that this is my neighborhood Thai place? Affordable yet elegant, it is a cross cultural Folsom street find. Everything from the curry samosa starter to my coconut rice pudding desert was interestingly flavored and unique. Go here for a date or to reunite with friends.
author: Jessica M.

description:
This is near my place so I thought I'd give it a shot.  Was craving Pad Ke Mao.  It is typically spicy; it was very mild.  The noddles were fine, but the flavor was bland and a bit oily.  Also, it was quite a bit higher than expected price-wise considering the portion was a bit weak.

Overall, I would go again to see if other dishes were better, but this is my staple thai dish, so that's pretty much killing the place for me.

I gave it two stars, because the atmosphere is great looking.  Makes for a nice get together.  But only if you guys really have bad taste in food.
author: Joey C.

description: ate there for dinner two nights in a row- one with one group of friends and then the next night with one friend.  Food is great for the price.  The fried banana and coconut ice cream dessert is great.  I wish they let me get the fried bananas with the fresh mango, though.
author: joseph k.

description: Just went there for a friend's birthday and there is absolutely nothing I put in my mouth that I didn't love. Total party in my mouth. Now, I've had my fair share of thom ka gai, and it was down right delicious here. My only criticism is the snootiness of the servers. They had gotten my rice wrong and therefore asked for them to fix it and switch it to brown rice. The girl came with a bowl, threw my fork on the table and then swooped the white rice off of my plate with her hand onto a plate I was using for my pot stickers that I wasn't even done with yet. The arrogance that this was done with was theatrical. Had the food not been excellent and the ambiance delightful (along with the company ;) I would rate this place ONE STAR for the unsanitary handling of my fork and plate. I mean, at least in France you don't tip, the waiters handle your food with utensils and the unfriendliness is expected. That said, I pretty much forgot about all that I just described when I put that tamarind tiger prawn dancing with the green and red peppers on my palette. Talk about deeelish. The sirloin steak cubes in the green curry dish was divine. I guess they can afford to treat their clientele with a certain arrogance. Their food truly rules.
author: Amelia Q.

description: I was here on Valentine's Day with five others and we ordered a bunch of dishes to share. To start off, we had drinks: I had the Sublime (sour but delicious), and everyone else had the Mojito. We ordered the paupia, which was the spring rolls and I would go back for those alone. The grilled marinated lamb was excellent. I've had lamb once in my life before the other night and I thought I might never have it again, but the Basil's Lamb was very good. Pad Thai and curries were good as well. We had excellent service as well which topped off a good Valentine's Day. Prices are very reasonable.
author: Robin M.

description: My 2nd favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco. It's plain on the outside and a bit hard to find but its beautiful inside. Food is very good. Drinks are yummy. I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Impatient K.

description: Me, my GF and a friend went here after a recommendation from our cashier at Rainbow Grocery. I've seen this space change many times over the years and finally it seems this restaurant fits. Everything on the menu looked good but I settled for the pork wonton soup and it was delicious. The only drawback was all our food came out at different times and to be polite we had to sit there until everyone had their food before we ate it. Like Lulu M. I was torn between 3 and 4 stars. 3.5 rating.
author: Jason C.

description: I think my experience here is about the same as that of the woman who comes here because it's a block away from her house. This is also about a block away from our house, but I would also come here even if it required a bit of a walk. Not everything here is awesome, but even the stuff that isn't is pretty damn good. The place is always pretty crowded, but the staff tends to put in a lot of effort to make sure everyone is taken care of.
author: Kathleen P.

description: Soooo much better than Osha Thai! I always have the pad talay raummit and panang short ribs.  They are my 2 faves on the menu!
author: jen h.

description: this was my first place to eat in san fransisco. it was pretty good, especially the green curry. i'd never had thai curry before, and it tasted nothing like the japanese curry i'm so accustomed to. the service was good, and the location is cool. i liked the ambience a lot, fancier than what i'm used to.
author: Rachelle B.

description:
okay so basil thai is a rather good restaurant. it has some really good dishes and some not so great dishes.  i came here with my sister because she likes thai food and it got good yelp reviews and whatever.  bottom line is that we ordered four things

1.) curry puffs
2.) chicken satay
3.) stuffed eggplant
4.) panang short ribs

the curry puffs were dry. like straight up sahara. this would not have been too bad of a problem except they came with no sauce. because of this it was like biting into dry wall but with tastier insides. (the duck inside was good, but, dry).

the chicken satay was good: large portion, juicy, cooked right, and the peanut sauce was great. you figure though, how bad would a thai restaurant have to be to screw up chicken satay. if i come back i would probably order this again because it real good.

the stuffed eggplant was mushy (i know that eggplant can become mushy when cooked (read: overcooked)).  on top of the mushyness it was a tad bit slimy (gross). the saving grace was the green curry. that was absolutely delicious and probably would have been delicious on anything.

the panang short ribs were easily the star of the night: tender, succulent, flavorful and offset perfectly by the crispy veggies in the dish. the short ribs were really well cooked and i just wish there was more in the dish--but then again for 14 bucks it was a reasonable amount.  the panang curry was phenomenal and although i usually enjoy a spicier curry, i think that this played well off the tastes of the beef. definitely a must have for anyone who enjoys short ribs and thai food.

also. i lied.

the real star of the show that night was the couple next to us. there was a white gentleman and an asian woman.  it was clear that it was a second date. yelpers- i wish i could share with you the awkwardness that was occurring just two feet from us in better detail than what i am about to describe, but please believe me, it was amazing.

some key topics of discussion:

gentleman patronizing attempting to 'teach' his date to say the word 'train'. 

gentleman: "you know, i have been thinking about this a lot lately. i just have to say. i really think my mother talks waaaaay to much. i mean seriously. she just doesnt stop talking."

gentleman: "i'm happy that i didnt scare you off with all of the crazy things i was talking about last time.  i though for sure that i would have."

gentleman: "are you uncomfortable--do you want to talk about something more comfortable to you?"

i honestly thought i was on a tv show and at any moment hidden cameras were going to pop out and the host was going to say, "you were just on 'sitting next to the most awkward dates everrrrr!!!'."  

unfortunately the cameras never came out. to her credit, however, the woman was a real trooper. i would have ended the date about five minutes in. 

thanks basil thai for offering such enjoyable people watching.
author: Jason B.

description: I LOVE the tamarind prawns with a  side order of the beef salad and sticky rice.  The have one of the best mojitos in town. :-)
author: Cristal G.

description:
I really liked two out of four things we ordered, but the other two could have been improved and were not really worth the price. 

Here's what we got:
porpia sod -  fresh rolls of vegetables & tofu served with crushed peanuts, chili, lime vinaigrette 
Nice and fresh, the dipping sauce had a lot of flavor.

yum Shiang Hai -  clear noodle rolls with peanuts and greens tossed in lemongrass dressing. 
the noodle pieces were much bigger and flatter than I expected, but I don't know why i had that expectation :P It tasted pretty good, but there was too much dressing and I was kinda overwhelmed by the lime taste in the dressing.

plapow - today's fresh fish filet infused with lemongrass and served with lime-garlic sauce. 
This was a disappointment :(  Our fish was sea bass and it came wrapped in a banana leaf, but it was actually pretty dry. Too bad because it seemed like the fish had a pretty good dry rub. Unfortunately this was also the most expensive item of the four dishes at $18. 

pad Thai -  rice stick noodles stir-fried with bean cakes, chives, bean sprouts and prawns. 
I liked the pad thai - it was light and very slightly sweet. I liked the large pieces of stir fried tofu.

overall, was a fun place to hang out with cool decor and good service. also looked like they had some creative drinks on the menu that would be worth a try.
author: Sushmita S.

description: Tasty, some what upscale and reasonable price. Can't go wrong there, especially their pad thai. YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMMYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY!!!
author: Joon Y.

description: Great thai food in a nice modern environment.  The best part is that their prices are super reasonable.  While there's better Thai available in the city, I think this is the best bang for your buck if you're looking for a nice looking place as well.
author: Rudro S.

description: I always enjoy going to new places to eat, especially in SOMA. So I went to Basil recently. It's 5 star settings, 4 star prices, and 3 star entrees. Not bad, but don't make this a top destination for Thai. The city is filled with plenty more Thai spots. Nonetheless, the place is cool for power lunches with your office mates (BTW thank you office mates for the power lunch).
author: Leroid D.

description: Ok food, definitely better in the restaurant than it is to go.  Friendly staff and nice atmosphere.  Great for a quick bite.  Great drinks, they definitely make up for anything else!
author: Sean M.

description:
ok, a bit on the pricey side..  the food was average..  a little too hip and western for me..

I say head West and go to Manoras
author: Fredz R.

description: The Thai food here leans towards the rich and creamy side but it is downright good.  They are attentive and maintain a comfortable ambiance.  It is a great place to have a conversation as they tend to keep the volume down low.  I enjoyed their coy "bowl" in particular.  Perhaps it is just a flower pot full of goldfish but it really cracked me up.  Someday they'll have a real pond.
author: Cyan C.

description:
basil is a perfectly decent thai place.  there is really nothing extraordinary about their food, but there is nothing bad about it either.

it is a very nice place, and you are basically paying for presentation here.  an extra $2 an entree compared to other thai places for a white tablecloth.  which is great if you're on a date, but otherwise...

also, they make the worst caipirinhas i've ever had here.  they taste like bad margaritas.  i'd avoid them.
author: Steve S.

description: I was extremely impressed with the unique thai menu.  I loved everything that we ordered and will remember that taro root noodle dish for next time.
author: Debbie Y.

description: Tasty food, and the place is so pretty: simple and elegant and small, with white tablecloths and minimalist square Asian-ish plates.  I remember we kept eyeing the appetizers, even through the meal, with that "are you going to finish that because if not, I am" kind of polite - but nonetheless, predatory - look.  Very yummy, and just a pleasant place to eat.  I'd love to have a party here!
author: M. H.

description: Great place to take a group of friends, the prices are good and the food is great.  I have had the duck curry and this is my favorite place to go for this dish, and I usually try duck curry at every Thai restaurant I visit.   I have tried the noodles and they are good!  The eggrolls are really good too!  The service is attentive and the restaurant is a good size.
author: Jen C.

description:
i really enjoyed all the flavors their dishes we ordered...
very contemporary interior...
felt clean
author: charlotte s.

description: Well, you definitely pay for the atmosphere.  Average thai food, but really nice decor and staff.
author: Mark D.

description: I had the fire calamari which was bland. The cuts of squid were quite good, but rendered rubbery and blah by overcooking. However, the pad me kow was fantastic.
author: Matt W.

description: Ate here last night, always a good place for Thai. Sadly, I found a hunk of plastic in my curry! They made amends though, and I was soon enjoying sticky rice with mango. Despite the plastic, I am coming back!
author: Darren M.

description: Nicely decorated Thai restaurant with great tasting food
author: ITesh J.

description:
so i generally really like their food, although it pays to shop around the menu for the real winners. they have my favorite peanut sauce.

however, the ambiance is not all that special. . . the pathetic aquarium attempt in the pot next to the door? not working so well when 2 out of the 4 fish are floating belly up. makes you wonder.
author: Chelsea B.

description:
Three and one half stars.

My partner and I ate here yesterday night.  We had dinner to catch up with a friend and his new girlfriend.  When we first arrived and were seated, it was extremely noisy.  There was a VERY large group that the restaurant was accommodating - comfortably.  After the large party left, it was much easier to carry on a conversation.  The atmosphere is clean and cool.  The service was nice - barely noticed them, but always there when you needed something!  

The food.  The food was was well prepared and flavorful.  The menu is jam packed full of options.  If you don't like beef, and you don't feel like chicken, or duck - they have fish.  One of our party had a cat fish dish.  I didn't try it, but she said it tasted great.  

There is a noodle section, a curry section, and a wok section on the menu.  They also have a large variety of starters, soups and skewers. So many of the options looked tasty.  I think the portions were perfect.  I believe we all had about one or two bites left on our plate - not too little to eat, and not an over abundance or wasteful amount of food - just right.  I thought the brown rice we all ordered was nicely done!

The desserts were fair.  Not great, but not terrible.  I ordered the sticky rice and mango.  The mango was just right (not hard, and not complete mush).  My partner ordered the tapioca pudding with corn and another type of root (NOT SURE!).   Neither of us cared for it.  I think over half of it was left.  The fried bananas and the granita dessert were also ordered.  I think those two were the best of all.  The fried bananas weren't too heavy and the coconut ice cream that came with it was alright.  I thought the granita dish was very tasty!

Overall - Definitely worth checking out!
author: Jaden V.

description: Basil Thai successfully executes on creating a trendy, modern atmosphere.  The food is a little on the spendy side for Thai food, but both dishes my friend and I tried were really tasty.  We ordered the Basil's Eggplant (eggplant, tofu, shitake mushrooms, and scallions sauted with basil-chili puree) and the  Kang Gai (chicken & bamboo shoots in basil-red curry) as well as the requisite accompanying jasmine rice. Although both dishes were tasty, I thought the basil-red curry was the better of the two.
author: Matt P.

description: This food is good.  I really like it as far as Thai goes.  The decor is pretty sleek and cool.  My vodka and goose was stiff, but good.  I had a really nice date there but the service was lacking.  The drinks were good all night, which was nice becasue we were there for a while, the food was flavorful.  Nothing completely amazing, but definitely worth trying.
author: Rachel P.

description:
Had the spicy khee mao (sp?) - while it didnt look all that appetizing, it tasted delicious. One of the best khee mao's I've every had. Plus, shrimp chips!
Wine and beer we had were also good.
Overall, great experience, good food, good company, good atmosphere. 
Even when the 4 men clad in black leather / latex (one dragging another by a chain) rolled in. No one batted an eye.
author: Nick J.

description:
how many thai places can you eat at before it just all begins to mesh into one? does carry out vs eat in matter at some places?
i feel the same about much food i eat, theres rarely a time when i have a 'dining experience' rather than just a meal.

we hit up basil thai before a show at 1015 (yeah, i MIGHT have been with that guy below, what of it?) and we were greeted with a smile. reservations made earlier seemed to give us an awesome seat in the place. it was really just.. perfect.

the food was prepared quickly.. like REALLY quickly & the veggies were fresh, flavorful & bright. the typical and not so typical items on the menu intrigued me, and amazingly, were priced very well, for a place that looked so nice.
author: Gabby K.

description: I'm not usually a big fan of Thai food, but this place is pretty solid. The short rib and the curry chicken were both very tender and tasty. The price is very reasonable and the modern decor of the restaurant is great. It isn't crowded and loud which is also kind of nice.
author: jack c.

description: LOVE THIS PLACE! I just recently discovered Basil Thai and I've already been there 3 times in the past 2 months!  The service is awesome everytime I've went and the food is incredible!  I've already tried several different dishes from them, and have yet to find one that I don't like!  It has a small, yet warm and cozy environment!  I have to try their sister restaurant Basil Canteen.  Hopefully it will be the same!
author: Chloe G.

description: Went here again for a lunch meeting today with some construction colleagues and the food is as good as ever.  Service was great and everything tasted fantastic!  This place is a can't miss as far as I'm concerned.
author: Ron T.

description: This is my favorite Thai place in the city.  The food is just plain good.
author: Jason L.

description: Big fan of this place. Great food - I love the curry appetizer! It's a great place to take a group - the drinks are strong and the staff can handle the chaos that ensues with a party. The atmosphere isn't that great, but that's the beauty of a party - your friends are interesting and the drinks make them even more funny.
author: Heidi L.

description: Arrived on a Friday evening at 8pm.  Place was filled and there was a waiting list.  Being that I had to catch a movie with my friend, we sat at the bar.  Not so bad.  Service was good.  The food was very good.  Try the cubed beef dish and the corn fritter appetizer.  The tom yum goong soup was very very good.  I'm not a spicy food fan, but this had the right amount of "heat" to keep me from downing a gallon of water.  Overall very tasty.  Would definitely go back.
author: Christopher C.

description: Basil Thai - where the curry flows like wine..  I love Basil Thai.  If I lived closer I would partake in takeout quite a bit.  The service is great and the food fresh.  The decor is nice to boot!  What more can you ask for in an American style Thai restaurant?  Side note: The long islands have been especially tasty during my visits.. at least the first two. :)
author: Robin S.

description: This is a good restaurant, but really, you're paying for the decor as much as you are the food. Don't get me wrong--the food was good. I danced in my seat several times. But I really would recommend it not for Thai food specifically, but if you want to go "out" to dinner and feel like, or can only agree upon, Thai. It's, like, a solid place for a nice evening out. Not a destination, really. If you're really hankering for Thai, there's cheaper AND better.
author: SheRat R.

description: Yummy yummy! Haven't eaten here in a while but when I lived in the neighborhood it was one of my favorites! Service was good, food was good, menu a little typical but nonetheless appetizing.
author: Stephanie J.

description: Basil serves up an excellent pad ke mao with a perfect balance of flavors and heat. The noodles and beef exhibited the caramelization and oh-so-slight charing that indicate excellent wok technique, and the whole sprigs of fresh basil were a great addition. I'm definitely looking forward to trying the red curry with lamb.
author: Will A.

description: The green curry with beef and eggplant was to die for!!!   So so good.  Making me look forward to my trip to Thailand next week!
author: Chaz N.

description: As a creature of habit, I've come here often and I find myself always getting the same tried and true short ribs and their peanut sauce something.  (I'll update later with the correct name.)...  because if it aint broke...
author: Michelle C.

description: Very nice Thai destination in the city before heading out! The food is definitely good and the ambiance is cool! I always share a bottle of wime with my dinner here as they have a nice selection. I tend to order a variety of the appetizers and most suprised my palatte with great flavors.
author: Chris A.

description: I rarely go into a restaurant, look at the menu, and go "I want to try EVERYTHING!" Since that is both physically and financially impossible, we went with the scallop and prawn satay skewers, the Basil's eggplant and Basil's lamb--hey, we figured anything "Basil's" would be good for beginners. Fantastic flavor all around. Fat Tire on tap (the greatest beer on tap ever, by the way).
author: Maximillian M.

description: A nice tasty Thai place. I recommend the Basil Eggplant.
author: Jerry S.

description: moving to a new neighborhood has its challenges. Moving into a new house and ripping out the kitchen provides even more. Luckily we found Basil right away and it has not let us down yet. I have tried several of the stir fry dishes with the crispy pork and spicy chicken dishes proving to be my favorites. I typically don't like Thai cuisine because coconut milk cause some stomach insecurities. Lucky for me the stir fry options are the cure and they even substitute tofu for the meats for my veggie wife. Yay Basil.
author: Kennan S.

description: I love Thai food! Especially when the service is great, and the prices are right. The workers here are on top of everything, so if you're in a rush to catch a movie at the metreon, or you're on a hot date and have time to kill, this is the place! The food is not only good in my opinion, they have a great Zagat rating! Check them out if you find yourself in the SOMA.
author: Garrett B.

description:
I eat here pretty frequently(once a week), and I can say without hesitation that I've never had a bad meal here. Whether I eat there or take it away, I am always stuffed and satisfied.
5 stars for full bar.
5 stars for great staff; really nice and sweet people.
5 stars for consistency.
Lamb curry - love it.
Calamari app. - eat it like chips
Skewers - addictive peanut sauce
Green seafood curry is really good
Would love for them to add new things to the menu; maybe some more care with the desserts.
author: Sam K.

description: I've been here for a  couple of times.  My favorite and the only dish that I order every time is  the basil clam noodle.  Great taste and the only thing that i would recommend the restaurant is to give a little bit more portion.
author: YELP U.

description: This is a nice restaurant for an area between Potrero hill and Downtown, which is virtually devoid of nice places to eat. The food is solidly good and reasonably priced. The services is fast and efficient. I've been there for lunch and dinner multiple times and it hasn't disappointed.
author: Katerina B.

description: Best Thai food possibly on the planet!!!  Love it!  Try the kang talay!!  It's their best curry!!
author: Jordan P.

description: I go often to Basil Thai and i love it. I mostly order the curries which are good and flavored. Prices are great for the food quality, and wines are good as well. In addition the atmosphere is warm and the decoration is well designed,  I am very sensitive to this aspect of the dining experience.
author: Ubergizmo G.

description: This is a great place to grab a quick bite and a lovely space, but if you want to linger over dinner you might get a few looks from the staff. I normally opt for take out, enjoying the delicious Pad Ke Mao at home.
author: Kate O.

description: This is hands down the best thai food I have ever had, and the fact that is has such a laid back feel makes me love it even more!
author: Lisa K.

description: Ive only had a veggie curry dish here but it is delicious. Up until last weekend I hadnt been in awhile and things havent changed a bit. They are always willing to make something special for you and your special needs. Lots of vegitarian options.
author: Misty D.

description: I am so glad I live around the corner from this wonderful place!  The ambience is great and the food is lovely.  Its a four star restaurant for a 2 star price.  I go with my girl for $40 including tip.
author: Matt N.

description: This place is by far my favorite Thai place to go to! If I didn't love the goong gra bog, the long beans and scallops and the chicken with yellow curry so much, I'd tell you about something else on the menu. This food goes really well with Conundrum wine too! BTW, this place really deserves 5 stars, but I realized that I've already given like every place but PETCO 5 stars, so I gave it 4.
author: John S.

description: This place is a great restaurant. The food is well cook. They really know what they are doing back there. My favorites are the Pad Thai and the Duck soup for lunch. The food is well seasoned and the meats are cooked to perfection. Attentive staff, clean, simple, and relaxing ambiance. One of my favorite restaurants.
author: Cat B.

description: I lunch here often and the food is reliably good. My favorites are the kao pode tod (corn fritters), pad ke mao (wide rice noodles & beef) and pak rad kang (vegetable green curry). If you like very spicy food try the green papaya salad.
author: Angela K.

description: We went there for a birthday party with 10 people.  The service was wonderful and they had multiple waiters serving and clearing the tables instead of just one.  The food is of course somewhat Americanized Thai food, but great none the less.  I had the curry chicken which was great, not too spicy.  The menu is well priced, the entrees are around $10-12.  Great prices and great atmosphere.
author: Rei and Rick ..

description: If you want traditional Thai food, go somewhere else. If you are looking for fushionish food in a nice, designy atmosphere, with a great service and not a $$$$ bill (neither a $) that's  definitely your place
author: Alex A.

description: For a Thai Fusion place, I'd say it ranks pretty high... almost as good as the new Osha.  They're always very nice there, and I haven't tasted something there that I didn't enjoy.  They are also very accommodating for large groups, and offer a pre-fix menu.  For a party of about 30 people, it ran roughly $30 per person.  This is a nice place to bring a date... not TOO fancy yet not too casual, nice trendy atmosphere, and not too loud so you don't have to shout at each other.
author: Mikolo R.

description: I liked the food here and felt comfy in the not too over the top decor. Way better than the other Thai food place near us (Cha am) so we are happy. The portions are small for what you pay but it is very tasty.
author: Julie D.

description: Had dinner here last night for the first time and really enjoyed it. We had the panstickers, spring rolls, duck, skirt steak and pad se ew. We enjoyed the ambiance and food was surprisingly good. I'm only giving it 3 stars because the price was a bit higher than other Thai restaurants and the portions were small.
author: Laura B.

description: My party of 3 was told 10-15 minutes wait for a table.  After 25 minutes of waiting and noticing that several other parties were sat before us that had 4 or 4+ people (pulling together several 2 tops to make a few 4 tops) and they had clearly arrived after us and had inquired about seating without a reservation, we inquired about our place on the list.  Perhaps since one in our party was "festively but tastefully" dressed for the Dore event that weekend , perhaps we were overlooked.  In the end, we got a vague excuse and were told the party at our table was about to pay their bill and leave.  Funny, they had just been served as the hostess provided that lame excuse.  No thank you and never again.
author: M K.

description:
I've been lunching at Basil Thai for several years, and the quality has always been good. This review is specifically for a lunch combo meal I just had: kang kua gai, a tangy red curry of sliced chicken breast and pumpkin, and the tamarind prawns. The prawns were quite disappointing. The tamarind prawns tasted like sweet-n-sour shrimp, only with no sour = way too sweet. I couldn't detect any tamarind flavor at all.

However, the pumpkin and chicken red curry was absolutely delicious: mild, flavorful, and inventive. Leftovers were still delicious the next day. The fresh (non-fried) rolls and the fried spring rolls are also delicious. I've also enjoyed the turnip cake on other visits. It reminds of the daikon cake at Tung Kee noodle house in San Jose, only more expensive, but you don't have to drive to San Jose for it. And Basil's Eggplant is the favorite choice of many a colleague.
author: Shimi R.

description:
Thai restaurants are a dime a dozen in the city but this one is tops. 

Scored tickets for Wicked via the lottery so with some time to kill, yelp iphone app led us to Basil Thai.  Any Thai restaurant, fusion or authentic has got to get two dishes right, Tom Kai Gai and Pad Thai.  They were definitely spot on.  The Tom Kai Gai had a good balance of lime and coconut.  Lots of chicken..wished there were a bit more mushrooms.  Pad Thai was sweet and the shrimp was fresh, not rubbery.  I usually blow past this place onto and off the freeway but definitely have to go back.
author: John C.

description: Excellent Thai food! They have high quality meet and flavorful food. The Grilled Indian bread with eggplant,  papaya salad, skirt steak, crunchy bean cakes, and kang talay are all SO good! Yum!
author: Nicole F.

description: The lunch specials are very affordable and tasty. Decent service and surroundings. Worth a try.
author: Tim K.

description: Tasty thai food served in a slightly modern setting. Nice to go for dinner with a group. Mojitos are terrible.
author: Mitali D.

description: The food's really good and only a buck or two more than other Thai places but the ambience and the decor makes it feel very chi-chi and fancy.  A great, reasonably priced way to impress guests.
author: Frankie D.

description: We were over at City Beer and decided to give this place a go. Very reasonable, tasty food and a nice selction at the bar. The eggplant entree was amazing and the pad kee moa was good too. Oh yeah, the spring rolls were tasty too.
author: Chris G.

description: Since moving to SOMA, Basil has become one of my regular places to eat - thank the gods there's awesome Thai in the hood.  There is a lot to choose from which I think is great - and it's nicely presented on the the menu.  From their seafood dishes, curries and apps - you can't go wrong.  There'll be something there for you to die for.  Mine - get the Fire Squid.
author: Tiberius A.

description: This place is great. The service is attentive and very friendly. The food is amazing, and the price is more than fair. You must try the catfish and the stuffed eggplant. The food is a bit americanized, which isnt a bad thing at all, just be sure your expectations are aware of this before hand.
author: josh b.

description: Went there with friends to celebrate my birthday.  The food was okay, but the service was a bit slow and not very well paced.  After we had the appetizers, we waited quite a while for the entrees.  There were big gaps between serving time, so some dishes came after people have finished eating.
author: Mindy C.

description: Although fairly flavorful, I found the food here, particularly the chicken, inconsistent.  We started with chicken satay which I couldn't get myself to finish.  Although the sauce and flavoring were tasty, the chicken had a rubbery texture that kinda turned my stomach.  My bf, however, had no problem eating it.  We substituted the prawns in the Pad Thai for chicken.  Here the chicken was overcooked as it was in the gai ma-muang. The param rungsong was really tasty.
author: Jeff P.

description: Great service, nice surroundings, but shouldn't thai food have more flavor?  I am still looking for my go to Thai restaurant in San Francisco.
author: Tom F.

description:
This place deserves 4.5 Stars really...

Basil was brightly lit, well decorated and clean; a pleasure to eat in. Great fast service, but the place was curiously empty when we went. Not all menu items are authentic Thai, so be careful ordering. The seafood salad was tangy & spicy, and the Angus steak curry was mouthwatering! Prices are a bit more expensive than usual, but the food is delicious.
author: M. W.

description: 4 pieces of tofu does not constitute tofu Pad Thai. Nor does 3 corn fritters serve as an appetizer for four people (at $6.75 a plate). However, the decor was appealing (very SOMA - chic yet relaxed) and the staff showed above average courtesy. I wouldn't mind going back.
author: Rachel K.

description: Basil has great presentation and environment. The food is pretty average thai quality. The tastes are standard and so are the menu options.
author: George M.

description: I love coming to this place!  The restaurant is very clean/modern and the service is wonderful.  For lunch I love eating their dumpling noodle soup and sipping on a glass of Thai ice tea.
author: JenJen W.

description:
SOOO GOOD!

I ate here with my friend after reading yelp reviews, and I really liked this place.  It is small with modern decor.   We did have to wait about 20 mins to be seated but it was worth it.  The food was perfectly cooked and seasoned appropriately.  The waitress was nice, and the mojito I ordered was awesome!
author: unknown u.

description: Great restaurant to bring friends and family. The dishes are really great. The green curry was just delightful. Great service.
author: Jamie E.

description:
i just ate lunch here - it was excellent.  

The service: was okay - not as prompt as I usually prefer.  They also did not bring the food out in quite the order that is most preferable either - they brought the spring rolls only 5 minutes before bringing my main course - but not my friend's main course.  it always is awkward when someone's food comes out much sooner than the other person - and there were really not too many people in the restaurant - so orders were not exactly rushed.  

The flavor:  5/5!! I'm a huge thai fan.  went to the thailand and ate their local flavor for about a month straight - these guys are right on the money.  the spring rolls were delicious - had an extra something in there - maybe a shitake mushroom or something - but it was just delicious.  I also that their version of Tom Yum - flavor was excellent (huge bowl) - noodles were too slippery though.  I'll be back here very soon.  

Ambiance: I LOVE the space.  it used to be a fancier lounge bar/restaurant - thank got they changed it - by putting in a long table that shared among guests - it really transforms this otherwise modern cold lofty space into a comfortable friendly setting.
author: Megan M.

description: Good wine selection, strong cocktails, and the food was great, so was the service. I'd go back...
author: F E.

description: Food is great here with price is totally reasonable. The service is nice too. You definitely at least need try once.
author: Qing L.

description: Love it, great food and service with a reasonable prices. thump up
author: sweetie p.

description: I've been here a couple of times.  The food is fantastic.  Not too many vegetarian dishes on the menu, but they have always accommodated me when I've requested something special.  Prices are pretty reasonable.  Drinks are stiff.  What's not to love?!
author: Meredyth H.

description: Nice casual place with tasty food and stylish presentation.
author: jessica a.

description:
me and my friend went there with my friend's recommendation. 
nice and cozy environment, a decent dining place
we order tom yum goong soup, minced chicken stir-fried with basil and eggplant, and roast duck red curry
soup is ok, too sweet and not that authentic
the two dishes are very nice, though i think they are a little bit too sweet in flavor, but the roast duck here tastes really good! 
minced chicken stir-fried is my all-time favorite Thai dish, here it's nice with touch of spiciness (we ordered spicy one, and we can really eat spicy food). 
the two dishes are good with rice, the portion is surprisingly ok as we're big eaters. 

service is just alright, but one of the waiters was really polite though. 

this restaurant is more like a fusion/westernized one. for Thai food, here is a little bit costly.
author: Florence C.

description: I really liked this place.  Those veggies eggrolls (whatever the Thai word really is please insert here).  The staff was busy as was this restaurant which had a small wait at 8 on a Wednesday night.
author: Jere C.

description: Stopped in last night and enjoyed sitting with my beloved in the two-person front window. She enjoyed a glass of the rose and I a Singha.  We started with the satay chicken sticks before moving on to the Fire Calamari (a bit of heat) and one of the spicy chicken salads.  Despite sitting up the front the staff were attentive and kept checking in. I think next time we'll try sitting further down to check out the rest of the place. The food however was great and guaranteed we will be back!
author: Nigel G.

description: Tasty Thai dishes, quiet/casual atmosphere, good service...all around a great spot.
author: A D.

description:
We love this place.  We've been going there at least once a month for about 3 years now.  I have them on my speed dial.  The staff are super nice.  The presentation is great.  The menu is simple.... pretty original Thai with a twist.  The food is great, not greasy, and not overly-tasty or overpowering (like some Thai restaurant that try really hard to be authentic).  A lot of Thai places that people rave about make their food really sweet - we don't do that in Thailand.  For me, unless you're in Thailand, you're never gonna get "real" Thai food.  Basil's got the best of both World.

Basil is my most favorite restaurant ever!
author: T. J.

description:
Finally, a decent Thai establishment!  I live in SoMA, so I'm happy to find a yummy Thai place that is not too far away.  The prices are right, you can always get a table, and the decor is easy, comfortable modern.  The wait staff was courteous and friendly.  

I had the rice paper wrapped shrimp appetizer, which for the price I think was a steal.  Six small fried shrimp with a spicy sweet dipping sauce was the perfect answer to a craving for something fried, but not too heavy.  For the entree, I got pad see wu (sp?) - typical American-friendly rice noodle dish.  It was less greasy and salty than the same dish at Osha (and thankfully without the cheesy, and I mean cheesy, Marina crowd).

It's a great option for dinner when you want to stay in the neighborhood.  An elegent, yet casual neighborhood joint.
author: Sarah C.

description:
I am a local SOMA resident that LOVES my Thai!  I go to Koh samui and gran pu bah (forgive the spelling) both great restaurants.  Someone said to try Basil and my boyfriend and I went last night and we were very let down.
The potstickers were WAY over fried and greasy.
The naan with eggplant was also grossly fried and undercooked, to top it off we got the beef curry and it was like eating tough beef jerkey floating in coconut milk.
Needless to say.....won't be back.  Cool looking bar though.
author: Stella W.

description: Great experience at Basil Thai.  Got a table for 5 people on Saturday evening quickly.  The saketini is not too sweet, but the lychee and sake weren't mixed evenly - at least the lychee seemed fresh.  Mango drink was good too.  Ordered the crab fried rice, steak noodles, duck green curry, catfish, and skirt steak.  All really good!  The value for money was great.
author: Sandeep D.

description: While it may not be my favorite thai shop in the city (a very close #2), it is definitely the tastiest and a great white table cloth spot if you're looking for something nicer.  Everyone I have taken here has loved it... so kudos to the chefs.
author: Victory V.

description: not too good for veggies. They have like 3 veggie dishes all of which feature fried tomatoes and/or eggplant as the main ingredient. I was looking for more of a hearty mixed variety like broccoli, carrots, anything else but then thats not the worst part. They put hella mushrooms in the curry when I told them not to put any, and a chunk of chicken randomly found its way in as well... PLUS they mixed in the prawns with the pad thai when I asked for them on the side. When I told the server he was mildly apologetic, but didnt comp us or fix it or anything. Screw that place! Way too many other on point veggie friendly Thai restruants in this city to ever go back. But if youre a yuppie douche bag you just might like it!
author: Peter B.

description:
Ok so I've been to this place about 7 or 8 times and the flavor of the food, wine and ambiance has never let me down once. The food is consistently superb, the wait staff is very attentive, but alas, I can only give it 4 stars, since on our way out, when our server didn't see our tip, he followed after us when we left, we were already 2 blocks away and our server actually asked the two of us for a tip. 

BAD FORM, DUDE.

So, I guess if you're going to go, don't stiff the wait staff. They'll come after you!

BTW, the pictures on YELP are horrible for this restaurant. I'm a food photographer, so if there's an opportunity to show the world what you're all about, Basil, I'm your gal!
author: Amber T.

description: this is the best thai food i've had outside of thailand. i may not be thai, but i lived there for 3 months so i get some credit. their red duck curry is simply spectacular. honestly. it's creamy and yummy and filling and the duck skin is nice and crispy and and i want to marry it. it's that good. they have a decent wine list too. everything else i've ever had there (as in i go with other people, they order other things, i taste them, they are tasty, but everyone's in love with my duck curry) is good. but duck curry = outstanding. yum. eat it.
author: pepper e.

description: I was introduced to this place by a friend and it has now become a tradition when she visits from England. I look forward to her visits. This place is simply decorated with a warm feeling, and for the price the food is superb. The service can sometimes be slow, but if you are not in a rush it can give you time to catch up. For dates, or girly dinners this place works for all occasions in my opinion at least.
author: Michelle C.

description: Went here after an SF Wine Week event across the street. We were one of the only people in there with a group of 7. We sat at the long table in the front. Every dish ordered was fantastic, service was excellent, and they tolerated our rowdy antics. I had the monkfish with noodles which was new for me and tasty. I really liked the beef red curry with ramen-like noodles my friend ordered. It was spciy, flavorful, rich, in short, very delicious. I definitely will go back when I am in the area and the space it inhabits where the Public used to be is awesome--exposed brick, upper level dining area, nice bar for waiting for your table.
author: Snora E.

description: Ah, prawns are delicious when cooked well and Basil does them up just right. There is a variety of delicious menu options. I can't wait to go back again so I can try some other things. I'm so happy to have moved to SOMA this month. Basil will be my new hangout. It's very reasonable. When I saw the sign outside and walked up to the door, I thought it was going to be a pricier place.  But, it's actually not. The decor is modern, clean and comfortable--even if you don't happen to sit along the booth wall. Oh, and I forget what beers they had on tap, but I had a Stella. (I'm a draft beer fan over bottled beer any day of the week.)  You will be kicking yourself if you don't check out Basil. It's delicious from all angles. Plus, even the name is cool.  Who doesn't like a little basil every now and again?
author: Dawn L.

description: I have this thing for ambiance. Sometimes you can feed me something really forgettable but I will keep coming back to bask in your warm red lighting or enjoy your shiny, comfy booth (i.e. Absinthe)... I think that's why I like Basil so much.  The food is very good and has always tasted FRESH- but the restaurant is sleek and not cramped. I have taken several out-of-towners here and had lovely, lingering meals with excellent service.
author: jen m.

description: Very consistent. I usually get take out and order the panstickers and larb gai.  Never disappoints.  They do a booming business for lunch.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: Bossa Nova was the intended destination, but with an hour wait despite a few empty tables, we moved on (no worries bossa, I still five star love you). Ended up at Basil instead, and thought it was pretty good. Service was quick, very reasonably priced, and most importantly, the eats, were delicious. Chicken skewers and chicken pumpkin curry were spot on.
author: Jason B.

description: I was disappointed with the service at Basil. They forgot one of our dishes and we couldn't get any to even pay attention to us to get it. when we finally did get someone we had to ask twice before we got it. It was disappointing because the food was excellent. Maybe it was just a bad day to go. I would go back just because the food was so good I just won't except as much next time.
author: Travis V.

description: We were on our way to eat at Rocco's and decided to come here instead. The food was wonderful. The roti w/ eggplant was delicious. The roasted 1/2 chicken was ok....would order other dishes instead. We loved the ground chicken w/ eggplant. We will come back
author: Hannah K.

description: This place is amazing!  I have been here twice and I am so glad that I moved in directly across the street from it!  The appetizers are amazing, fried calamari and eggrolls were delicious along with the rice cracker things that are always complimentary.  Their thai iced tea is amazing as well!  My favorite dish that I have had their is the lamb, which was quite possibly the best entree I have ever had, (make sure to get it with rice!).  The service here is very good too, the food comes fast if you dont get appetizers and it comes perfectly when you finish your appetizers.  The waiters/waitresses are all friendly.  I would recomend this to anyone looking for a good meal.  This would also be a good place to take your girlfriend!
author: Bobby G.

description: I had heard a lot about this place and I was not disappointed: great food at great prices in a nice location.
author: Laurent C.

description: I had dinner there last Friday evening and I thought it was great.  I always order larb and when they served it with chopped steak, as opposed to ground beef, I thought it was a great touch.
author: John c.

description:
It's nice to have a Thai restaurant where you don't smell the grease. (from the tablecloth or whatever). 

We ordered Pad Thai and Red Curry w/ Chicken and they were both great. I wasn't sooo impressed by the Calamari, probably I had too high expectation.
author: Amy C.

description: This place is great, quality food at reasonable prices. EK provided some of the best customer service I have seen in years..
author: Brendan R.

description: this place is solid. all of the food is good. the atmosphere is great, very friendly, cozy, clean, modern look. the presentation of the dishes is also more impressive than you usually get at a thai place. this is my go-to thai restaurant in SF. i don't think anyone would be disappointed here.
author: Geoff B.

description: Basil is yet another "upscale and trendy" Thai restaurant in SOMA (others of this caliber include Koh Samui and the Monkey as well as Lingba Lounge). On a Tuesday around 12:30, the place is already quite busy, filled with business-y looking people discussing very important deals over curry and spring rolls. Our friendly hostess seated us at a table in the back and we decided on my two gold standards for assessing the quality of a Thai restaurant: pad see ew and curry- this particular dish being of the pumpkin variety (since I am a die hard fan of anything containing pumpkin). We also shared an order of fresh vegetarian spring rolls as an appetizer. The food arrived quickly at which point the spring rolls quickly disappeared. These fresh tofu, lettuce, mint, and bean thread noodle filled treats are wrapped in rice paper and served with a mildly sweet sauce laced with chopped peanuts- very similar to Vietnamese spring rolls, but without the basil (surprisingly so, according to the restaurant's name). The two other dishes were also quite good, although Hywel pointed out that the pumpkin curry did not have enough pumpkin- and I concur. If the dish advertised as pumpkin curry, one would expect the pumpkin to star- however I was disappointed to find much more chicken and pepper than squash. The red curry coconut sauce however, was delicious. The pad see ew, with chicken, egg, and broccoli passed my pad see ew approval, but I cannot give it as high a rating as the pad see ew at Little Thai, since the noodles were not quite as buttery. Overall though, Basil Thai offers a pleasant and modern thai dining experience, and if you happen to be in the area, I'd recommend paying a visit.
author: Kate A.

description: My office eats here consistently for lunch, and it is delicious.  The lamb curry, the keow wan neur (apolgoies if my spelling isn't up to snuff), and the short ribs get consistently rave reivews.  Generous portions, really good quality meat, very affordable for what you get.  Easily the best food I've had in the Tenderloin, and a legitimate condender for the best thai food in its price range in the bay area.  My only complaint is the lack of free refills on sodas.  In this modern era, I think we should be able to expect more.
author: Matt M.

description: yummy and classy. plus they were really awesome with our big 12-person order packing it in boxes and giving us extras and helping me double check the order. plus my friends love it and go here regularly.
author: lisa w.

description: i was first introduced to this place by my wife, for she used to work there and her sister used to cook there.  as far as thai food goes, this place probably was the best i've ever had.  pick one pick em all, the food is that good.  the drinks and water are always filled, servers are always friendly and constantly check up on you, but not to the point it's bothersome.  i love the contemporary interior.  this place is a little hard to see when you're driving on busy folsom street.  street parking is abundant, i've never had a problem.
author: will m.

description: This is one of my ultimate favorite restaurants in the city - every entree i've had here is DELICIOUS and the prices are pretty reasonable - my favorite dishes include the short ribs curry, the eggplant wrapped chicken (and i usually don't like eggplant), the flat-iron steak, and the chicken/stringbeans/basil dish - i've never had a long wait for dinner (on the weekends even) and the atmopshere is really nice - would recommend this to anyone!
author: Kylene S.

description: Had lunch there today with a group of people.  Everything was delicious. The only item I'd probably not get again would be saty. The sauce was very tasty, but often meat can be dry.  The lemongrass/coconut soup - outstanding, veg egg rolls - delicious, grilled meat salad - yum, calamari salad, very tasty, great pad thai and we had dessert - again, outstanding.  I've been here in the past and had forgotten how good the food is.  It's also reasonably priced.  I highly recommend eating at this restaurant.
author: Eleanor L.

description: Oh so deliciously good.  Ask for their specialties and you will be in thai heaven.
author: Casey J.

description: Great neighborhood eatery. I suggest it for dinner about 2-3 times a week in hopes that my husband will agree with me (which he does 40% of the time if we're not making dinner at home) ... so the way I see it, if I suggest it more often then the likelihood we'll actually have Basil for dinner will increase. Hmmm ...
author: Kat T.

description: The food is excellent and I liked the presentation on everything.  The space is open and not crowded and you can hear conversations and the like perfectly well and not strain nor do you hear your neighbors although that can be fun!
author: Misti L.

description: This place is has fabulous food.  Not your average Thai restaurant menu.  Much more sophisticated and upscale but with decent prices.  Good service, sleek surroundings.
author: Frank Q.

description: I'm going to give you guys a little bit of history about this place. About 22 years ago, this place was a run down warehouse which was later taken over by someone who transformed it into an Ital in Restaurant which was actually pretty successful. The closed about 15 years ago and I believe that they were taken over by a couple of other people before it became Basil's. The place looks pretty much the same as it used to with the exception of the bar which used to be a counter where you could watch the cooks make your food as well as the back wall is gone and now they have big black curtains. They also didn't have that wall to the left where it is all wooden with benches. Anyway, enough about that and now on to the food! The food is pretty good although expensive for what you actually get. It isn't in any way Superior over other Thai places that charge less. Now I don't mind paying more for better food, service, etc...unfortunately this place doesn't warrant the prices that they charge. The only reason I would go back is purely for some of the great memories that I had when it used to be Milano Joe's!
author: Diane M.

description: my favorite thai place in the city.  the decor is sleek and contemporary, yet comfortable.  the food is excellent, flavorful, with fresh ingredients and cooked just right.  parking is usually abundant and have never had to wait for a table - a real bonus for such great food.
author: Vic A.

description: We moved here from NYC so were very picky about our thai food.... Basil Thai is AWESOME, yummy, authentic, and reasonably priced. Highly recommend the larb w chicken... it is absolutely the best dish ever!!!
author: M S.

description: i've been here a few times for big birthday dinners.  the food was good but the memorable part was the great service.  the restaurant in fairly narrow and even though there were usually 20+ intoxicated individuals getting up, going outside, crawling under the table, going to the bathroom and then sitting in the wrong place repeatedly throughout the night, the staff was pleasant and efficient.
author: Seong P.

description: i hadn't dined here in years, but last night, i got take out from here, since it is down the street.  at around 9, i called and they told me my order would be ready in 15-20 minutes for pick up.  not bad.  i got the veggie pad thai, green curry, and green papaya salad w/ a side of rice.  the total came out to $32.  this fed 3 ppl w/ some leftovers to spare, so i would say it was a pretty good deal.
author: Helen T.

description: nicer than average thai place with good food.  i prefer the food at marnee in the sunset, but basil is bigger and has  stylish sleek and modern decor.  it's a great place to go with a large group and share family style.
author: Roshni R.

description: The place is pretty, but while I was eating last night I couldn't stop staring at the television they had over the bar, and it was flashing this sports show about what happens to players' bodies when they make impact with each other. There was all this CGI stuff of brains filling up with liquid. It didn't put me off my food or anything, but the food itself fell a little flat anyway, so I ended up giving everything away to the other diners. I don't recommend the green papaya salad or the fish cakes (the oil tasted rancid in the papaya dressing, though I was told that it was just the fish flavoring, and the fish cakes were a gummy, chewy texture and there were no yard-long green beans on the plate because they'd been pureed and put in the cakes). Because it's just down the street from my boyfriend's house I am willing to try a third time, but I'll pay attention to the other yelpers' specific food recommendations next time.
author: Andrea D.

description: Didn't know where we were going to eat dinner so we decided to go to Basil on a suggestion from Yelp. 4 stars can't be wrong, right? When you get to the front door, the usual suspects are in the window. A framed Zagat Survey article, a People Love Us on Yelp sticker and your accepted credit card sticker. When you walk in, you'll notice the seating, but your keen eye may also see the full bar. Anyway, the service that we had was pretty good. The waiter was not all that helpful for suggestions, but getting us our food and taking our order was done just fine. For the food, we got a soup (don't know the name but had coconut milk in it). Then we had a chicken curry, beef thing and vermicelli with prawns. The food was pretty good For drinks we had the coconut flavoured sake. It was pretty good and unfiltered. And for you sake novices, you sip sake, not shoot it (that's what I did for my first one). Anyhow, this was good and might be worth going to again if in the area. That said, this was the first time that I was in the area in the 4+ years that I've lived in the bay area.
author: Andrew Y.

description: A step above any Thai restaurant I have ever been to.  Huge menu, very good prices and have liked everything I have tried on the menu.  I will always visit this restaurant on my trips to San Francisco.
author: Gus L.

description: Favorite Thai place in the city.  More upscale and fun environment and the food is awesome.
author: Callie C.

description: The food here is very good, and the service is exceptional.  It seems more of an upscale type of thai place, which is a nice treat now and then (and for visitors).  Only two complaints...  the portions are on the small side, and the tables are very close together.  Unless the place is not busy, it's not the place for romantic chit chat.
author: Shep S.

description: Tom ka gai soup is among the best in the city.  Great dishes - come w/ a group so you get to sample lots of dishes.
author: WP D.

description: love this place!  basil has been around for years and is always a sure bet for a cute place with quality food at a very reasonable price. the food is not that different from the usual thai fare but it is always consistent. i have even been there with big groups and they have always been able to accommodate us.
author: pancakegirl l.

description: tasty thai food in a trendy SOMA restaurant atmosphere with trendy SOMA price increases. being thai food, even when it's expensive in a relative sense, it doesn't really hurt your wallet.
author: Clover Dan ..

description: One of the best Thai restaurants in the City.  The best one I know of anyway.  Food is light, healthy and extremely delicious.  The Tom Yum Gai soup is my barometer for a good Thai restaurant, and this one knocks it out of the park.  Best Tom Yum Gai I've every had.  Every other dish I've had has been stupendous.  The ingredients are really fresh and prepared to perfection.  I used to be addicted to Marnee Thai out in the Sunset, but Basil is my new favorite.  If you like Thai, you owe it to yourself  to check out Basil.
author: Sienna L.

description: wowowowowowow.  yumyumyumyum.  get in my belly!!!  stuffed eggplant and brown rice.  enough.said.
author: Jon K.

description: i've eaten here / ordered take away from basil thai 50+ times over the last 2.5 years. need i say more?
author: jon w.

description: Great average thai restaurant. Food is good, service is good, ambiance is clean. Not spectacular in any way but its priced right and is definitely a place to go back to. The lunch combos are great to share.
author: Ivan B.

description: I am unbelievably lucky that my BFF lives right aroud the corner.  The food is absolutely amazing.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Such a great little Thai place.  Pretty authentic I think.  Nice, friendly people.  And good location.
author: James B.

description: They only have a few veggie options, but they are good. You can feel the freshness in the food. Would recommend to other people.
author: Kuldeep T.

description: Very very good thai place, service was great as well as food. Best ratio quality/price in SF for a thai restaurant by far
author: laurent i.

description: just had some friends in town and they were looking for quality thai. i read some reviews and suggested basil thai. we had great service and everyone really enjoyed their food. i had the stuffed eggplant -- which our waiter mentioned was his favorite -- and it is now mine too. my friends also really enjoyed their food. would go back again in a heartbeat.
author: James P.

description: I had a salsa dance class nearby and I love thai food so I came to this place that i found on yelp.  It is not an authentic thai place, more a fusion.  The environment is very classy and it looked like a pricey restaurant but it was not at all!!  Our bill came out and it was less than 40$.  We ordered the keow wan roti ( grilled Indian bread with green curry and oriental eggplant) as an appetizer and it was so delicious.  Then we had the param rungsong (grilled marinated skirt steak topped with peanut sauce) and the curry peppercorn duck.  The portions are big compare to other places and we had to bring back the left overs.  The green curry in both the appetizer and the duck was so good I could of lick it off my plate.  Also, I love the thai basil in each of the plates, it gives such a fine and subtle taste.   As for the steak, it was really tender but I wasn't a fan of the peanut sauce... too strong for me.   Overall, I love this place and will definitely come back to try the numerous choices on the menu.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Amazing fried egg rolls. Not so amazing service. But in general, this place is pretty cheap for how good it is.
author: Lindsay B.

description: Great Thai food in SOMA.  Within reasonable walking distance to BART.
author: Tom R.

description: The food is good and the place is very clean, but I do not think it can be ranked for 5 stars, so I think the 4 stars is the right choice. And also thanks Yelp, I think it is a very good place.
author: Jacy G.

description: One of my favorite, most reliable eateries in the City.  I've eaten at Basil with friends from all over the world, and it has never once disappointed - never less than delighted.  Mmm mmm good!
author: Michael J.

description: This is the cutest place! Friendly service, great atmosphere, and delicious food!!!
author: Gracie C.

description: This is a fantastic Thai restaurant! My favorite in the city. The food is excellent. I can never get enough of the krispy chicken and green beans. Excellent curry. The only downside is the dining room is pretty small so sometimes you have to wait awhile to get a table and it gets pretty loud inside when there is a full house. The service and food are worth it though!
author: Red R.

description: used to be a cab ride away from the old crib....great spot with good music....check out their Gai Yang and Tom Yum Gai!
author: Brock H.

description: My husband and I went with another couple to this restaurant before seeing Wicked.  We were a little pressed for time, and fortuitously they were as well because a larger reservation that was due to come in around 7:30 pm.  The service was efficient and friendly.  I thought our waiter provided some great recommendations from the menu and did not encourage us to over order which can sometimes happen when you ask a waiter for advice on ordering family style.  The food was very tasty.  Definitely pleased.  I particularly enjoyed the calamari - lightly fried and tasted fresh, the eggplant curry dish (eggplant is stuffed with chicken) - yummy, and the salt & pepper duck curry dish. Ah and the spare ribs were extremely tender and well seasoned.  Yes, overall a great experience.  If I had to add a drawback, perhaps it would be that the portions can be tricky to share among 4 persons - they were a little small.
author: Jacqueline A.

description: your average upscale thai restaurant.  nothing special about the place, the decor is nicer than most thai places, but the food is the same as any hole in the wall thai restaurant you find at EVERY corner of sf.
author: kunal p.

description: this is one of my favorite thai spots in the city. i went there on my 1st date with my husband back in 2005 and have loved it every since. we finally ventured out the other day and got the beef cubs and the chicken and cashews and it was sooo good! we normally get pad thai, which has a good amount of shrimp, and pork fried rice which is loaded with veggies. the only thing about the pfr is that if you love cherry tomatoes as much as I do you might want to ask for extra when ordering. you also can not go to this spot w/o an order of curry puffs!
author: rachel d.

description: the food was fresh, and the mojitos were delish!  i was with a group and everyone liked their dish.  i just gotta knock it one star because we had to wait 20 minutes even though i made reservations.  otherwise, i'm definitely coming back!
author: noone n.
